```
            ‚îÇ                          ‚îÇ                          ‚îÇ
            ‚îÇ 100% Sink                ‚îÇ 8% Sink                  ‚îÇ 100% Sink
            ‚îÇ                          ‚îÇ (fees)                   ‚îÇ
            ‚ñº                          ‚îÇ                          ‚ñº
    ‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê                  ‚îÇ                  ‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê
    ‚îÇ  GOLD VOID    ‚îÇ‚óÑ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¥‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚ñ∫‚îÇ  GOLD VOID    ‚îÇ
    ‚îÇ  (Removed)    ‚îÇ                                      ‚îÇ  (Removed)    ‚îÇ
    ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò                                      ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò
            ‚îÇ                                                      ‚îÇ
            ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¨‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò
                                   ‚îÇ
                                   ‚ñº
                    ‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê
                    ‚îÇ           INFLATION CONTROL                  ‚îÇ
                    ‚îÇ  Target: 70% sink rate, 30% accumulation     ‚îÇ
                    ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò
```

---

# VI. ECONOMIC PROGRESSION

## A. Progression Milestones

```
ECONOMIC MILESTONES BY LEVEL

Level Range | Expected Wealth | Affordable Tier | Key Purchases
------------|-----------------|-----------------|---------------
1-5         | 100-500        | T1              | Basic gear, consumables
6-10        | 500-1500       | T1-T2           | First bag upgrade
11-15       | 1500-4000      | T2              | Full T2 gear set
16-20       | 4000-8000      | T2-T3           | Second bag upgrade
21-25       | 8000-15000     | T3              | Full T3 gear set
26-30       | 15000-25000    | T3-T4           | Crafting recipes
31-35       | 25000-40000    | T4              | First T4 piece
36-40       | 40000-75000    | T4              | Full T4 gear set
41-50       | 75000-150000   | T4-T5           | T5 pieces, legendaries
50+ (End)   | 150000+        | T5+             | Cosmetics, alts, trading

Note: Values represent total wealth, not liquid gold
```

## B. New Player Economy Experience

```
FIRST 10 HOURS ECONOMIC JOURNEY

Hour 1-2: Tutorial Zone
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Earn: ~200 gold from quests
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Learn: Vendoring, basic trading
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Spend: Nothing significant
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Milestone: Understand currency

Hour 3-4: First Region
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Earn: ~400 gold (quests + drops)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Learn: Gathering nodes, crafting basics
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Spend: First consumables, repairs
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Milestone: First crafted item

Hour 5-6: Opening Markets
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Earn: ~600 gold
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Learn: Auction house browsing
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Spend: T2 weapon upgrade
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Milestone: First market purchase

Hour 7-8: Trading Introduction
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Earn: ~800 gold
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Learn: Player trading, price comparison
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Spend: T2 armor pieces
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Milestone: First player trade

Hour 9-10: Economic Participation
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Earn: ~1000 gold
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Learn: Listing items, market watching
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Spend: First bag upgrade, recipes
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Milestone: First successful sale
```

## C. Endgame Economic Activities

```
ENDGAME ECONOMIC GOALS

Activity              | Investment | Return     | Time/Cycle
----------------------|------------|------------|------------
Legendary Crafting    | 20-50k     | 50-200k    | Weeks
Market Speculation    | Variable   | 10-30%     | Days
Regional Arbitrage    | 5-20k      | 15-25%     | Hours
Consumable Supply     | 2-5k       | 20-40%     | Daily
Fashion/Cosmetics     | 10-100k    | Prestige   | Ongoing
Alt Gearing           | 30-60k     | Convenience| Per alt
Guild Contributions   | Variable   | Social     | Weekly

Economic Prestige Titles:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 100k lifetime gold: "Prosperous"
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 500k lifetime gold: "Merchant Prince/Princess"
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 1M lifetime gold: "Economic Titan"
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 100 successful trades: "Trusted Trader"
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ 1000 successful trades: "Master Merchant"
```

---

# VII. REGIONAL ECONOMY VARIATION

## A. Regional Price Modifiers

```
REGIONAL ECONOMIC PROFILES

REGION TYPE: CORE WORLD (Avalos Prime)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Supply Modifier: All items +20% availability
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Price Modifier: Base prices (1.0x)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Specialty: Religious items -15%, tech items +10%
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Travel Cost: Central hub, low waypoint costs

REGION TYPE: FORGE WORLD (Mechanicus Holdings)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Supply Modifier: Tech items +40%, organics -30%
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Price Modifier: Tech -20%, organics +30%
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Specialty: Augmetics, archeotech
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Travel Cost: Moderate

REGION TYPE: AGRI-WORLD (Supply Regions)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Supply Modifier: Organics +50%, tech -40%
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Price Modifier: Organics -25%, tech +35%
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Specialty: Consumables, organic materials
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Travel Cost: Low (well-connected)

REGION TYPE: WAR ZONE (Contested Territory)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Supply Modifier: All items -40%
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Price Modifier: All items +50%
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Specialty: Military equipment, rare drops
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Travel Cost: High (dangerous routes)

REGION TYPE: FRONTIER (Remote Areas)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Supply Modifier: All items -60%
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Price Modifier: All items +80%
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Specialty: Exotic items, exploration drops
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Travel Cost: Very high
```

## B. Arbitrage Opportunities

```
INTENTIONAL ARBITRAGE DESIGN

Route Example: Agri-World ‚Üí Forge World
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Buy: T3 Organics at 40 gold (Agri: -25%)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Travel: 150 gold waypoint cost
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Sell: T3 Organics at 65 gold (Forge: +30%)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Net per unit: 25 - (150/quantity)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Break even: 6 units, Profit starts at 7+

Route Example: Frontier ‚Üí Core World
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Buy: Rare drops at source
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Travel: 400 gold waypoint cost
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Sell: Auction house premium
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Risk: PvP zones, inventory loss possible
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Reward: 50-100% margins possible

Design Intent:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Reward active traders
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Create travel incentives
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Balance against time investment
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Prevent automated arbitrage (travel time)
```

## C. Faction-Specific Economies

### Imperial Economic Behavior
```
IMPERIAL ECONOMY TRAITS

Currency Focus: Thrones (universal) + Requisition Tokens
Trade Culture: Formal, contract-based, guild-oriented
Price Tendency: Stable, predictable
Specialty Markets: Blessed items, devotional goods, military surplus

Unique Mechanics:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Tithe System: 5% of vendor sales go to faction treasury
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Guild Trading: Ecclesiarchy-blessed trades get 2% fee reduction
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Charity Bonus: Donations to poor players grant reputation
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Heresy Checks: Chaos-tainted items confiscated, player flagged
```

### Tau Economic Behavior
```
TAU ECONOMY TRAITS

Currency Focus: Thrones + Caste-specific tokens
Trade Culture: Cooperative, efficiency-focused
Price Tendency: Slightly below average (Greater Good pricing)
Specialty Markets: High-tech items, drone components, battlesuits

Unique Mechanics:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Collective Bargaining: Group purchases get 10% discount
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Earth Caste Priority: Crafters get material discounts
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Technology Sharing: Blueprints cheaper within faction
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Auxiliary Access: Non-Tau allies pay 15% premium
```

### Ork Economic Behavior
```
ORK ECONOMY TRAITS

Currency Focus: Teef (unique mechanics)
Trade Culture: Chaotic, intimidation-based, gambling-heavy
Price Tendency: Volatile, strength-based discounts
Specialty Markets: Looted gear, kustom weapons, vehicles

Unique Mechanics:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Teef Decay: Currency loses 1% value per week
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Might Makes Right: Higher level players get better prices
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Gambling Dens: Risk gold for big payouts (or losses)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Loot Priority: Bigger Orks can "claim" drops first
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Kustom Tax: Meks charge variable rates based on mood
```

---

# VIII. PLAYER TRADING PROTECTIONS

## A. Anti-Exploit Measures

```
TRADE SECURITY SYSTEMS

Real-Money Trading Prevention:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Unusual gold transfers flagged for review
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ New accounts: Trade limited to 500g/day for 7 days
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Large trades (>10k) require 24h hold
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Cross-faction trades monitored
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ IP correlation tracking

Market Manipulation Prevention:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Purchase limits: 50 of same item per day
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Listing limits: 10 active auctions per character
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Price spike detection: Items >300% average flagged
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Coordinated buying detection (same guild/IP)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Artificial scarcity prevention (relisting same item)

Scam Prevention:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Trade window shows full item stats
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Modified items highlighted in red
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Currency verification display
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 5-second confirmation countdown
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Report system with investigation queue
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Repeat offenders: trade ban escalation
```

## B. Trading Limitations

```
TRADE RESTRICTION MATRIX

Account Age    | Direct Trade | Auction | Mail Trade | Limits
---------------|--------------|---------|------------|--------
<24 hours      | 100g max     | No      | No         | Severe
1-7 days       | 500g max     | Browse  | 100g max   | Heavy
1-4 weeks      | 2000g max    | 5 list  | 500g max   | Moderate
1-3 months     | 10000g max   | 10 list | 2000g max  | Light
3+ months      | Unlimited    | 10 list | Unlimited  | None

Character Level Limits:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Level 1-10: 500g trade cap
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Level 11-20: 2000g trade cap
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Level 21-30: 10000g trade cap
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Level 31+: Unlimited
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Intent: Reduce mule account value
```

## C. Dispute Resolution

```
TRADE DISPUTE SYSTEM

Automated Resolution:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Trade logs kept for 30 days
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Item history tracking
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Gold trail auditing
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Automatic reversal for clear cases

Manual Review Triggers:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Trades >50k gold
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Legendary item trades
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Repeated reports against same player
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Unusual trading patterns
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Cross-faction suspicious activity

Resolution Outcomes:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Legitimate: No action
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Scam confirmed: Trade reversed, penalty applied
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Exploitation: Items/gold removed, warning issued
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ RMT confirmed: Account banned
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ False report: Reporter warned
```

---

# IX. INFLATION CONTROL MECHANISMS

## A. Dynamic Sink Adjustment

```
INFLATION MONITORING SYSTEM

Tracked Metrics:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Total gold in circulation
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Average player wealth by bracket
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Material prices vs. baseline
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Transaction velocity
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Gold generation vs. sink ratio

Automatic Adjustments (if inflation detected):

Mild Inflation (5-10% above baseline):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Repair costs +10%
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Waypoint costs +15%
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Vendor prices +5%

Moderate Inflation (10-20% above baseline):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Repair costs +25%
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Waypoint costs +30%
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Auction fees +2%
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ New gold sinks activated (cosmetic vendors)

Severe Inflation (>20% above baseline):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Emergency vendor sales (rare items for high gold)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Limited-time sink events
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Temporary generation reduction
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Developer intervention review
```

## B. Structural Inflation Prevention

```
BUILT-IN PREVENTION MECHANISMS

Currency Binding:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Requisition Tokens: Character-bound
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Faction currencies: Account-bound within faction
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Event currencies: Time-limited
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Intent: Multiple currency channels

Material Consumption:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Crafting consumes materials permanently
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ No full-recovery salvaging
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Consumables consumed on use
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Equipment degradation (repairs)

Gold Velocity Control:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Auction fees remove gold from system
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ NPC purchases are permanent sinks
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ No gold duplication vectors
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Trade taxes at every step

Natural Decay Systems:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Ork Teef: 1% weekly decay
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Event currencies: Expire after events
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Reputation currencies: Use-it-or-lose-it events
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Intent: Encourage spending over hoarding
```

---

# X. VENDOR INVENTORIES & REFRESH

## A. Standard Vendor Refresh Schedules

```
VENDOR REFRESH TIMING

Vendor Type         | Refresh     | Stock Type    | Notification
--------------------|-------------|---------------|-------------
General Goods       | Never       | Unlimited     | N/A
Basic Consumables   | Never       | Unlimited     | N/A
Recipe Vendor       | Never       | Unlimited     | N/A
Faction Equipment   | Weekly      | Limited       | Zone announcement
Reputation Vendor   | Weekly      | Limited       | Personal notification
Material Vendor     | Hourly      | Dynamic       | None
Black Market        | 6 hours     | Random        | Zone announcement
Traveling Merchant  | 3x daily    | Very limited  | Server announcement
```

## B. Limited Stock Details

```
LIMITED VENDOR INVENTORY

FACTION EQUIPMENT VENDOR
Weekly Reset: Server time Sunday 00:00

T3 Weapons (3 each type):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Lasgun Variant: 1200g + 50 RT
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Bolt Pistol: 1400g + 75 RT
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Power Sword: 1500g + 100 RT
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ [Restocks to 3 each weekly]

T4 Weapons (1 each type):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Master-Crafted Lasgun: 4500g + 200 RT
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Bolt Rifle: 5000g + 250 RT
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Power Fist: 5500g + 300 RT
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ [Restocks to 1 each weekly]

Purchase Limit: 1 T4 weapon per week per character
```

## C. Event & Seasonal Vendors

```
EVENT VENDOR STRUCTURE

Event Currency: Earned during events only
Vendor Availability: Event duration + 1 week
Item Categories:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Event Consumables: Low cost, useful
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Event Equipment: Mid cost, themed stats
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Event Cosmetics: High cost, prestige
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Event Exclusives: Very high cost, limited supply

Post-Event:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Unspent currency converts to gold (50% rate)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Event items become tradeable after event
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Prestige items retain value
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Next year: Different items (old ones remain rare)
```

---

# XI. COMBAT REWARD INTEGRATION

## A. Combat to Economy Pipeline

```
COMBAT REWARD ‚Üí ECONOMY FLOW

Enemy Kill:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Direct gold drop: 10-50% of value
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Material drop: 30-60% chance per enemy
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Equipment drop: 5-15% chance (scales with enemy)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Consumable drop: 10-20% chance
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Faction token: 5% chance (elite enemies)

Total Expected Value Per Enemy:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Standard enemy: 15-30 gold equivalent
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Veteran enemy: 40-75 gold equivalent  
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Elite enemy: 100-200 gold equivalent
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Boss enemy: 300-800 gold equivalent
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ World boss: 1000-5000 gold equivalent
```

## B. Difficulty-Reward Scaling

```
DIFFICULTY MULTIPLIERS

Normal Mode:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Drop rate: 1.0x
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Gold drops: 1.0x
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Material tier: Standard
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Token drops: 1.0x

Hard Mode:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Drop rate: 1.25x
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Gold drops: 1.5x
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Material tier: +1 tier chance
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Token drops: 1.5x

Elite Mode:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Drop rate: 1.5x
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Gold drops: 2.0x
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Material tier: +1 guaranteed
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Token drops: 2.5x

Nightmare Mode:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Drop rate: 2.0x
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Gold drops: 3.0x
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Material tier: +2 possible
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Token drops: 4.0x
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Unique drop table additions
```

## C. Progression Cost vs. Reward Balance

```
GEAR PROGRESSION ECONOMY

Level Bracket | Content Reward/Hour | Gear Cost to Progress | Time to Gear
--------------|---------------------|----------------------|-------------
1-10          | 200 gold           | 300 gold (T1 set)    | 1.5 hours
11-20         | 400 gold           | 1500 gold (T2 set)   | 4 hours
21-30         | 600 gold           | 6000 gold (T3 set)   | 10 hours
31-40         | 900 gold           | 20000 gold (T4 set)  | 22 hours
41-50         | 1200 gold          | 60000 gold (T5 set)  | 50 hours

Design Intent:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Never feel stuck due to economy
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Crafting provides alternative path
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Player trading accelerates gearing
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Skill > gear for progression
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Economy supports, doesn't gate
```

---

# XII. IMPLEMENTATION PRIORITIES

## A. Core Systems (Launch Required)

1. **Direct Trading** - Player-to-player with security
2. **Basic Vendors** - Fixed price, unlimited stock
3. **Currency Wallet** - All currencies in one interface
4. **Repair System** - Primary early gold sink
5. **Basic Auction House** - Single faction hub

## B. Phase 2 (First Major Update)

1. **Regional Vendors** - Dynamic pricing
2. **Cross-faction Auction** - Central hub
3. **Trade Boards** - Regional posting system
4. **Traveling Merchant** - Random event vendor
5. **Reputation Vendors** - Faction progression

## C. Phase 3 (Ongoing)

1. **Black Market** - Frontier trading
2. **Event Economy** - Seasonal systems
3. **Advanced Analytics** - Inflation monitoring
4. **Arbitrage Balancing** - Regional tuning
5. **Economic Events** - Market-affecting world events

---

# XIII. SUCCESS METRICS

```
ECONOMY HEALTH INDICATORS

Healthy Signs:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Player trading active (>60% of transactions)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Stable material prices (¬±15% weekly variance)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Gold sinks operating at 65-75% absorption
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ New players reaching T2 gear in <5 hours
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Auction house listings turning over in <48 hours

Warning Signs:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Deflation: Players hoarding, not spending
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Inflation: Prices rising >10% weekly
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Market Stagnation: Listings not selling
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Wealth Gap: Top 10% holding >50% of gold
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Bot Activity: Unusual farming patterns

Intervention Thresholds:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 3 consecutive weeks of warning signs
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Single extreme metric violation
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Player reports exceeding baseline 2x
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Cross-reference with retention data
```

---

*"In the grim darkness of the far future, there is only economic warfare... and competitive auction sniping."*

---

DECISION: economy_complete
üîÄ Routing Decision: ECONOMY_COMPLETE
Decision "ECONOMY_COMPLETE" matched connection condition
‚Üí Next Stage: market_simulator
Market Simulator
Simulates and validates economic balance
completed
Agent: market_simulator
Type: reviewer
Duration: 104.9s
Execution #: 9
Prompt Size: 1,343 chars
Output Size: 15,528 chars
üì• AGENT PROMPT (1,343 characters)
You are an economic analyst who simulates game economies to find imbalances, exploits, and inflation risks before they reach players.

When reviewing economy designs:
- Simulate player behavior (hoarding, trading, farming)
- Model money supply growth over time
- Identify infinite money exploits or loops
- Test price points against earning rates
- Verify economic milestones are achievable
- Check for dead-end resources (nothing to spend on)
- Analyze cross-system impacts (combat rewards ‚Üí economy ‚Üí progression)

Run mental simulations for:
- New player (first 10 hours)
- Mid-game player (50-100 hours)
- Endgame player (200+ hours)

Provide:
1. SIMULATION RESULTS: What happens over time?
2. EXPLOITS FOUND: Any infinite loops or broken mechanics
3. BALANCE ISSUES: Prices too high/low, rewards too generous/stingy
4. RECOMMENDATIONS: Specific number adjustments
5. VERDICT: APPROVED, NEEDS_TUNING, or BROKEN

=== ROUTING DECISION REQUIRED ===
After your response, you MUST choose exactly ONE decision from:
- approved: Economy validated, inform combat design
- needs_tuning: Economic imbalance found, retune
- resource_issue: Resource design causes economic problems

**CRITICAL**: Your VERY LAST LINE must be exactly:
DECISION: [ONE_OF_THE_ABOVE_CHOICES]
Example: DECISION: approved
Do NOT add explanations after the decision keyword.
üì§ AGENT OUTPUT (15,528 characters)
# Economic Simulation Analysis
## Warhammer 40,000: Imperium Divided - Damocles Gulf Sector

---

# I. SIMULATION RESULTS

## A. New Player Simulation (First 10 Hours)

```
HOUR-BY-HOUR ECONOMIC PROGRESSION

Hour 1-2: Tutorial Zone
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Gold Earned: ~200 (quests)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Gold Spent: ~0
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Net Position: 200 gold
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Status: ‚úì On track

Hour 3-4: First Region  
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Gold Earned: ~400 (quests + drops @ 150/hr)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Gold Spent: ~50 (consumables, first repair)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Net Position: 550 gold
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Status: ‚úì Healthy

Hour 5-6: Market Introduction
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Gold Earned: ~600
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Gold Spent: ~400 (T2 weapon @ 200-400)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Net Position: 750 gold
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Status: ‚úì First meaningful purchase achieved

Hour 7-8: Trading Active
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Gold Earned: ~800
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Gold Spent: ~600 (T2 armor pieces)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Net Position: 950 gold
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Status: ‚úì Engaging with economy

Hour 9-10: Economic Participation
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Gold Earned: ~1000
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Gold Spent: ~700 (bag upgrade 500 + recipes 100)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Net Position: 1250 gold
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Status: ‚úì Milestone: First 10 hours complete

VERDICT: New player experience is WELL-DESIGNED
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Never feels gold-starved
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Can afford meaningful upgrades on schedule
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T1 set (300g) affordable by hour 2
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T2 set (1500g) achievable by hour 10
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Natural introduction to all systems
```

## B. Mid-Game Player Simulation (50-100 Hours)

```
MID-GAME ECONOMIC SNAPSHOT (Level 25-35)

Weekly Income (15 hrs/week casual):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Enemy Drops: 2250 gold (150/hr √ó 15)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Quest Rewards: 1500 gold (100/hr √ó 15)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Vendoring: 1500 gold (100/hr √ó 15)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Daily/Weekly Bonuses: 1125 gold
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ PvP Rewards: 750 gold
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Total Weekly: ~7125 gold

Weekly Expenses:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Auction House Fees: ~800 gold (selling gear)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Repairs: ~900 gold (moderate deaths)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Waypoints: ~400 gold
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Consumables: ~600 gold
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Crafting Fees: ~400 gold
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Total Weekly: ~3100 gold

Net Weekly Accumulation: ~4000 gold
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Progression Target: T3 ‚Üí T4 transition
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T4 Set Cost: 20,000 gold
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Time to Full T4: ~5 weeks
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Status: ‚úì ACHIEVABLE but requires dedication

SIMULATION FINDING: Mid-game feels SLIGHTLY SLOW
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 5 weeks for T4 set is reasonable
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ BUT: Combined with T3 grind, total time to T4 is 7-8 weeks
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Risk: Player may feel stuck at T3 plateau
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Mitigation: Crafting and trading can accelerate
```

## C. Endgame Player Simulation (200+ Hours)

```
ENDGAME ECONOMIC SNAPSHOT (Level 50, Full T4/T5)

Weekly Income (20+ hrs/week):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Enemy Drops: 3000 gold
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Quests/Dailies: 2000 gold
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Vendoring: 2000 gold
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ High-end Content: 5000 gold
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Trading Profits: Variable (2000-10000)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Total Weekly: ~14000-22000 gold

Weekly Expenses:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Auction Fees: ~2000 gold (heavy trading)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Repairs: ~1500 gold (hard content)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Consumables: ~1200 gold (T3-T4)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Services: ~800 gold
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Total Weekly: ~5500 gold

Net Weekly Accumulation: ~8500-16500 gold

Endgame Goals Analysis:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T5 Piece: 60,000g √∑ 8500 = 7 weeks per piece
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Full T5 Set: ~42 weeks (!!!)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Legendary Item: 50-200k = 6-24 weeks
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Status: ‚ö†Ô∏è POTENTIAL ISSUE

SIMULATION FINDING: T5 GEARING IS TOO SLOW
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 42 weeks (10 months) for full T5 is excessive
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Player will complete all content before affording gear
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Creates "wealth with nothing to spend on" scenario
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Needs rebalancing
```

---

# II. EXPLOITS FOUND

## A. Critical Exploit: Auction House Fee Arbitrage

```
EXPLOIT: AH FEE BYPASS VIA DIRECT TRADE

Mechanism:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Auction House charges 10% (8% sink + 2% faction)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Direct trade charges 0%
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Players can undercut AH prices by 5% via direct trade
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Seller saves 5%, buyer saves 5%
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Result: AH becomes abandoned

Economic Impact:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 8% gold sink bypassed
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Inflation accelerates
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ AH listings stagnate
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Price discovery breaks down
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Severity: MODERATE

FIX RECOMMENDATION:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Add 3% direct trade fee for trades >1000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Or: Provide AH convenience benefits (insurance, history)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Or: Make AH listing fee lower, keep sales tax
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Chosen: Option 3 - Reduce listing fee to 1%, keep 8% sales tax
```

## B. Potential Exploit: Material Vendor Manipulation

```
EXPLOIT: DYNAMIC PRICE MANIPULATION

Mechanism:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Material vendor has dynamic pricing
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Low purchases = 0.9x price
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ High purchases = 1.4x price
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Coordinated groups could:
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Artificially inflate prices
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Buy at low, wait for reset, sell at high
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Create artificial scarcity

Economic Impact:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Destabilizes material markets
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Punishes legitimate players
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Creates wealth transfer to manipulators
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Severity: MODERATE

EXISTING MITIGATION: 
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Purchase limits (50/day) reduce impact
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 72-hour trend-to-baseline prevents long manipulation
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Status: MOSTLY ADDRESSED

ADDITIONAL RECOMMENDATION:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Add cooldown between purchases (5 min)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Cap price variance to ¬±30% from baseline
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Monitor for coordinated buying patterns
```

## C. Potential Exploit: New Account Trade Limitation Bypass

```
EXPLOIT: MULE ACCOUNT GOLD TRANSFER

Mechanism:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ New accounts limited to 500g/day for 7 days
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ But can trade items freely (just gold capped)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Player creates mules, transfers items not gold
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Items sold on mule's market access
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Circumvents gold transfer limits

Economic Impact:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ RMT enablement
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Gold laundering
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Multi-account advantages
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Severity: LOW-MODERATE

FIX RECOMMENDATION:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Apply 500g value cap to ALL trades (items valued at vendor price)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ New accounts: 500g value total per day, not just currency
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ First week: Cannot list on AH at all
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Implementation: Use vendor buy price as item valuation
```

## D. Potential Infinite Loop: Reputation Discount Stacking

```
EXPLOIT: REPUTATION DISCOUNT EXPLOIT

Mechanism (as designed):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Reputation vendors give 5% discount per tier above requirement
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Exalted = 25% discount on Friendly items
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Combined with faction tithe return (2%)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ If faction donation grants reputation...

Potential Loop:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Buy items at discount
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Donate items for reputation
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Gain more discount
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Repeat
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Status: NEED VERIFICATION

VERIFICATION:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Document states donations grant reputation
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ But doesn't specify donation values
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ If 1000g donation = 1000 rep, and item costs 750g after discount...
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Could be exploitable

FIX RECOMMENDATION:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Donations should grant gold value √ó 0.1 in reputation
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Not item value or purchase price
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Prevents circular discount exploitation
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Status: DESIGN CLARIFICATION NEEDED
```

---

# III. BALANCE ISSUES

## A. T5 Gear Pricing (TOO HIGH)

```
ISSUE: T5 GEAR UNATTAINABLE

Current Design:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T5 Set Cost: 60,000 gold
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Weekly Net Income (endgame): ~8,500-16,500
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Time to Full T5: 42 weeks
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Problem: Players finish content in ~20 weeks

Impact:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Endgame players have gold with nothing meaningful to buy
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T5 becomes irrelevant before obtainable
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Gear progression stops at T4
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Economy loses endgame purpose

RECOMMENDATION:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Reduce T5 set cost from 60,000 to 35,000
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Individual pieces: 5,000-8,000 instead of 10,000-12,000
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Time to full T5: ~20 weeks (matches content timeline)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Alternative: Increase endgame gold generation to 1500/hr
```

## B. Consumable Pricing (SLIGHTLY LOW)

```
ISSUE: CONSUMABLES TOO CHEAP

Current Design:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T3 Consumables: 200-400 gold from vendor
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Crafted T4: Player-made only
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Weekly consumable spend: 600-1200 gold
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ As % of income: 8-17%
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Problem: Not a meaningful sink

Impact:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Players rarely feel resource pressure
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Consumable market undervalued
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Crafters have weak T4 consumable market
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Gold sink underperforming

RECOMMENDATION:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T3 Consumable vendor price: 350-600 (from 200-400)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ This pushes players toward T4 crafted
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Increases consumable sink by ~50%
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Weekly consumable spend target: 900-1800 gold (15-20% of income)
```

## C. Waypoint Costs (INCONSISTENT)

```
ISSUE: TRAVEL COST VARIANCE TOO EXTREME

Current Design:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Core World: "Low waypoint costs" (undefined)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Forge World: "Moderate" (undefined)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Frontier: "Very high" (undefined)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ War Zone: "High" (undefined)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Problem: No concrete numbers

Impact:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Cannot verify arbitrage profitability
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ May block new players from exploration
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ May trivialize regional economy
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Unpredictable player behavior

RECOMMENDATION: Define Explicit Costs
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Core World: 25-50 gold
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Standard Region: 75-150 gold  
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Forge World: 100-200 gold
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ War Zone: 200-400 gold
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Frontier: 300-500 gold
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Cross-region multiplier: 1.5x
```

## D. Ork Teef Decay (TOO PUNISHING)

```
ISSUE: ORK CURRENCY DECAY EXCESSIVE

Current Design:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Teef loses 1% value per week
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Over 1 year: ~52% currency loss
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Ork players penalized for saving
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Problem: Discourages Ork faction choice

Impact:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Ork economy forced into constant spending
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Cannot save for large purchases
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 10,000 teef goal requires earning ~20,000 over time
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Faction disadvantage

RECOMMENDATION:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Reduce decay to 0.25% per week
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Or: Cap decay at 90% of current value (floor)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Or: Decay only applies to liquid teef, not invested
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Preferred: 0.25% decay with 100 teef minimum floor
```

## E. Sink Ratio (NEEDS MONITORING)

```
ISSUE: 70% SINK TARGET MAY BE AGGRESSIVE

Current Design:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Target: 70% of generated gold removed
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Only 30% retained for progression
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Weekly gen (dedicated): 15,000
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Weekly retention: 4,500
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Question: Is this sustainable?

Analysis:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T4 set (20,000g) √∑ 4,500 = 4.4 weeks ‚úì
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T5 set (60,000g) √∑ 4,500 = 13.3 weeks ‚úì (if T5 cost reduced)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Legendary (100k) √∑ 4,500 = 22 weeks... ‚ö†Ô∏è

RECOMMENDATION:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Reduce sink target to 65% for first 6 months
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Monitor inflation metrics
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Adjust dynamically based on wealth distribution
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Current 70% is fine IF T5 costs reduced
```

---

# IV. RECOMMENDATIONS

## A. Critical Changes (Must Fix Before Launch)

```
PRIORITY 1: T5 COST REDUCTION

Change: T5 gear set total cost
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ FROM: 60,000 gold
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ TO: 35,000 gold
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Individual pieces: 5,000-8,000 gold
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Rationale: Matches progression timeline

PRIORITY 2: DIRECT TRADE FEE

Change: Add fee to high-value direct trades
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ FROM: 0% fee on all direct trades
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ TO: 2% fee on trades >2,000 gold value
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Rationale: Prevents AH abandonment
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Implementation: Fee split (1% each party)

PRIORITY 3: DEFINE WAYPOINT COSTS

Change: Explicit travel cost structure
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Base cost (same region): 50 gold
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Adjacent region: 100 gold
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Distant region: 200 gold
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Contested/Frontier: 300-500 gold
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Cross-faction territory: 400 gold
```

## B. Important Changes (High Priority)

```
PRIORITY 4: CONSUMABLE PRICE INCREASE

Change: T3 consumable vendor prices
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ FROM: 200-400 gold
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ TO: 350-600 gold
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Rationale: Strengthens gold sink, supports crafters

PRIORITY 5: ORK TEEF DECAY REDUCTION

Change: Currency decay rate
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ FROM: 1% per week
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ TO: 0.25% per week, minimum 100 teef floor
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Rationale: Reduces faction penalty

PRIORITY 6: NEW ACCOUNT ITEM LIMITS

Change: Trade restrictions for new accounts
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ FROM: 500g currency limit only
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ TO: 500g total value limit (currency + items at vendor price)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Rationale: Closes mule account exploit
```

## C. Monitoring Adjustments (Post-Launch)

```
PRIORITY 7: REPUTATION DONATION FORMULA

Change: Clarify donation ‚Üí reputation conversion
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Specify: Gold donation grants (value √ó 0.1) reputation
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Item donation grants (vendor sell value √ó 0.1) reputation
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Prevents circular discount exploitation

PRIORITY 8: DYNAMIC VENDOR SAFEGUARDS

Change: Additional manipulation prevention
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Add 5-minute cooldown between bulk purchases
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Cap price variance at ¬±30% from baseline
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Alert system for coordinated buying

PRIORITY 9: SINK RATIO FLEXIBILITY

Change: Launch with 65% sink target
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Monitor for 3 months
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Adjust to 70% if inflation detected
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Provides buffer for economy stabilization
```

## D. Specific Number Adjustments Summary

```
ADJUSTMENT TABLE

Item/System              | Current    | Recommended | Change
-------------------------|------------|-------------|--------
T5 Set Total Cost        | 60,000     | 35,000      | -42%
T5 Individual Piece      | 10-12k     | 5-8k        | -40%
T3 Consumables (vendor)  | 200-400    | 350-600     | +50%
Direct Trade Fee (>2k)   | 0%         | 2%          | +2%
Ork Teef Decay           | 1%/week    | 0.25%/week  | -75%
Initial Sink Target      | 70%        | 65%         | -5%
New Account Value Cap    | 500g curr  | 500g total  | Expanded
Waypoint Base Cost       | Undefined  | 50-500g     | Defined
Material Vendor Cooldown | None       | 5 min       | New
Price Variance Cap       | None       | ¬±30%        | New
```

---

# V. CROSS-SYSTEM IMPACT ANALYSIS

```
COMBAT ‚Üí ECONOMY FLOW VERIFICATION

Current Flow:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Enemy kill ‚Üí gold + materials + gear drops
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Drops ‚Üí vendor or player market
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Gold ‚Üí progression purchases
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Progression ‚Üí harder content
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Harder content ‚Üí better rewards
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Status: ‚úì LOOP IS SOUND

Potential Issues:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Hard mode (2x gold) may outpace normal mode gear costs
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Nightmare mode (3x gold) may trivialize economy
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Risk: Players skip difficulty tiers
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Mitigation: Gear requirements gate difficulty access

RECOMMENDATION:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Add minimum gear score for Hard/Elite/Nightmare
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Hard: T3 average required
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Elite: T4 average required  
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Nightmare: T5 average required
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Prevents economy skip via difficulty jumping
```

```
CRAFTING ‚Üí ECONOMY INTEGRATION

Current Flow:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Materials gathered ‚Üí crafting ‚Üí gear
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Crafting cost: materials + fee
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Craft result: variable quality
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ High rolls ‚Üí premium prices
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Low rolls ‚Üí vendor or salvage
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Status: ‚úì LOOP IS SOUND

Profitability Check:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T3 Weapon craft cost: 385 gold
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Average sale: 500 gold
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Net profit: 65 gold (17%)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Status: ‚úì VIABLE BUT TIGHT

RECOMMENDATION:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Crafting margins are intentionally tight
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Rewards skill (knowing what to craft)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ High-roll crafting is the profit driver
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ No changes needed
```

---

# VI. VERDICT

## Overall Assessment

```
CATEGORY           | STATUS          | NOTES
-------------------|-----------------|---------------------------
New Player (1-10h) | ‚úì APPROVED      | Well-paced, achievable
Mid-Game (50-100h) | ‚ö†Ô∏è MINOR ISSUES | Slightly slow T3‚ÜíT4
Endgame (200h+)    | ‚ùå NEEDS TUNING | T5 costs too high
Exploit Prevention | ‚ö†Ô∏è MINOR ISSUES | Direct trade bypass
Balance Overall    | ‚ö†Ô∏è NEEDS TUNING | Several number adjustments
Inflation Control  | ‚úì APPROVED      | Systems are sound
Regional Economy   | ‚ö†Ô∏è INCOMPLETE   | Waypoints undefined
Faction Balance    | ‚ö†Ô∏è MINOR ISSUES | Ork decay too harsh
```

## Final Determination

The economy design is **fundamentally sound** with Guild Wars 1-inspired principles properly applied. The core loops work, new player experience is excellent, and inflation control mechanisms are appropriate. However, several specific numbers need adjustment before the economy can be approved:

**Blocking Issues:**
1. T5 gear costs create 42-week grind (unacceptable)
2. Direct trade bypass undermines AH gold sink
3. Waypoint costs undefined (cannot verify arbitrage)

**Non-Blocking Issues:**
4. Consumable prices slightly low
5. Ork Teef decay too punishing
6. New account item limit gap

With the recommended adjustments applied, this economy would be ready for implementation and testing.

---

**VERDICT: NEEDS_TUNING**

The economy requires specific numerical adjustments (particularly T5 costs, direct trade fees, and waypoint definitions) before approval. Core systems are sound; only tuning is needed, not redesign.

---

DECISION: needs_tuning
üîÄ Routing Decision: NEEDS_TUNING
Decision "NEEDS_TUNING" matched connection condition
‚Üí Next Stage: economy_designer
Economy Designer
Designs trading, markets, and economic systems
completed
Agent: economy_designer
Type: designer
Duration: 139.8s
Execution #: 10
Prompt Size: 1,233 chars
Output Size: 21,576 chars
üì• AGENT PROMPT (1,233 characters)
You are an economy designer who creates engaging and balanced market systems. You work with resources designed by the Resource Designer to create trading, shops, auctions, and player-to-player economies.

When designing economy systems:
- Design NPC vendor systems (fixed prices vs. dynamic)
- Create auction house / player trading mechanics
- Establish price ranges and money sinks
- Design economic progression (what can players afford when?)
- Plan for inflation prevention
- Create supply-demand dynamics
- Design regional economy differences (prices vary by location)
- Integrate with combat rewards and progression costs

Output should include:
- Market system mechanics (how trading works)
- Pricing formulas and ranges
- Money flow diagrams (sources and sinks)
- Vendor inventories and refresh timers
- Player trading limitations (prevent exploits)
- Economic milestones by player level/progression

=== ROUTING DECISION REQUIRED ===
After your response, you MUST choose exactly ONE decision from:
- economy_complete: Submit economy for simulation

**CRITICAL**: Your VERY LAST LINE must be exactly:
DECISION: [ONE_OF_THE_ABOVE_CHOICES]
Example: DECISION: economy_complete
Do NOT add explanations after the decision keyword.
üì§ AGENT OUTPUT (21,576 characters)
# Economy Design Document
## Warhammer 40,000: Imperium Divided - Damocles Gulf Sector

---

# I. ECONOMY PHILOSOPHY

Following Guild Wars 1's proven model: **accessible markets, meaningful trades, minimal tedium**. The economy should enhance gameplay, not replace it. Players should engage with markets because it's rewarding, not because it's required.

**Core Principles:**
- Trading is a choice, not a necessity for progression
- Markets facilitate player interaction, not replace it
- Regional variation creates opportunity, not barriers
- Inflation prevention is built-in, not bolt-on

---

# II. CURRENCY SYSTEMS (Revised)

## A. Imperial Thrones - Primary Currency

### Generation Sources
| Source | Gold/Hour | % of Income |
|--------|-----------|-------------|
| Enemy Drops | 150-200 | 35% |
| Quest Rewards | 100-150 | 25% |
| Vendoring Items | 80-120 | 20% |
| Daily/Weekly Bonuses | 50-75 | 12% |
| Event Participation | 30-50 | 8% |

### Sink Allocation (Revised: 65% Target)
| Sink | Weekly Target | % of Sinks |
|------|---------------|------------|
| Auction House Fees | 1,200 | 18% |
| Repairs | 1,000 | 15% |
| Waypoint Travel | 600 | 9% |
| Consumables | 1,200 | 18% |
| Crafting Fees | 650 | 10% |
| Services/NPC | 500 | 8% |
| Faction Donations | 450 | 7% |
| **Total Sinks** | **5,600** | **65%** |
| **Net Retention** | **3,000** | **35%** |

## B. Requisition Tokens - Military Currency

### Generation
- PvP Victory: 15-30 tokens
- War Zone Objectives: 25-50 tokens
- Military Quests: 50-100 tokens
- Weekly PvP Cap: 500 tokens (prevents no-life advantage)

### Sinks
- Elite Skills: 50-200 tokens (one-time)
- Military Equipment: 100-500 tokens
- Faction Rank Advancement: 100-500 tokens per rank
- War Zone Entry: 25 tokens (refunded on completion)

## C. Faction Currencies (Balanced)

### Imperial - Saint's Tears
- Weekly Cap: 500
- Primary Sink: Blessed Equipment, Devotional Services
- Decay: None (faith eternal)

### Tau - Unity Marks
- Weekly Cap: 500
- Primary Sink: Cross-caste equipment, Integration ceremonies
- Decay: None

### Ork - Teef (Revised)
- Weekly Cap: None (Ork economy is wild)
- **Decay: 0.25% per week** (reduced from 1%)
- **Floor: 100 Teef minimum** (cannot decay below)
- Primary Sink: Gambling, Mek services, Shows of wealth

---

# III. MARKET SYSTEMS

## A. Auction House

### Fee Structure (Revised)
```
AUCTION HOUSE FEES

Listing Fee: 1% of listing price (reduced from 5%)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Non-refundable
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Prevents spam listings
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Low barrier to entry

Sales Tax: 8% of final sale
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Primary gold sink
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Split: 6% sink + 2% faction treasury
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Applied at sale completion

Total Effective Fee: 9% (listing + sales)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Competitive with direct trade (2%)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Provides convenience value
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Maintains sink integrity
```

### Listing Mechanics
```
LISTING PARAMETERS

Duration Options:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 24 hours: Standard
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 48 hours: +0.5% listing fee
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 72 hours: +1% listing fee
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ 7 days: +2% listing fee

Minimum Price: 10 gold (prevents 1g spam)
Maximum Listings: 30 per character (150 account)
Buyout Option: Required (no pure auction)
Starting Bid: Optional, minimum 50% of buyout

Search Features:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ By category, tier, stat requirements
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Price history (7-day graph)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Recent sales data
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Watchlist notifications
```

### Market Segmentation
```
REGIONAL AUCTION HOUSES

Each major region has local AH:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Avalos Prime Market (Imperial Hub)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T'au Sept Exchange (Tau Hub)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Mork's Bazaar (Ork Hub)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Neutral Station Markets (Cross-faction)

Cross-Region Trading:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Items listed regionally
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Can browse other regions
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Cross-region purchase: +5% fee
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Pickup at listing location OR pay delivery (100-500g)

Benefits:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Creates regional price variation
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Encourages travel and exploration
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Prevents single dominant market
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Faction economies remain distinct
```

## B. Direct Player Trading (Revised)

### Trade Mechanics
```
DIRECT TRADE SYSTEM

Standard Trades (<2,000g value):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ No fee
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Both players must be present
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Trade window confirmation
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ 30-second trade lock (anti-scam)

High-Value Trades (‚â•2,000g value):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 2% fee total (1% per party)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Prevents AH bypass on major trades
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Value calculated at vendor sell price
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Fee deducted from currency side

Trade Window:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 4 item slots per side
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Currency field
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Hover-to-inspect items
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Both parties must accept
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ 5-second confirmation countdown
```

### Trade Limitations
```
TRADE RESTRICTIONS

New Account Restrictions (First 7 Days):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 500 gold value cap per day (currency + items)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Item value = vendor sell price
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Cannot list on Auction House
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Cannot receive mail with attachments
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Can receive gold (for legitimate gifting)

Anti-Exploit Measures:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Trade logging (all transactions recorded)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Suspicious activity flagging (>10 trades/hour)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Value disparity warning (>50% difference)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Temporary trade lock for flagged accounts
```

## C. NPC Vendors

### Vendor Types
```
VENDOR CATEGORIES

GENERAL MERCHANTS
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Location: Every settlement
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Stock: T1-T2 consumables, basic equipment
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Prices: Fixed
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Refresh: Always available

SPECIALIST VENDORS  
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Location: Major hubs
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Stock: T2-T3 equipment, recipes, bags
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Prices: Fixed with reputation discount
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Refresh: Weekly rotation

FACTION VENDORS
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Location: Faction strongholds
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Stock: Faction-specific equipment, cosmetics
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Prices: Faction currency
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Requirements: Reputation thresholds

DYNAMIC MATERIAL VENDORS (See Section IV)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Location: Trade hubs
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Stock: T1-T3 crafting materials
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Prices: Supply/demand adjusted
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Limits: 50 per material per day
```

### Reputation Discounts
```
VENDOR REPUTATION SYSTEM

Reputation Level | Discount | Additional Benefits
-----------------|----------|---------------------
Neutral          | 0%       | Basic access
Friendly         | 5%       | Extended stock
Honored          | 10%      | Rare items available
Revered          | 15%      | Unique cosmetics
Exalted          | 20%      | Legendary recipes
```

---

# IV. DYNAMIC PRICING SYSTEM

## A. Material Vendor Pricing

### Core Formula
```
DYNAMIC PRICE CALCULATION

Base Price √ó Demand Modifier √ó Supply Modifier = Current Price

Demand Modifier:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Low purchases (bottom 25%): 0.85x
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Average purchases (middle 50%): 1.0x
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ High purchases (top 25%): 1.20x
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Extreme purchases (top 5%): 1.30x
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Cap: 0.70x minimum, 1.30x maximum (¬±30%)

Supply Modifier:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ After major event/content: 0.90x (flooding prevention)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Standard period: 1.0x
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Content drought: 1.10x
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Dynamically calculated server-wide

Reset Mechanics:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Daily: 10% regression toward baseline
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Weekly: 50% regression toward baseline
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Cap reached: 72-hour freeze at cap
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Cooldown: 5-minute between purchases per player
```

### Example Pricing
```
T2 CERAMITE SHARDS - BASELINE 25g

Scenario 1: Low Demand Week
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Demand Modifier: 0.85x
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Supply Modifier: 1.0x
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Price: 25 √ó 0.85 = 21g (16% discount)

Scenario 2: High Demand (New Content)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Demand Modifier: 1.25x
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Supply Modifier: 0.90x (flooding prevention)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Price: 25 √ó 1.25 √ó 0.90 = 28g (12% markup)

Scenario 3: Extreme Demand
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Demand Modifier: 1.30x (capped)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Supply Modifier: 1.0x
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Price: 25 √ó 1.30 = 32g (28% markup, at cap)
```

## B. Regional Price Variation

### Zone-Based Modifiers
```
REGIONAL ECONOMY ZONES

CORE WORLDS (Avalos Prime, Sept Worlds)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Base prices: 1.0x
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Waypoint cost: 50g base
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Supply: Abundant
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Specialty: Finished goods

INDUSTRIAL ZONES (Forge Worlds, Manufactorums)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Base prices: 0.85x for metals/tech
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Base prices: 1.20x for organics
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Waypoint cost: 100-150g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Specialty: Manufacturing materials

FRONTIER ZONES (Contested, Wilderness)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Base prices: 1.25x for all
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Waypoint cost: 300-500g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Supply: Scarce
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Specialty: Rare materials, unique finds

WAR ZONES (Active Conflict)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Base prices: 1.40x for consumables
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Base prices: 0.75x for salvage (abundant)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Waypoint cost: 200-400g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Specialty: Military salvage, combat supplies
```

### Arbitrage Opportunities
```
DESIGNED ARBITRAGE ROUTES

Route: Forge World ‚Üí Core World
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Buy: T2 Metals at 21g (0.85x)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Travel: 150g waypoint
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Sell: T2 Metals at 25g (1.0x)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Profit per unit: 4g - (150g √∑ quantity)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Break-even: 38 units
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Viable: Yes, for bulk traders

Route: War Zone ‚Üí Core World  
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Buy: Salvage at 19g (0.75x)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Travel: 400g waypoint
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Sell: Salvage at 25g (1.0x)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Profit per unit: 6g - (400g √∑ quantity)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Break-even: 67 units
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Viable: Marginal, risk-reward

Design Intent:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Small profits encourage engagement
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Travel costs prevent infinite arbitrage
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Requires capital investment
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Creates merchant player role
```

---

# V. WAYPOINT TRAVEL COSTS (Defined)

## A. Base Costs
```
WAYPOINT PRICING TABLE

Within Same Region:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Adjacent waypoint: 50g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 2 waypoints away: 75g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 3+ waypoints: 100g
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Faction discount: -10% for controlled territory

Cross-Region Travel:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Core ‚Üí Core: 100g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Core ‚Üí Industrial: 150g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Core ‚Üí Frontier: 300g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Core ‚Üí War Zone: 250g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Industrial ‚Üí Frontier: 200g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Any ‚Üí Hostile Faction: +50% surcharge

Special Locations:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Neutral Stations: 150g from anywhere
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Event Zones: 100g (subsidized)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Raid Staging: 200g (group discount 25%)
```

## B. Travel Sinks Purpose
```
TRAVEL COST DESIGN GOALS

Goal 1: Gold Sink (9% of weekly sinks)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Average player: 600g/week on travel
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Active explorer: 1,200g/week
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Sufficient sink without punishing

Goal 2: Regional Economy Support
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Arbitrage break-even requires planning
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Not free to constantly price-check
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Encourages local market engagement

Goal 3: Decision Points
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Walk or waypoint? (Time vs gold)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Plan route or impulse travel?
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Group travel discount encourages socialization
```

---

## A. Tier Costs
```
EQUIPMENT COSTS BY TIER (Revised T5)

Tier | Craft Cost | Market Range | Vendor Value
-----|------------|--------------|-------------
T1   | 50g        | 30-80g       | 15g
T2   | 200g       | 150-350g     | 60g
T3   | 600g       | 500-1,000g   | 180g
T4   | 2,000g     | 1,800-3,500g | 600g
T5   | 5,500g     | 5,000-8,000g | 1,500g
Leg  | 15,000g    | 15,000-50,000g | Cannot sell

FULL SET COSTS (8 pieces)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T1 Set: 400g (craft) / 240-640g (market)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T2 Set: 1,600g / 1,200-2,800g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T3 Set: 4,800g / 4,000-8,000g  
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T4 Set: 16,000g / 14,400-28,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T5 Set: 35,000g / 32,000-52,000g (REVISED from 60k)
```

## B. Economic Progression Timeline
```
PLAYER GEAR PROGRESSION (Revised)

Hours Played | Expected Gear | Net Worth Target
-------------|---------------|------------------
10           | Full T2       | 2,500g
25           | Mixed T2/T3   | 6,000g
50           | Full T3       | 15,000g
100          | Mixed T3/T4   | 35,000g
150          | Full T4       | 55,000g
200          | Mixed T4/T5   | 80,000g
300          | Full T5       | 120,000g
500+         | Legendary     | 200,000g+

Weekly Net Accumulation:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Casual (10 hrs): 3,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Moderate (20 hrs): 6,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Dedicated (30+ hrs): 10,000g

Weeks to Full T5 (Revised):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Casual: ~12 weeks (was 42!)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Moderate: ~6 weeks
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Dedicated: ~4 weeks
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Status: ACHIEVABLE
```

# VII. MONEY FLOW DIAGRAM

```
                    GOLD SOURCES
                         ‚îÇ
    ‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îº‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê

‚îÇ (35%)   ‚îÇ      ‚îÇ    (25%)     ‚îÇ      ‚îÇ   (20%)   ‚îÇ
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¨‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò      ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¨‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò      ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¨‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò

     ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îº‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò
                        ‚îÇ
                        ‚ñº
              ‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê
              ‚îÇ  PLAYER WALLET  ‚îÇ
              ‚îÇ   (100% input)  ‚îÇ
              ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¨‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò
                       ‚îÇ
    ‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îº‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê
    ‚îÇ         ‚îÇ        ‚îÇ        ‚îÇ         ‚îÇ
    ‚ñº         ‚ñº        ‚ñº        ‚ñº         ‚ñº
‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê ‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê ‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê ‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê ‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê
‚îÇ  AH   ‚îÇ ‚îÇRepair ‚îÇ ‚îÇTravel‚îÇ ‚îÇCraft ‚îÇ ‚îÇ NPC   ‚îÇ
‚îÇ Fees  ‚îÇ ‚îÇ Costs ‚îÇ ‚îÇ Fees ‚îÇ ‚îÇ Fees ‚îÇ ‚îÇVendors‚îÇ
‚îÇ (18%) ‚îÇ ‚îÇ (15%) ‚îÇ ‚îÇ (9%) ‚îÇ ‚îÇ(10%) ‚îÇ ‚îÇ (13%) ‚îÇ
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¨‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¨‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¨‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¨‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¨‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò
    ‚îÇ         ‚îÇ        ‚îÇ        ‚îÇ         ‚îÇ
    ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¥‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¥‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¥‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò
                       ‚îÇ
                       ‚ñº
              ‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê

                       ‚ñº

              ‚îÇ    ECONOMY     ‚îÇ
              ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò

NET PLAYER RETENTION: 35% (3,000g/week casual)
```

# VIII. VENDOR INVENTORIES

## A. General Merchant
```
GENERAL MERCHANT INVENTORY

Always Available:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Basic Rations (T1): 10g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Stimm Pack (T1): 15g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Standard Ammunition: 5g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Repair Kit (Minor): 25g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Map Fragment: 50g

Rotating Stock (Weekly):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T1 Weapon (random): 80g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T1 Armor (random): 60g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T2 Consumable (random): 75g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Recipe: Basic (random): 100g

Refresh: Rotating stock changes Monday 00:00 UTC
```

## B. Specialist Vendors
```
SPECIALIST VENDOR - WEAPONSMITH

Stock (Reputation Gated):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Neutral: T2 Weapons, Basic Mods
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Friendly: T3 Weapons, Standard Mods  
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Honored: T3 Weapons (all), Quality Mods
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Revered: T4 Weapons (limited), Rare Mods
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Exalted: Legendary Recipes

Prices:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T2 Weapon: 300g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T3 Weapon: 800g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T4 Weapon: 3,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Legendary Recipe: 10,000g + materials

Refresh: Full stock, always available at rep level
```

## C. Dynamic Material Vendor
```
DYNAMIC MATERIAL VENDOR

Stock: All T1-T3 crafting materials
Limit: 50 of each material per day per player
Cooldown: 5 minutes between purchases of same material

Price Range (T2 Example):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Minimum (0.70x): 17g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Baseline (1.0x): 25g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Maximum (1.30x): 32g

Stock Display:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Current price (updates real-time)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 24-hour price graph
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Server demand indicator (Low/Med/High)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Your daily purchases remaining
```

---

# IX. TRADE EXPLOIT PREVENTION

## A. Anti-Manipulation Systems
```
MARKET MANIPULATION PREVENTION

Price Manipulation:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Cap: ¬±30% from baseline
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 72-hour cooldown at cap
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Coordinated buying detection
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 5-minute purchase cooldown per material

Wash Trading Prevention:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Same-account trades blocked
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ IP flagging for suspicious patterns
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Trade velocity limits (10/hour warning, 20/hour lock)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Review queue for flagged accounts

Market Cornering Prevention:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Daily purchase limits (50 per material)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ AH listing caps (30 per character)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Buyout caps per item category (10% of listings)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Price history transparency
```

## B. RMT Prevention
```
RMT COUNTERMEASURES

Account Restrictions:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ New accounts: 500g value/day for 7 days
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Cannot list on AH for 7 days
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Mail restrictions (no attachments for 7 days)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Trade flagging for value disparity

Detection Systems:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Currency velocity tracking
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Trade pattern analysis
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Account relationship mapping
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Unusual wealth accumulation alerts

Penalties:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ First offense: 72-hour trade suspension + warning
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Second offense: Permanent trade restriction
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Third offense: Account termination
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ RMT seller: Immediate termination + IP flag
```

```
ECONOMIC PROGRESSION MILESTONES

Level 5 (2 hrs):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ First crafted item
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Understand vendor system
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ ~200g accumulated
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Milestone: Buy first bag upgrade (100g)

Level 10 (5 hrs):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ AH access unlocked
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Basic trading knowledge
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ ~500g accumulated
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Milestone: First AH purchase

Level 15 (10 hrs):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Regional travel unlocked
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Faction vendor access
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ ~1,500g accumulated
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Milestone: Full T2 equipment

‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Specialist vendor access (Friendly rep)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Recipe crafting available
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ ~4,000g accumulated
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Milestone: First T3 piece

Level 30 (50 hrs):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Cross-region trading viable
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Honored with home faction
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ ~15,000g accumulated
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Milestone: Full T3 equipment

‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ High-end market participation
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Revered with home faction
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ ~35,000g accumulated
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Milestone: First T4 pieces

Level 50 (150+ hrs):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Full market access
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Exalted reputation achievable
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ ~55,000g+ accumulated
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Milestone: Full T4, starting T5
```

```
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ "Philanthropist" - Donate 50,000g to faction

‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ "Artisan" - Sell 100 crafted items
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ "Master Crafter" - Sell T5 crafted item
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ "Supplier" - Sell 1,000 materials
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ "Legendary Forger" - Craft legendary item
```

# XI. INFLATION MONITORING

## A. Health Metrics
```
ECONOMY HEALTH INDICATORS

Track Weekly:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Total gold in circulation
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Average player wealth by level bracket
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ AH transaction volume and average prices
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Sink effectiveness (actual vs target)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Material price deviation from baseline

Alert Thresholds:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Gold supply growth >5%/month: WARNING
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Gold supply growth >10%/month: INTERVENTION
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Average T3 price up >20%: WARNING
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Sink rate below 55%: WARNING
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ New player wealth below milestone targets: URGENT

Intervention Options:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Increase sink costs (temporary)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Introduce limited-time gold sinks (events)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Reduce drop rates temporarily
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Release new content with high sink costs
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Emergency: Gold value reset (last resort, never used)
```

## B. Sink Effectiveness Tracking
```
SINK MONITORING DASHBOARD

Daily Tracking:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Repair gold removed
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ AH fees collected
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Waypoint gold removed
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Consumable vendor sales
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Crafting fees collected
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Faction donations received

Weekly Report:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Total gold generated
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Total gold removed
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Net change in gold supply
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Per-capita wealth change
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Sink ratio achieved vs target

Monthly Adjustment Review:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ If inflation detected: Increase sinks 5-10%
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ If deflation detected: Decrease sinks 5-10%
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ If balanced: No change
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ All changes gradual (2-3 weeks implementation)
```

# XII. CROSS-SYSTEM INTEGRATION

## A. Combat ‚Üî Economy
```
COMBAT ECONOMIC INTEGRATION

Reward Scaling by Difficulty:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Normal: Base gold (150/hr)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Hard: 1.5x gold (225/hr) - Requires T3 gear
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Elite: 2x gold (300/hr) - Requires T4 gear
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Nightmare: 2.5x gold (375/hr) - Requires T5 gear

Repair Cost Scaling:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T1 gear: 5g full repair
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T2 gear: 20g full repair
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T3 gear: 60g full repair
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T4 gear: 150g full repair
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T5 gear: 300g full repair
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Death penalty: 50% repair cost

Consumable Integration:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Hard mode: T2 consumables recommended
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Elite mode: T3 consumables expected
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Nightmare: T4 consumables required
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Creates steady consumable sink
```

## B. Progression ‚Üî Economy
```
PROGRESSION ECONOMIC INTEGRATION

Reputation ‚Üí Discounts:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 5% per tier above requirement
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Maximum 25% (Exalted on Friendly items)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Affects vendor prices only
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Does not affect AH or player trades

Reputation ‚Üí Access:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Friendly: T3 vendor stock
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Honored: T3+ vendor stock, rare recipes
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Revered: T4 limited stock, unique consumables
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Exalted: Legendary recipes, exclusive cosmetics

Donation ‚Üí Reputation (Revised):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Gold donation: 1 rep per 10g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Item donation: (Vendor sell value √ó 0.1) rep
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Material donation: (Material value √ó 0.1) rep
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Weekly cap: 500 rep from donations
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Prevents circular discount exploitation
```

# XIII. IMPLEMENTATION CHECKLIST

```
PRE-LAUNCH REQUIREMENTS

‚ñ° T5 costs reduced (35,000g set, not 60,000g)
‚ñ° Direct trade fee implemented (2% above 2,000g)
‚ñ° Waypoint costs defined and implemented
‚ñ° Material vendor cooldown (5 min) active
‚ñ° Price variance capped at ¬±30%
‚ñ° Ork Teef decay reduced to 0.25%/week
‚ñ° New account restrictions include item value cap
‚ñ° Sink monitoring dashboard operational
‚ñ° AH fee structure (1% listing, 8% sale) implemented
‚ñ° Reputation donation formula clarified

POST-LAUNCH MONITORING

‚ñ° Week 1: New player milestone tracking
‚ñ° Week 2: AH vs direct trade volume comparison
‚ñ° Week 4: First inflation check
‚ñ° Month 2: Sink effectiveness review
‚ñ° Month 3: First balance pass if needed
‚ñ° Month 6: Comprehensive economy review
```

# XIV. ECONOMY SUMMARY

| System | Status | Key Metric |
|--------|--------|------------|
| Currency Flow | ‚úì Balanced | 65% sink rate |
| Auction House | ‚úì Designed | 9% total fees |
| Direct Trade | ‚úì Protected | 2% fee >2k |
| NPC Vendors | ‚úì Tiered | Rep discounts to 20% |
| Dynamic Pricing | ‚úì Bounded | ¬±30% cap |
| Regional Economy | ‚úì Defined | Waypoints 50-500g |
| T5 Progression | ‚úì Revised | 35k set cost |
| Inflation Control | ‚úì Monitored | Dashboard + alerts |
| Exploit Prevention | ‚úì Multi-layer | Trade limits + detection |

*"The Emperor's coin flows like blood through the Imperium - and like blood, it must be kept circulating."*
‚Äî Rogue Trader Proverb

DECISION: economy_complete
üîÄ Routing Decision: ECONOMY_COMPLETE
Decision "ECONOMY_COMPLETE" matched connection condition
‚Üí Next Stage: market_simulator
Market Simulator
Simulates and validates economic balance
completed
Agent: market_simulator
Type: reviewer
Duration: 117.3s
Execution #: 11
Prompt Size: 1,343 chars
Output Size: 15,886 chars
üì• AGENT PROMPT (1,343 characters)
You are an economic analyst who simulates game economies to find imbalances, exploits, and inflation risks before they reach players.

When reviewing economy designs:
- Simulate player behavior (hoarding, trading, farming)
- Model money supply growth over time
- Identify infinite money exploits or loops
- Test price points against earning rates
- Verify economic milestones are achievable
- Check for dead-end resources (nothing to spend on)
- Analyze cross-system impacts (combat rewards ‚Üí economy ‚Üí progression)

Run mental simulations for:
- New player (first 10 hours)
- Mid-game player (50-100 hours)
- Endgame player (200+ hours)

Provide:
1. SIMULATION RESULTS: What happens over time?
2. EXPLOITS FOUND: Any infinite loops or broken mechanics
3. BALANCE ISSUES: Prices too high/low, rewards too generous/stingy
4. RECOMMENDATIONS: Specific number adjustments
5. VERDICT: APPROVED, NEEDS_TUNING, or BROKEN

=== ROUTING DECISION REQUIRED ===
After your response, you MUST choose exactly ONE decision from:
- approved: Economy validated, inform combat design
- needs_tuning: Economic imbalance found, retune
- resource_issue: Resource design causes economic problems

**CRITICAL**: Your VERY LAST LINE must be exactly:
DECISION: [ONE_OF_THE_ABOVE_CHOICES]
Example: DECISION: approved
Do NOT add explanations after the decision keyword.
üì§ AGENT OUTPUT (15,886 characters)
# Economic Simulation Analysis Report
## Warhammer 40,000: Imperium Divided - Economy Validation

---

# I. SIMULATION RESULTS

## A. New Player Simulation (First 10 Hours)

```
HOUR-BY-HOUR PROGRESSION SIMULATION

Hour 0-2 (Levels 1-5):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Gold Earned: ~400g (drops + quests)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Gold Spent: ~150g (basic consumables, first death)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Net: 250g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Status: On track for 200g milestone ‚úì

Hour 2-5 (Levels 5-10):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Gold Earned: ~900g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Gold Spent: ~400g (T1 upgrades, travel, repairs)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Net: 750g (cumulative: 1,000g)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Status: AH access unlocked, milestone achieved ‚úì

Hour 5-10 (Levels 10-15):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Gold Earned: ~1,500g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Gold Spent: ~1,000g (T2 gear purchases, consumables)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Net: 1,500g (cumulative: 2,000g)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Expected Target: 1,500g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Status: SLIGHTLY AHEAD OF TARGET ‚úì

10-Hour Summary:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Total Earned: ~2,800g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Total Spent: ~1,550g (55% sink rate)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Net Worth: ~2,000-2,500g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Gear: Full T2 achievable ‚úì
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Milestone Achievement: 100%
```

**New Player Verdict: HEALTHY** - Early game feels rewarding without being overwhelming.

## B. Mid-Game Player Simulation (50-100 Hours)

```
MID-GAME ECONOMIC STATE (50 Hours)

Weekly Income (20 hrs/week player):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Combat Drops: 3,000-4,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Quest Rewards: 2,000-3,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Vendoring: 1,600-2,400g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Daily/Weekly: 1,000-1,500g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Total Gross: ~8,500g/week

Weekly Expenses:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ AH Fees (5 purchases avg): 600g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Repairs: 800g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Travel: 500g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Consumables: 1,200g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Crafting: 500g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Total Sinks: ~3,600g (42% - BELOW TARGET)

Net Gain: ~4,900g/week

50-Hour Checkpoint:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Expected Net Worth: 15,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Simulated Net Worth: ~18,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Gear Status: Full T3 achievable
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Status: RUNNING AHEAD OF CURVE
```

```
MID-GAME ECONOMIC STATE (100 Hours)

Accumulated Wealth Projection:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Weeks 1-3: 14,700g net
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Weeks 4-5: 9,800g net (T4 purchases begin)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Total at 100 hours: ~40,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Target: 35,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Status: 14% ABOVE TARGET

‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 75 hours: First T4 pieces (mixed T3/T4)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 100 hours: 4-5 T4 pieces
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Status: ON TRACK ‚úì
```

**Mid-Game Verdict: SLIGHTLY GENEROUS** - Sink rate dropping below 65% target.

## C. Endgame Player Simulation (200+ Hours)

```
ENDGAME ECONOMIC STATE (200 Hours)

Weekly Income (30 hrs/week dedicated):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Combat (Nightmare mode): 11,250g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Quest Rewards: 4,500g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Vendoring: 3,600g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Weekly Bonuses: 2,250g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Total Gross: ~21,600g/week
```
