‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ AH Fees (high-end trading): 2,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Repairs (T5 gear, deaths): 1,800g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Travel (war zones): 1,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Consumables (T4 required): 2,400g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Crafting (T5 materials): 1,500g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Total Sinks: ~8,700g (40% - SIGNIFICANTLY BELOW TARGET)

Net Gain: ~12,900g/week

200-Hour Checkpoint:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Expected Net Worth: 80,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Simulated Net Worth: ~95,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Status: 19% ABOVE TARGET - INFLATION RISK
```

```
LONG-TERM ENDGAME (500+ Hours)

Projected Wealth Accumulation:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ By 300 hours: ~170,000g (target: 120,000g) +42%
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ By 500 hours: ~350,000g (target: 200,000g) +75%
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ By 1000 hours: ~800,000g (no target)

Issue Identified:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Endgame sink rate: 40%
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Target sink rate: 65%
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Gap: 25 percentage points
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Result: GOLD ACCUMULATION EXCEEDS DESIGN
```

**Endgame Verdict: INFLATIONARY PRESSURE** - Dedicated players accumulate faster than intended.

---

# II. EXPLOITS FOUND

## A. Confirmed Exploits

### Exploit #1: Repair Cost Avoidance
```
REPAIR BYPASS LOOP

Mechanic:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Death penalty: 50% repair cost
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Full repair T5: 300g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Death repair: 150g

Exploit:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Die intentionally at 99% durability
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Pay 150g instead of 300g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Savings: 150g per full cycle

Severity: LOW
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Time cost makes it impractical
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Loss of progress/time
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Social stigma in group content
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Recommendation: No change needed
```

### Exploit #2: Cross-Region Price Arbitrage Scaling
```
BULK ARBITRAGE CALCULATION

Intended Design:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Small profits for engaged players
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Travel costs prevent infinite arbitrage

Reality Check:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Forge World metal: 21g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Core World price: 25g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Travel cost: 150g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Break-even: 38 units
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Daily limit: 50 units
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Daily profit: (50-38) √ó 4g = 48g

Issue: With multiple characters (8 max account):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Daily profit: 48g √ó 8 = 384g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Time required: ~30 minutes
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Gold/hour: 768g/hour
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Standard farming: 200g/hour

Severity: MEDIUM
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 3.8x more efficient than intended
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Requires alt investment
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Creates "merchant alt" meta
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Recommendation: Per-account daily limits, not per-character
```

### Exploit #3: Reputation Donation Loop
```
DONATION REPUTATION EXPLOIT

Current System:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Gold donation: 1 rep per 10g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Weekly cap: 500 rep
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Max donation cost: 5,000g/week

Cross-Reference with Discounts:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Exalted: 20% vendor discount
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Revered to Exalted: ~6,000 rep
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Weeks to Exalted (donations only): 12 weeks
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Total donation cost: 60,000g

Payback Calculation:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Weekly vendor purchases (endgame): ~5,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 20% savings: 1,000g/week
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ ROI period: 60 weeks
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Status: NOT EXPLOITABLE - ROI too long ‚úì
```

### Exploit #4: Ork Teef Hoarding
```
ORK CURRENCY ANALYSIS

Current System:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Weekly cap: None (intentional)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Decay: 0.25%/week
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Floor: 100 Teef minimum

Simulation (Dedicated Ork Player):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Weekly Teef earned: ~800
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Weekly Teef spent: ~400 (gambling, Mek)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Net accumulation: 400/week

After 1 Year:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Gross accumulation: 20,800 Teef
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Decay loss: ~3,120 Teef (15%)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Net Teef: ~17,680

Issue: No weekly cap + low decay = massive stockpiles
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Ork economy inflates relative to others
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Cross-faction trades become imbalanced
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ "Teef whales" dominate Ork markets

Severity: MEDIUM
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Faction-specific
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Thematic (Orks hoard)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Affects cross-faction balance
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Recommendation: Implement weekly soft cap of 1,000 Teef
```

## B. Potential Exploits (Theoretical)

### Theoretical #1: Multi-Account Gold Transfer
```
GOLD TRANSFER EXPLOIT CHECK

Restriction: 500g/day for 7 days (new accounts)
Max transferable to mule: 3,500g

Cost to RMT seller:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Account creation time
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 7-day wait period
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Risk of detection
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Return: 3,500g

Assessment: ADEQUATELY PROTECTED
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Low reward for effort
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Detection systems in place
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ No change needed
```

### Theoretical #2: AH Fee Bypass
```
AH VS DIRECT TRADE COMPARISON

AH Fees: 9% total
Direct Trade Fees: 2% (above 2,000g)

High-Value Trade (10,000g item):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ AH cost: 900g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Direct trade cost: 200g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Savings: 700g

Potential Issue:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Players may never use AH for expensive items
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ AH becomes low-value only
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Discovery (price transparency) suffers

Severity: LOW-MEDIUM
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Direct trade requires trust
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ AH provides convenience + buyer protection
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 7% premium is reasonable for service
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Recommendation: Monitor AH usage patterns post-launch
```

---

# III. BALANCE ISSUES

## A. Sink Rate Deficit

```
SINK RATE ANALYSIS BY PLAYER PHASE

Target Sink Rate: 65%

Actual Simulated Rates:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ New Player (0-10 hrs): 55% - ACCEPTABLE
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Mid-Game (50-100 hrs): 42% - LOW
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Endgame (200+ hrs): 40% - CRITICALLY LOW

Gap Analysis:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Mid-game gap: 23 percentage points
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Endgame gap: 25 percentage points
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Result: ~6,000g/week excess retention (endgame)
```

**Root Cause Analysis:**
1. **Repair costs don't scale with income** - T5 repairs (300g) vs Nightmare income (375g/hr)
2. **Travel becomes trivial** - 500g waypoints vs 21,600g weekly income
3. **Consumable costs plateau** - T4 consumables don't increase proportionally

## B. T5 Gear Accessibility (Revised Assessment)

```
T5 GEAR TIMELINE CHECK

Design Document Claims:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Casual (10 hrs/week): 12 weeks to full T5
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Moderate (20 hrs/week): 6 weeks
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Dedicated (30+ hrs/week): 4 weeks

Simulation Results:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Casual: 35,000g √∑ 3,000g/week = 11.7 weeks ‚úì
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Moderate: 35,000g √∑ 6,000g/week = 5.8 weeks ‚úì
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Dedicated: 35,000g √∑ 10,000g/week = 3.5 weeks ‚úì

Status: T5 PROGRESSION CORRECTLY TUNED ‚úì
```

## C. Regional Economy Imbalance

```
REGIONAL PROFIT ANALYSIS

War Zone ‚Üí Core (Salvage Route):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Buy: 19g (0.75x)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Travel: 400g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Sell: 25g (1.0x)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Per unit: 6g profit
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Break-even: 67 units
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Daily limit: 50 units
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Result: UNPROFITABLE (17 units short)

Issue: War Zone arbitrage is designed but non-functional
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Appears as opportunity
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Math doesn't work
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Player frustration when discovered

Severity: LOW
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Doesn't break economy
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Creates player confusion
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Recommendation: Reduce travel cost to 250g or increase salvage discount to 0.65x
```

## D. Consumable Economy Gap

```
CONSUMABLE TIER ANALYSIS

Required Consumables by Difficulty:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Hard mode: T2 consumables (75g each)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Elite mode: T3 consumables (150g each)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Nightmare: T4 consumables (300g each)

Hourly Consumable Consumption (Nightmare):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Stimms: 2-3/hour = 600-900g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Ammunition: 4-5/hour = 1,200-1,500g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Repair kits: 1/hour = 300g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Total: 2,100-2,700g/hour

Nightmare Income: 375g/hour base

CRITICAL ISSUE:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Consumable cost: 2,100-2,700g/hour
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Base income: 375g/hour
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Net: NEGATIVE 1,725-2,325g/hour

Wait - this contradicts earlier calculations...

RECALCULATING NIGHTMARE INCOME:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Document says 375g/hour (2.5x of 150g)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ But total endgame gross is 21,600g/week @ 30 hrs
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ That's 720g/hour gross

Resolution: Combat drops (150g ‚Üí 375g @ Nightmare) is only ONE source
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 375g/hour combat + other sources ‚âà 720g/hour
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Still negative vs consumable requirements

SEVERITY: HIGH
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Nightmare mode may be economically unplayable
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Hardcore content gates behind consumable cost
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Creates "farm lower content" meta
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Recommendation: Consumable costs need revision OR drop rate increase
```

---

# IV. RECOMMENDATIONS

## A. Critical Fixes (Required Before Launch)

### Fix #1: Endgame Sink Rate
```
PROPOSED SINK ADJUSTMENTS

Current Endgame Sinks: ~8,700g/week (40%)
Target Endgame Sinks: ~14,000g/week (65%)
Gap to Close: ~5,300g/week

Adjustments:

1. Scaling Repair Costs
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Current T5 full repair: 300g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Proposed: 500g + 50g per death
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Reasoning: 67% increase, scales with content
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Weekly impact: +400g

2. War Zone Entry Fee (Non-Refundable Portion)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Current: 25 tokens (refunded on completion)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Proposed: 25 tokens + 100g (gold non-refundable)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Reasoning: War content should have gold cost
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Weekly impact: +500g (assuming 5 war zone runs)

3. T4-T5 Consumable Crafting Fees
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Current crafting fee: ~10% of sink
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Proposed: High-tier consumable crafting fee 50g each
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Reasoning: Creates decision point (buy vs craft)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Weekly impact: +600g

4. Endgame Gold Sink Service: "Blessed Enhancements"
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ New system: Temporary buffs for gold
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 500g for 2-hour enhancement
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Reasoning: Optional but powerful sink
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Weekly impact: +1,500g (3 sessions)

5. Increased Travel for Endgame Content
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Raid staging: 200g ‚Üí 400g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Nightmare dungeon entry: New 150g fee
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Weekly impact: +800g

Total Additional Sinks: +3,800g/week
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ New sink rate: ~58%
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Remaining gap: 7% (acceptable variance)
```

### Fix #2: Consumable Cost Rebalancing
```
CONSUMABLE ECONOMY FIX

Current Issue: Nightmare consumables exceed income

Option A: Reduce Consumable Costs
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T4 consumables: 300g ‚Üí 150g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Hourly cost: 2,100g ‚Üí 1,050g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Net with income: -330g/hour (still negative)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Status: INSUFFICIENT

Option B: Increase Nightmare Rewards
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Base income: 375g/hour ‚Üí 600g/hour
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ With other sources: ~950g/hour
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Net vs consumables: ~-1,150g/hour
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Status: STILL INSUFFICIENT

Option C: Consumable Drop Rate Increase (RECOMMENDED)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Add consumable drops to Nightmare content
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Drop rate: 1 T4 consumable per 15 minutes
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Value recovered: 4 √ó 300g = 1,200g/hour
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Net: +150-450g/hour profit
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Status: SUSTAINABLE ‚úì

Recommendation: Implement Option C
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Thematic: Harder content = better supplies found
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Economic: Self-sustaining loop
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Engagement: Reduces farm-lower-content behavior
```

### Fix #3: Arbitrage Per-Account Limits
```
ARBITRAGE LIMIT CHANGE

Current: 50 materials/day per character
Exploit: 8 characters √ó 50 = 400 materials/day

Proposed: 50 materials/day per account (shared)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Eliminates alt-army arbitrage
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Preserves single-character gameplay
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Reduces gold/hour from 768 to 96

Implementation Note:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Track purchases at account level
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Display "Account Daily Limit: X/50"
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Reset at daily server reset time
```

## B. Recommended Adjustments (High Priority)

### Adjustment #1: Ork Teef Weekly Soft Cap
```
ORK CURRENCY BALANCING

Current: No weekly cap, 0.25% decay
Issue: Infinite accumulation potential

Proposed Soft Cap System:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ First 500 Teef/week: Full value
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 501-750 Teef/week: 75% value
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 751-1000 Teef/week: 50% value
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 1001+ Teef/week: 25% value

Effect:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Casual Ork: No change
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Dedicated Ork: 500 + 187 + 125 + 50 = 862 effective max
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Maintains "wild" Ork economy theme
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Prevents infinite stockpiling
```

### Adjustment #2: War Zone Travel Cost
```
WAR ZONE ARBITRAGE FIX

Current: 400g travel, 67 units break-even, 50 unit cap
Result: Route mathematically impossible to profit

Option A: Reduce Travel
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 400g ‚Üí 250g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Break-even: 42 units
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Profit: (50-42) √ó 6g = 48g/day
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Status: Marginally viable ‚úì

Option B: Increase Discount
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Salvage 0.75x ‚Üí 0.65x
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Profit: 25g - 16g = 9g/unit
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Break-even: 44 units
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Profit: (50-44) √ó 9g = 54g/day
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Status: Marginally viable ‚úì

Recommendation: Option A (simpler)
```

## C. Monitoring Requirements (Post-Launch)

```
CRITICAL METRICS TO TRACK

Week 1:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ New player milestone achievement rate (target: >90%)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Average time to full T2 (target: 8-12 hours)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ AH listing volume (baseline establishment)

Week 4:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Sink rate by player bracket
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Gold supply growth rate (target: <5%/month)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T3 equipment price stability (¬±10%)

Month 3:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Endgame wealth distribution (Gini coefficient)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Regional price variance (should be 10-30%)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Cross-faction currency exchange rates

Intervention Triggers:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Sink rate drops below 50%: Increase service costs 10%
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Gold supply growth >7%/month: Emergency sink event
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T5 prices deflate >20%: Reduce drop rates
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ New player dropout >30% at 10-hour mark: Ease early costs
```

---

# V. COMPREHENSIVE ISSUE SUMMARY

| Issue | Severity | Impact | Status |
|-------|----------|--------|--------|
| Endgame sink rate (40% vs 65%) | HIGH | Inflation | NEEDS FIX |
| Nightmare consumable costs | HIGH | Content gating | NEEDS FIX |
| Multi-char arbitrage | MEDIUM | Exploit | NEEDS FIX |
| Ork Teef accumulation | MEDIUM | Faction imbalance | NEEDS FIX |
| War Zone arbitrage broken | LOW | Design intent | NEEDS FIX |
| AH vs Direct Trade gap | LOW | Market behavior | MONITOR |
| Repair bypass | LOW | Minimal impact | ACCEPT |
| T5 gear timeline | NONE | Correct | VALIDATED ‚úì |
| New player experience | NONE | Correct | VALIDATED ‚úì |

---

# VI. VERDICT

## Assessment: **NEEDS_TUNING**

The economy design is fundamentally sound with excellent new player pacing and achievable progression milestones. However, critical issues must be addressed:

**Blocking Issues (Must Fix):**
1. Endgame sink rate is 25 percentage points below target - will cause inflation within 3-6 months
2. Nightmare mode consumable costs exceed income by ~1,700g/hour - makes endgame content economically irrational
3. Per-character arbitrage limits enable 3.8x exploit with alt armies

**Non-Blocking Issues (Should Fix):**
4. Ork Teef unlimited accumulation will create faction economy imbalance
5. War Zone arbitrage route is mathematically unprofitable despite being designed as viable

**Validated Systems:**
- T5 gear timeline correctly tuned
- New player progression on target
- AH fee structure appropriate
- Dynamic pricing bounds reasonable
- RMT prevention adequate

The economy cannot ship without fixes #1-3. With the recommended adjustments, this design will support a healthy long-term economy.

---

DECISION: needs_tuning
üîÄ Routing Decision: NEEDS_TUNING
Decision "NEEDS_TUNING" matched connection condition
‚Üí Next Stage: economy_designer
Economy Designer
Designs trading, markets, and economic systems
completed
Agent: economy_designer
Type: designer
Duration: 206.4s
Execution #: 12
Prompt Size: 1,233 chars
Output Size: 31,248 chars
üì• AGENT PROMPT (1,233 characters)
You are an economy designer who creates engaging and balanced market systems. You work with resources designed by the Resource Designer to create trading, shops, auctions, and player-to-player economies.

When designing economy systems:
- Design NPC vendor systems (fixed prices vs. dynamic)
- Create auction house / player trading mechanics
- Establish price ranges and money sinks
- Design economic progression (what can players afford when?)
- Plan for inflation prevention
- Create supply-demand dynamics
- Design regional economy differences (prices vary by location)
- Integrate with combat rewards and progression costs

Output should include:
- Market system mechanics (how trading works)
- Pricing formulas and ranges
- Money flow diagrams (sources and sinks)
- Vendor inventories and refresh timers
- Player trading limitations (prevent exploits)
- Economic milestones by player level/progression

=== ROUTING DECISION REQUIRED ===
After your response, you MUST choose exactly ONE decision from:
- economy_complete: Submit economy for simulation

**CRITICAL**: Your VERY LAST LINE must be exactly:
DECISION: [ONE_OF_THE_ABOVE_CHOICES]
Example: DECISION: economy_complete
Do NOT add explanations after the decision keyword.
üì§ AGENT OUTPUT (31,248 characters)
Looking at the simulation results, I need to design an economy system that addresses the identified issues while maintaining the solid foundation from the resource design. Let me create a comprehensive economy design.

---

# Economy Systems Design Document
## Warhammer 40,000: Imperium Divided - Damocles Gulf Sector

---

# I. MARKET PHILOSOPHY

Following Guild Wars 1's approach: **markets should facilitate play, not become the game**. Players engage with economic systems to enhance their combat experience, not as an end unto themselves.

**Core Principles:**
- Trading is a tool, not a profession
- Price transparency prevents exploitation
- Regional markets create interesting choices
- Sinks scale with wealth, not just activity

---

# II. NPC VENDOR SYSTEMS

## A. Vendor Types

### 1. General Merchants (Fixed Pricing)
Present in all settlements. Sell basic consumables, materials, and utility items.

```
GENERAL MERCHANT INVENTORY

Category         | Items                      | Price Model
-----------------|----------------------------|-------------
Basic Consumables| T1-T2 Stimms, Rations      | Fixed
Ammunition       | Infinite, all types        | Fixed (free)
Repair Supplies  | Repair Kits                | Fixed
Basic Materials  | T1 crafting materials      | Fixed
Travel Items     | Waystones, Beacons         | Fixed

Price Stability: 100% (never changes)
Stock: Unlimited
```

### 2. Specialty Merchants (Semi-Dynamic)
Faction-specific vendors with rotating stock and reputation discounts.

```
SPECIALTY MERCHANT SYSTEM

Mechanic: Base price modified by reputation tier
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Neutral: 100% price (no discount)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Friendly: 95% price
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Honored: 90% price
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Revered: 85% price
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Exalted: 80% price

Stock Rotation:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Common items: Always available
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Uncommon items: 75% chance, 6-hour refresh
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Rare items: 25% chance, 24-hour refresh
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Exotic items: 5% chance, weekly refresh

Inventory Examples:

ECCLESIARCHY MERCHANT (Imperial/Avalos)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Blessed Unguents (T2 Consumable): 50g base
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Purity Seals (cosmetic): 200g base
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Saint's Relics (T3 Material): 150g base
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Sacred Texts (lore unlock): 500g base
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Rotating: Blessed Weapons, Holy Artifacts

EARTH CASTE SUPPLIER (Tau)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Targeting Matrices (T2 Consumable): 50g base
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Drone Components (T2 Tech): 25g base
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Nano-Repair Paste: 75g base
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Rotating: Prototype Gear, Experimental Items

MEK SHOP (Ork)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Stikkbomz (consumable): 30 Teef
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Kustom Parts (T2 Tech): 50 Teef
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Squig Juice (healing): 20 Teef
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Rotating: Kustom Jobs, Looted Gear
```

### 3. War Quartermasters (Requisition Currency)
Military equipment vendors accepting Requisition Tokens.

```
WAR QUARTERMASTER INVENTORY

Tier | Items                          | Requisition Cost
-----|--------------------------------|------------------
T2   | Standard Military Weapons      | 50-100 tokens
T3   | Veteran Equipment              | 150-250 tokens
T4   | Elite Military Gear            | 400-600 tokens
T5   | Commander's Arsenal            | 1000-1500 tokens

Restrictions:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Faction rank requirements
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Some items require specific achievements
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Weekly purchase limits on T4-T5 (prevents token hoarding)
```

### 4. Black Market Dealers (Dynamic Pricing)
Cross-faction traders in neutral zones with supply/demand pricing.

```
BLACK MARKET MECHANICS

Location: Neutral settlements only
Hours: Available 24/7 but prices shift every 4 hours

Price Formula:
Base Price √ó Supply Modifier √ó Demand Modifier √ó Faction Modifier

Supply Modifier (based on recent sales to vendor):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Oversupplied (>200% normal): 0.75x buy price
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Normal supply: 1.0x
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Undersupplied (<50% normal): 1.25x buy price

Demand Modifier (based on recent purchases from vendor):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ High demand (>200% normal): 1.35x sell price
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Normal demand: 1.0x
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Low demand (<50% normal): 0.80x sell price

Faction Modifier (your faction's standing):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Hostile faction goods: +15% premium
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Allied faction goods: -5% discount

Price Bounds:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Minimum: 50% of base
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Maximum: 200% of base
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Change rate: Max ¬±10% per 4-hour cycle
```

---

# III. AUCTION HOUSE SYSTEM

## A. Structure

### Regional Auction Houses
Separate markets per region prevent instant arbitrage while allowing dedicated traders to profit.

```
AUCTION HOUSE REGIONS

Region          | Primary Trade           | Price Tendency
----------------|-------------------------|---------------
Core Worlds     | Reference point         | 1.0x baseline
Forge Worlds    | Metals, Tech            | 0.8x metals, 1.2x organics
Frontier Worlds | Organics, Consumables   | 0.8x organics, 1.2x metals
War Zones       | Salvage, Requisition    | 0.65x all*, 1.3x consumables
Tau Space       | Tau goods only          | 0.9x Tau, 1.5x Imperial
Ork Territory   | Ork goods, gambling     | 0.7x everything**, high variance

* War Zone discount reflects battlefield salvage
** Ork economy is inherently cheaper but chaotic
```

### Listing Mechanics
```
AUCTION HOUSE LISTING

Listing Fee: 3% of listing price (non-refundable)
Sale Fee: 6% of sale price (on successful sale)
Total Fee: 9% (5% listing + 10% sale reduced to 3% + 6%)

Duration Options:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 6 hours: Base fee
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 24 hours: 1.25x fee
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 72 hours: 1.5x fee
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ 7 days: 2x fee

Listing Limits:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Per character: 30 active listings
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Per account: 100 active listings
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Premium (earned): +20 listings
```

### Buyout vs. Bidding
```
AUCTION TYPES

Buyout Only: Instant purchase at fixed price
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Default option
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 90% of all listings
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Simpler, faster

Auction Style: Bidding with optional buyout
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Minimum bid starts at 50% of buyout
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Bid increments: 5% minimum
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Anti-snipe: Bids in last 5 min extend by 5 min
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Used for rare/valuable items

Reserved: Private listing visible only to specified player
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Same fees apply
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Cannot be searched
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Used for pre-arranged trades
```

## B. Search and Discovery

```
AUCTION HOUSE INTERFACE

Search Filters:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Category (Weapons, Armor, Materials, etc.)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Subcategory (Lasgun, Bolter, Plasma, etc.)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Tier (T1-T5, Legendary)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Price Range (min-max)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Time Remaining
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Faction Affiliation
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Stat Filters (damage, armor, etc.)

Sort Options:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Price (low-high, high-low)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Time Remaining
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Recently Listed
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Most Bids

Price History:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Shows last 30 days of sales
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Average, min, max prices
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Volume traded
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Trend indicator (rising/falling/stable)
```

## C. Fee Structure (Revised)

Addressing the simulation concern about AH vs Direct Trade:

```
REVISED FEE COMPARISON

Auction House:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Listing fee: 3%
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Sale fee: 6%
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Total: 9%
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Benefits: Price discovery, buyer protection, convenience

Direct Trade:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Fee: 3% flat (up from 2%)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Minimum fee: 100g (prevents micro-trade spam)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Benefits: Privacy, negotiation

Result: AH premium reduced to 6% over direct trade
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Still incentivizes AH use for small/medium trades
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Direct trade viable for large known-buyer trades
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Prevents AH abandonment for high-value items
```

---

# IV. PLAYER-TO-PLAYER TRADING

## A. Direct Trade

```
DIRECT TRADE SYSTEM

Initiation: Target player ‚Üí Trade Request
Distance: Within 50 meters
Duration: 5-minute timeout

Trade Window:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Your Offer (left panel)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Their Offer (right panel)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Gold input field
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Lock/Unlock toggle
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Accept button (both must accept)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Cancel button

Safety Features:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 5-second confirmation delay after both lock
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Item tooltips visible in trade window
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Warning for valuable items (<1000g difference from AH avg)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Screenshot confirmation option
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Trade log stored for 30 days

Restrictions:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Account-bound items cannot be traded
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Soulbound items show warning
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 3% fee on gold transfers (collected from sender)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Minimum 100g fee for any trade involving gold
```

## B. Mail System Trading

```
COD (CASH ON DELIVERY) MAIL

Mechanic:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Attach items to mail
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Set COD price
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Recipient pays price to receive items
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Sender receives payment minus 5% fee

Limits:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Max 12 attachments per mail
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Max 50,000g COD price
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Mail expires after 7 days (items returned)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Fee paid by sender on successful delivery

Use Cases:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Trades when both parties aren't online
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Pre-arranged purchases
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Cross-region delivery (no travel needed)
```

## C. Trading Limitations (Anti-Exploit)

```
TRADE LIMITATIONS

New Account Restrictions (First 14 days):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Max trade value: 1,000g/day
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ AH listing limit: 10
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Cannot receive mail gold
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Cannot use COD system
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Flagged for RMT review if limits approached

Account-Wide Limits:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Material arbitrage: 50 units/day/account (not per character)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Gold mail limit: 10,000g/day sent
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Trade frequency: Max 20 trades/hour
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ AH sales: 500,000g/day before soft cap

Value Discrepancy Detection:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Trades >10x market value flagged for review
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Repeated 1g trades to same player flagged
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Large gold-only trades (>5000g, no items) logged
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Pattern detection for split trades
```

---

# V. PRICING FORMULAS

## A. Base Price Calculations

```
ITEM BASE PRICE FORMULA

Equipment:
Base Price = (Material Cost √ó 1.2) + (Tier Multiplier √ó 100) + Rarity Bonus

Material Cost = Sum of (Material Qty √ó Material Vendor Price)
Tier Multiplier = Tier¬≤ (T1=1, T2=4, T3=9, T4=16, T5=25)
Rarity Bonus = 0/100/500/2000/10000 (Common to Legendary)

Example - T3 Rare Lasgun:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Materials: 150g worth
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Tier: 3¬≤ √ó 100 = 900g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Rarity: 500g
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Base Price: (150 √ó 1.2) + 900 + 500 = 1,580g

Consumables:
Base Price = (Material Cost √ó 1.1) + (Effect Value √ó Duration Modifier)

Effect Value: Damage buff = 2g per 1% per second
Duration Modifier: Instant = 5x, 30sec = 3x, 60sec = 2x, 5min = 1x

Example - T2 Stimm Pack (+15% damage, 30 sec):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Materials: 20g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Effect: 15 √ó 30 √ó 2 = 900 effect points √∑ 30 = 30g
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Base Price: (20 √ó 1.1) + 30 = 52g (rounded to 50g)
```

## B. Dynamic Price Bounds

```
MARKET PRICE BOUNDS

Player Market (AH):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Minimum list price: 10% of NPC vendor buy price
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Maximum list price: 1000% of base price
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Practical range: 50%-200% of base price
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Prices outside 50-200% flagged as unusual

NPC Dynamic Vendors:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Minimum: 50% of base
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Maximum: 200% of base
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Change rate: ¬±10% per cycle (4 hours)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Influenced by server-wide supply/demand

Emergency Price Floors:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ If item average drops below 20% of base for 7 days
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ NPC vendor buy price increases to 25% of base
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Creates artificial demand floor
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Prevents total market collapse of item categories
```

## C. Repair Cost Formula (Revised - Addressing Sink Issue)

```
REPAIR COST FORMULA (UPDATED)

Old Formula: Base Repair = Item Base Price √ó 0.05
New Formula: Base Repair = (Item Base Price √ó 0.08) + (Tier √ó 50)

Death Penalty Multiplier (unchanged at 50%)

Example - T5 Weapon (Base Price 5,000g):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Old full repair: 5000 √ó 0.05 = 250g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ New full repair: (5000 √ó 0.08) + (5 √ó 50) = 400 + 250 = 650g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Death repair: 325g
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Increase: 160% (addresses endgame sink deficit)

Weekly Repair Impact (Dedicated Player):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Old: ~1,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ New: ~2,600g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Additional sink: +1,600g/week
```

---

# VI. MONEY FLOW DIAGRAM

```
                    ‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê
                    ‚îÇ                    GOLD SOURCES                         ‚îÇ

                                             ‚ñº
                                   ‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê

          ‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¨‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¨‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¥‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¨‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¨‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê
          ‚ñº               ‚ñº             ‚ñº         ‚ñº             ‚ñº             ‚ñº
    ‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê   ‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê  ‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê ‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê ‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê ‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê

                    ‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê
                    ‚îÇ                     GOLD SINKS                          ‚îÇ
                    ‚îÇ              Target: 65% of Income                      ‚îÇ
                    ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò
```

## A. Source Breakdown

```
GOLD SOURCES (Per 100g Generated Server-Wide)

Combat Drops:        35g  ‚îÇ‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà
Quest Rewards:       25g  ‚îÇ‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà
Vendor Sales:        20g  ‚îÇ‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà
AH Sales:            10g  ‚îÇ‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà
Daily/Weekly:         7g  ‚îÇ‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà
Events:               3g  ‚îÇ‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà

Notes:
- Combat drops scale with difficulty
- Quest rewards are one-time (story) or repeatable (faction)
- Vendor sales represent material/item vendoring
- AH sales are gold from other players, not new gold creation
```

## B. Sink Breakdown (Revised)

```
GOLD SINKS (Per 100g Available Player Income)

Repairs (scaled):    25g  ‚îÇ‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà
Services (NEW):      20g  ‚îÇ‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà
Vendor Purchases:    20g  ‚îÇ‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà
Crafting Fees:       13g  ‚îÇ‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà
AH Fees:             12g  ‚îÇ‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà
Travel Costs:        10g  ‚îÇ‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà
‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ
Target Total:        65g  ‚îÇSink rate target achieved

SERVICE SINKS (New Category):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Blessed Enhancements: Temporary buffs (500g/2 hours)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Elite Content Entry: Nightmare dungeon fee (150g)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Raid Staging: Increased staging costs (400g)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Faction Donations: Weekly contribution
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Cosmetic Services: Transmog, name changes, etc.
```

---

# VII. ENDGAME GOLD SINKS (Addressing Simulation Findings)

## A. Blessed Enhancements System (New)

```
BLESSED ENHANCEMENTS

Concept: Optional temporary buffs purchased from faction NPCs
Location: Capital cities, war zone staging areas
Duration: 2 hours OR until death

Enhancement Tiers:

TIER 1 - Minor Blessings (200g):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ +5% movement speed
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ +5% experience gain
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ +5% gold find
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ +5% material find

TIER 2 - Standard Blessings (500g):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ +10% damage
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ +10% damage reduction
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ +10% healing effectiveness
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ +10% cooldown reduction

TIER 3 - Greater Blessings (1,000g):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ +15% all stats
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ +20% specific stat (choice)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ +25% faction reputation gain
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Death prevention (once per blessing)

Design Intent:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Powerful but not required
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Dedicated players use 2-3 per session = 1,500-3,000g/session
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Scales gold sink with wealth (rich players buy more often)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Creates meaningful gold/power tradeoff
```

## B. Elite Content Entry Fees (New)

```
ELITE CONTENT GOLD COSTS

Nightmare Dungeons:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Entry fee: 150g (per player)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Wipe respawn fee: 50g (after 3rd wipe)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Completion bonus: Consumable drops worth 400-600g
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Net with good play: +250g
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Net with struggle: -200g to -400g

Raid Content:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Staging fee: 400g (per player)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Repair stations in raid: 100g per use
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Victory bonus: Crafting materials + 500-1000g
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Creates group responsibility for performance

Design Intent:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Elite content has gold cost AND gold reward
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Skilled play is profitable
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Struggling creates natural progression gate
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Prevents "carried" gold farming
```

## C. Scaled Travel Costs

```
TRAVEL COST SCALING

Base Waypoint Cost: 10g + (Distance Factor √ó 5g)

Modifiers:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Same region: 1.0x
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Adjacent region: 1.5x
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Distant region: 2.0x
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Cross-faction territory: 3.0x
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ War zone destination: 2.5x

Examples:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Within Core World: 10g + 15g = 25g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Core to Frontier: 10g + 30g = 40g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Core to War Zone: (10g + 25g) √ó 2.5 = 87g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Imperial to Tau space: (10g + 40g) √ó 3 = 150g

Endgame Impact:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ War zone travel: ~80-150g per trip
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Dedicated player: 5-10 war zone trips/week
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Weekly travel sink: 400-1,500g (up from 500g)
```

---

# VIII. CONSUMABLE ECONOMY (Addressing Nightmare Deficit)

## A. Nightmare Consumable Drops (New)

```
NIGHTMARE MODE CONSUMABLE DROPS

Standard Enemies (Nightmare):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T3 Consumable: 8% drop rate (up from 2%)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T4 Consumable: 3% drop rate (new)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Expected: 1 T4 consumable per 15 minutes

Elite Enemies (Nightmare):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T3 Consumable: 25% drop rate
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T4 Consumable: 10% drop rate
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Expected: 1-2 T4 consumables per elite

Boss Enemies (Nightmare):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T3 Consumable: 100% (2-3 guaranteed)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T4 Consumable: 50% (1-2)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Expected: 3-4 consumables per boss

HOURLY CONSUMABLE ECONOMY (Nightmare):

Consumption:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T4 Stimms used: 2-3 (600-900g value)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T4 Ammunition: 4-5 (1,200-1,500g value)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Repair usage: 1 (300g value)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Total Consumed: ~2,100-2,700g

Recovery from Drops:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T4 drops: 4/hour √ó 300g = 1,200g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T3 drops: 8/hour √ó 150g = 1,200g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Total Recovered: 2,400g

Net Consumable Cost: -300g to +300g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Skilled play: Net positive
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Average play: Break even
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Struggling: Net negative (appropriate)
```

## B. Consumable Crafting Fees (New)

```
HIGH-TIER CONSUMABLE CRAFTING

New Fee Structure:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T1-T2 Consumables: No crafting fee (unchanged)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T3 Consumables: 25g crafting fee
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T4 Consumables: 50g crafting fee
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ T5 Consumables: 100g crafting fee

Design Intent:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Creates buy vs craft decision
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Crafting still cheaper than vendor
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Provides additional gold sink
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T4: 50g fee vs 300g vendor = 83% savings
```

---

# IX. VENDOR INVENTORIES & REFRESH

## A. General Merchant (Always Available)

```
GENERAL MERCHANT INVENTORY

CONSUMABLES:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Stimm Pack (T1): 10g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Combat Drugs (T1): 10g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Rations: 5g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Basic Medkit: 25g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Blessed Unguent (T2): 50g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Targeting Matrix (T2): 50g
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Standard Ammunition: Free (infinite)

UTILITY:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Waystone (temp respawn): 100g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Repair Kit (25%): 50g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Repair Kit (100%): 175g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Bag Slot (15 slots): 2,000g
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Material Storage Upgrade: 5,000g

MATERIALS (T1 Only):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Iron Ore / Refined Alloy: 5g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Grox Hide / Synth-Leather: 5g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Promethium Cell / Power Cell: 5g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Cogitator Parts / Circuit Wafer: 5g
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ All T1 materials available, buy only
```

## B. Specialty Merchants (Rotating Stock)

```
SPECIALTY MERCHANT REFRESH

Refresh Schedule:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Common items: Never rotate (always available)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Uncommon items: 6-hour rotation
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Rare items: 24-hour rotation
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Exotic items: Weekly rotation (server reset)

Inventory Slots:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Always available: 10 slots
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Uncommon rotation: 5 slots (3-4 active)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Rare rotation: 3 slots (1 active usually)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Exotic rotation: 1 slot (rarely active)

Example - Mechanicus Tech-Adept:

ALWAYS AVAILABLE:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Incense (rep consumable): 25g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Servo-Skull Core (T2 Tech): 25g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Blessed Oil (repair bonus): 75g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Data-Wafer (lore item): 100g
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Cogitator Upgrade (utility): 500g

ROTATING UNCOMMON (6hr):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Rare Mechanism (T3 Tech): 150g [75% appear]
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Archeotech Sensor (utility): 300g [75% appear]
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Machine Spirit Blessing: 250g [75% appear]

ROTATING RARE (24hr):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ STC Fragment (T4 Tech): 1,000g [25% appear]
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Archeotech Weapon Part: 2,000g [25% appear]

ROTATING EXOTIC (Weekly):
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Relic Component: 10,000g [5% appear]
```

## C. War Quartermaster (Requisition Currency)

```
WAR QUARTERMASTER INVENTORY

Faction: Astra Militarum

ALWAYS AVAILABLE:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Standard Lasgun (T2): 50 Requisition
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Flak Armor Set (T2): 75 Requisition
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Combat Knife (T2): 25 Requisition
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Frag Grenades (x10): 15 Requisition
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Field Rations (x20): 10 Requisition

RANK-GATED:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ [Corporal] Hotshot Lasgun (T3): 150 Requisition
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ [Sergeant] Carapace Armor (T3): 200 Requisition
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ [Lieutenant] Plasma Pistol (T4): 400 Requisition
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ [Captain] Artificer Armor (T4): 500 Requisition
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ [Colonel] Master-Crafted Weapon (T5): 1,000 Requisition

WEEKLY LIMITS:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T4 items: 2 per week
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T5 items: 1 per week
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Resets at weekly server reset
```

---

# X. ECONOMIC PROGRESSION MILESTONES

## A. New Player (Hours 0-20)

```
ECONOMIC MILESTONES: NEW PLAYER

Hour 2 (Level 5):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Expected gold: ~200g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Can afford: Full T1 gear from vendors
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Milestone unlock: Access to Auction House
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Achievement: "First Steps" (gold reward: 50g)

Hour 5 (Level 10):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Expected gold: ~500g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Can afford: Some T2 gear from AH
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Milestone unlock: Direct trading enabled
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Achievement: "Trader" (gold reward: 100g)

Hour 10 (Level 15):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Expected gold: ~1,500g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Can afford: Full T2 gear
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Milestone unlock: Material Storage unlocked
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Achievement: "Equipped" (gold reward: 200g)

Hour 20 (Level 20):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Expected gold: ~4,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Can afford: First T3 piece
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Milestone unlock: Crafting mastery tier 1
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Status: Ready for mid-game
```

## B. Mid-Game Player (Hours 20-100)

```
ECONOMIC MILESTONES: MID-GAME

Hour 30:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Expected gold: ~8,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Can afford: 2-3 T3 pieces
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Milestone: First faction reputation tier
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Unlock: Specialty merchant discounts (5%)

Hour 50:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Expected gold: ~15,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Can afford: Full T3 gear
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Milestone: Hard mode content accessible
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Unlock: Crafting mastery tier 2

Hour 75:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Expected gold: ~25,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Can afford: First T4 piece
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Milestone: Second faction reputation tier
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Unlock: Specialty merchant discounts (10%)

Hour 100:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Expected gold: ~35,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Can afford: 4-5 T4 pieces
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Milestone: Elite mode content accessible
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Status: Ready for endgame
```

## C. Endgame Player (Hours 100+)

```
ECONOMIC MILESTONES: ENDGAME

Hour 150:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Expected gold: ~55,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Can afford: Full T4 gear
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Milestone: Nightmare mode accessible
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Unlock: Blessed Enhancements (Tier 2)

Hour 200:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Expected gold: ~75,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Can afford: First T5 piece
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Milestone: Third faction reputation tier (Revered)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Unlock: Specialty merchant discounts (15%)

Hour 300:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Expected gold: ~110,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Can afford: 3-4 T5 pieces
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Milestone: Raid content accessible
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Unlock: Blessed Enhancements (Tier 3)

Hour 500+:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Expected gold: ~180,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Can afford: Full T5 gear
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Milestone: Exalted reputation (all factions possible)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Status: Wealth cap approaching, cosmetics/prestige focus
```

## D. Wealth Soft Caps

```
WEALTH MANAGEMENT AT CAP

Design Philosophy: Extreme wealth should be difficult to maintain

Soft Cap Mechanisms:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Above 200,000g: Donation tier unlocks (cosmetic titles for giving)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Above 300,000g: "Tithe" event access (expensive group content)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Above 500,000g: Legendary crafting projects (10,000-50,000g each)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Above 1,000,000g: "Patron" status (fund server events, named NPCs)

Prestige Purchases (Gold Sinks for Wealthy):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Guild hall upgrades: 25,000-100,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Personal quarters customization: 5,000-50,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Unique mount variants: 15,000-75,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Legacy titles: 50,000g+
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Donation plaques (permanent, server-wide visible): 100,000g+
```

---

# XI. REGIONAL ECONOMY MECHANICS

## A. Price Variance by Region

```
REGIONAL PRICE MODIFIERS

                    Metals  Organics  Tech  Energy  Consumables
Core Worlds         1.0x    1.0x      1.0x  1.0x    1.0x
Forge Worlds        0.8x    1.2x      0.85x 0.9x    1.1x
Frontier Worlds     1.2x    0.8x      1.1x  1.0x    0.85x
War Zones           0.65x   0.65x     0.65x 0.65x   1.3x
Tau Space           1.3x    0.9x      0.7x  0.8x    1.0x
Ork Territory       0.7x*   0.7x*     0.7x* 0.7x*   0.9x

* Ork prices are base lower but have ¬±20% random variance
```

## B. Arbitrage System (Fixed)

```
ARBITRAGE MECHANICS (REVISED)

Per-Account Daily Limits:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Cross-region material transport: 50 units/account/day
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Tracks across all characters
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Resets at daily server reset
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Cannot be circumvented by mail

Travel Cost Reduction (Fixing War Zone Route):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ War Zone travel: 400g ‚Üí 250g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Makes war zone arbitrage viable

Example Route (War Zone ‚Üí Core):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Buy price (War Zone): 25g √ó 0.65 = 16.25g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Travel cost: 250g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Sell price (Core): 25g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Profit per unit: 8.75g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Break-even: 29 units
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Daily capacity: 50 units
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Daily profit: (50-29) √ó 8.75g = 184g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Time investment: ~30 minutes
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Gold/hour: ~368g

Assessment:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Comparable to standard farming (~300-400g/hour)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Requires knowledge and planning
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Rewards engaged players without being exploitative
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Status: BALANCED ‚úì
```

## C. Regional Events Affecting Prices

```
DYNAMIC REGIONAL EVENTS

Event: War Zone Escalation
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Trigger: High PvP activity in war zone
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Effect: Consumable prices +20% in region
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Duration: 4-8 hours
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Creates demand spike, rewards stockpilers

Event: Forge World Production Surge
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Trigger: Crafting milestone (server-wide)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Effect: Metal prices -15% in Forge Worlds
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Duration: 24 hours
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Rewards material sellers in other regions

Event: Xenos Incursion
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Trigger: Story event or admin-triggered
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Effect: Travel costs +50% to affected region
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Duration: Variable (event-based)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Creates economic pressure, narrative integration
```

---

# XII. FACTION ECONOMY INTEGRATION

## A. Ork Economy Fixes

```
ORK TEEF SYSTEM (REVISED)

Weekly Soft Cap Implementation:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 0-500 Teef earned: 100% value
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 501-750 Teef earned: 75% value
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 751-1,000 Teef earned: 50% value
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 1,001+ Teef earned: 25% value

Effective Weekly Maximum:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Raw: 500 + 187 + 125 + (‚àû √ó 0.25)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Practical cap: ~900 effective Teef/week
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Prevents infinite accumulation
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Maintains "wild" Ork feel

Decay (Unchanged):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 0.25% weekly decay
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Floor: 100 Teef minimum
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Thematic: Teef rot

Cross-Faction Exchange:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Teef can be converted to Imperial Thrones
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Rate: 1 Teef = 3-5 Thrones (variable)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Only at Black Market dealers
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Daily limit: 200 Teef converted
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Prevents Teef from dominating all-faction economy
```

## B. Tau Economy

```
TAU INTERNAL ECONOMY

Unity Marks (Cross-Caste Currency):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Earned: Cooperative activities, auxiliary integration
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Spent: Multi-caste equipment, cultural items
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Weekly cap: 300 (promotes diverse play)

Earth Caste Crafting Bonus:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Group crafting: 10% material discount when crafting near other Earth Caste
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Drone assistants: Each assigned drone reduces craft cost 2% (max 10%)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Creates social crafting hubs

Fire Caste Honor Economy:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Honor Bonds cannot be traded
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Earned through combat excellence
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Spent on military equipment
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Creates separate progression track from gold
```

## C. Imperial Economy

```
IMPERIAL INTERNAL ECONOMY

Ecclesiarchy Tithe System:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Optional gold donations to shrines
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 1 Piety Mark per 10g donated
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Weekly cap: 500 Piety Marks
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ ROI: Slow but provides unique rewards

Mechanicus Data-Tithe:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 10% of Data-Tithes earned must be "uploaded"
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Creates community pool for shared bonuses
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Players can see contribution leaderboards
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Top contributors get special recognition

Militarum Requisition Economy:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Requisition earned through military content
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Cannot be traded between players
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Weekly maintenance: Rank √ó 25 Requisition
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Creates "use it or lose it" pressure
```

---

# XIII. INFLATION PREVENTION

## A. Active Gold Sinks

| Sink Category | Target % of Income | Mechanism |
|---------------|-------------------|-----------|
| Repairs | 25% | Scaled formula (new) |
| Services | 20% | Blessed Enhancements, content fees |
| Vendor Purchases | 20% | Consumables, materials |
| Crafting Fees | 13% | Base fee + high-tier fees |
| AH Fees | 12% | Listing + sale |
| Travel | 10% | Distance-scaled costs |
| **Total** | **65%** | Target sink rate |

## B. Passive Gold Removal

```
PASSIVE GOLD SINKS

Maintenance Costs:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Equipment durability loss: Passive over time
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Faction rank upkeep: Weekly fee based on rank
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Guild costs: Shared among members
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Bank fees: Storage beyond free limit

Event-Based Sinks:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Donation drives: Competitive giving for titles
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Server events: Entry fees for special content
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ War zone campaigns: Contribution costs
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Cosmetic releases: New prestige items

Emergency Valves:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ If gold supply grows >7%/month: Trigger sink event
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ If top 1% holds >20% of wealth: Luxury tax items
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ If T5 prices drop >20%: Reduce drop rates
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Automatic rebalancing based on metrics
```

## C. Supply Controls

```
GOLD GENERATION CONTROLS

Per-Activity Caps:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Quest rewards: Fixed, one-time (story) or daily/weekly cooldown
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Vendoring: Natural limit based on inventory space
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Combat drops: Diminishing returns after 4 hours/day
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ AH sales: 500,000g/day soft cap

Diminishing Returns (Combat Gold):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Hours 0-2: 100% drop rate
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Hours 2-4: 100% drop rate
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Hours 4-6: 75% drop rate
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Hours 6-8: 50% drop rate
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Hours 8+: 25% drop rate
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Resets at daily server reset

Design Intent:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Prevents no-life gold farming advantage
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Rewards consistent play over marathon sessions
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Creates healthy play patterns
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Doesn't punish occasional long sessions (still profitable)
```

---

# XIV. SUMMARY: SIMULATION ISSUE RESOLUTIONS

| Issue Identified | Solution Implemented | Expected Result |
|------------------|---------------------|-----------------|
| Endgame sink rate (40% vs 65%) | Scaled repairs, Blessed Enhancements, content fees | 65% target achieved |
| Nightmare consumable costs | T4 consumable drops in Nightmare mode | Break-even to profitable |
| Multi-char arbitrage | Per-account daily limits (50 units) | Reduced to 96g/hour |
| Ork Teef accumulation | Weekly soft cap system | ~900 effective max/week |
| War Zone arbitrage broken | Travel cost reduced to 250g | 184g/day viable profit |
| AH vs Direct Trade gap | Raised direct trade fee to 3% + 100g minimum | 6% AH premium (acceptable) |

---

# XV. IMPLEMENTATION PRIORITY

**Phase 1 (Launch Critical):**
1. Scaled repair cost formula
2. Per-account arbitrage limits
3. AH fee structure (revised)
4. Regional price modifiers

**Phase 2 (Week 1-4):**
1. Blessed Enhancements system
2. Elite content entry fees
3. Ork Teef soft cap
4. Nightmare consumable drops

**Phase 3 (Month 2+):**
1. Regional dynamic events
2. Prestige purchases
3. Emergency economic valves
4. Advanced monitoring systems

---

*"In the grim darkness of the far future, there is only economic policy."*

---

DECISION: economy_complete
üîÄ Routing Decision: ECONOMY_COMPLETE
Decision "ECONOMY_COMPLETE" matched connection condition
‚Üí Next Stage: market_simulator
Market Simulator
Simulates and validates economic balance
completed
Agent: market_simulator
Type: reviewer
Duration: 120.1s
Execution #: 13
Prompt Size: 1,343 chars
Output Size: 1,261 chars
üì• AGENT PROMPT (1,343 characters)
You are an economic analyst who simulates game economies to find imbalances, exploits, and inflation risks before they reach players.

When reviewing economy designs:
- Simulate player behavior (hoarding, trading, farming)
- Model money supply growth over time
- Identify infinite money exploits or loops
- Test price points against earning rates
- Verify economic milestones are achievable
- Check for dead-end resources (nothing to spend on)
- Analyze cross-system impacts (combat rewards ‚Üí economy ‚Üí progression)

Run mental simulations for:
- New player (first 10 hours)
- Mid-game player (50-100 hours)
- Endgame player (200+ hours)

Provide:
1. SIMULATION RESULTS: What happens over time?
2. EXPLOITS FOUND: Any infinite loops or broken mechanics
3. BALANCE ISSUES: Prices too high/low, rewards too generous/stingy
4. RECOMMENDATIONS: Specific number adjustments
5. VERDICT: APPROVED, NEEDS_TUNING, or BROKEN

=== ROUTING DECISION REQUIRED ===
After your response, you MUST choose exactly ONE decision from:
- approved: Economy validated, inform combat design
- needs_tuning: Economic imbalance found, retune
- resource_issue: Resource design causes economic problems

**CRITICAL**: Your VERY LAST LINE must be exactly:
DECISION: [ONE_OF_THE_ABOVE_CHOICES]
Example: DECISION: approved
Do NOT add explanations after the decision keyword.
üì§ AGENT OUTPUT (1,261 characters)
### **VERDICT: NEEDS_TUNING**

**Summary:**
The economy design is fundamentally sound with strong foundations following Guild Wars 1 philosophy. New player and mid-game experiences are well-paced. However, several issues prevent approval:

1. **Two exploits require immediate fixes** (Reserved AH for RMT, Price Floor manipulation)
2. **Endgame sink rate 18-22% over target** causing gold starvation
3. **Ork faction suffers 48-51% currency disadvantage** creating faction imbalance
4. **Multi-account arbitrage vulnerability** exists in mail system

**What Works Well:**
- No infinite loops detected
- New player onboarding (Hours 0-20) excellent
- AH fee structure creates appropriate friction
- Regional price variance adds strategic depth
- Consumable economy self-sustaining in Nightmare

**Required Before Approval:**
1. Close Reserved AH listing exploit
2. Fix Emergency Price Floor manipulation
3. Reduce endgame sink rate to 65-70% range
4. Improve Ork cross-faction currency parity
5. Add new account mail restrictions

**Estimated Tuning Effort:** 8-12 specific number adjustments + 2 feature changes

---

*"The Emperor's accountants have reviewed the ledger. Penance is required before the seal of approval may be granted."*

DECISION: needs_tuning
üîÄ Routing Decision: NEEDS_TUNING
Decision "NEEDS_TUNING" matched connection condition
‚Üí Next Stage: economy_designer
Economy Designer
Designs trading, markets, and economic systems
completed
Agent: economy_designer
Type: designer
Duration: 137.3s
Execution #: 14
Prompt Size: 1,233 chars
Output Size: 22,126 chars
üì• AGENT PROMPT (1,233 characters)
You are an economy designer who creates engaging and balanced market systems. You work with resources designed by the Resource Designer to create trading, shops, auctions, and player-to-player economies.

When designing economy systems:
- Design NPC vendor systems (fixed prices vs. dynamic)
- Create auction house / player trading mechanics
- Establish price ranges and money sinks
- Design economic progression (what can players afford when?)
- Plan for inflation prevention
- Create supply-demand dynamics
- Design regional economy differences (prices vary by location)
- Integrate with combat rewards and progression costs

Output should include:
- Market system mechanics (how trading works)
- Pricing formulas and ranges
- Money flow diagrams (sources and sinks)
- Vendor inventories and refresh timers
- Player trading limitations (prevent exploits)
- Economic milestones by player level/progression

=== ROUTING DECISION REQUIRED ===
After your response, you MUST choose exactly ONE decision from:
- economy_complete: Submit economy for simulation

**CRITICAL**: Your VERY LAST LINE must be exactly:
DECISION: [ONE_OF_THE_ABOVE_CHOICES]
Example: DECISION: economy_complete
Do NOT add explanations after the decision keyword.
üì§ AGENT OUTPUT (22,126 characters)
# Economy Systems Design Document
## Warhammer 40,000: Imperium Divided - Damocles Gulf Sector

---

# I. ECONOMY PHILOSOPHY

Following Guild Wars 1's economic principles: **Trading should be accessible, fair, and support player agency without enabling exploitation.** The economy exists to facilitate player goals, not gatekeep them.

**Core Principles:**
- Player-to-player trading is the heart of the economy
- NPC vendors provide floor/ceiling price anchors
- Multiple currency sinks prevent runaway inflation
- Faction identity creates economic niches, not barriers
- No feature should enable real-money trading (RMT)

---

# II. MARKET SYSTEMS

## A. Auction House (The Commercia)

### Structure
```
AUCTION HOUSE OVERVIEW

Name by Faction:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Imperial: The Commercia
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Tau: Trade Nexus
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Ork: Da Tradin' Post

Access Points:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Major hubs (1 per faction capital)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Outpost terminals (limited functionality)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Field access via consumable (view only)

Listing Types:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Standard Auction (12-48 hour duration)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Buyout Only (instant purchase option)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Bulk Listing (10+ identical items, discounted fees)
```

### Fee Structure
```
AUCTION HOUSE FEES

Action          | Fee Type      | Rate    | Purpose
----------------|---------------|---------|------------------
Listing         | Flat + %      | 5 + 2%  | Spam prevention
Successful Sale | % of Sale     | 8%      | Primary gold sink
Failed Listing  | Flat only     | 5       | Returns 2% deposit
Buyout Premium  | Additional %  | +2%     | Convenience tax
Bulk Discount   | Fee Reduction | -25%    | Reward volume traders

Example: 1000g item with buyout
- Listing fee: 5 + 20 = 25g
- Sale fee: 80g (8%)
- Buyout fee: 20g (2%)
- Total fees: 125g (12.5% effective rate)
```

### Anti-Exploit Measures
```
AUCTION HOUSE PROTECTIONS

REMOVED: Reserved Listings (was exploitable for RMT)
- All listings visible to all players
- No private/reserved auctions

NEW: Suspicious Transaction Detection
- Listings >300% regional average flagged for review
- Repeated max-price purchases between same accounts monitored
- Pattern detection for gold transfer schemes

Price Caps:
- Maximum listing: 500% of vendor value OR 200% of 7-day average
- Minimum listing: 10% of vendor value
- Prevents extreme price manipulation

Account Restrictions:
- New accounts (<72 hours): Cannot list items >100g
- New accounts (<72 hours): Cannot bid on items >500g
- Prevents fresh account arbitrage
```

### Search & Interface
- Filter by: Item type, tier, faction, price range, time remaining
- Sort by: Price, time, quantity, seller reputation
- Watchlist: Track 20 items, get notifications
- Price History: 30-day graphs for common items

## B. Direct Player Trading

### Trade Window
```
DIRECT TRADE SYSTEM

Trade Limits:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Currency per trade: 50,000g maximum
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Items per trade: 12 slots each side
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Trades per hour: 10 maximum
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ New accounts: 5 trades/day for first week

Safety Features:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 5-second confirmation delay
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Item comparison tooltips
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Scam warning for uneven trades (>10:1 value ratio)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Trade history log (30 days)
```

### Mail System
```
MAIL TRADING

UPDATED: New Account Restrictions
- Accounts <7 days old: Cannot send items via mail
- Accounts <7 days old: Cannot send >100g via mail
- Accounts <14 days old: Cannot send >1000g via mail
- Full access after 14 days with verified email

Standard Limits:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Attachments: 8 items + currency per mail
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Currency cap: 25,000g per mail
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Storage: 50 mails maximum
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Expiration: 30 days (returned to sender)

Fees:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Text only: Free
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ With items: 10g flat
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ With currency: 1% (minimum 5g)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Cross-faction: +50% fee
```

## C. Regional Markets

### Price Variance by Location
```
REGIONAL ECONOMY ZONES

Zone Type        | Price Modifier | Supply Focus    | Demand Focus
-----------------|----------------|-----------------|---------------
Capital City     | Base (100%)    | Balanced        | Balanced
Frontier Outpost | +20-30%        | Local materials | Manufactured
War Zone         | +40-60%        | Military goods  | Everything
Contested Region | Variable ¬±50%  | Scavenged       | Consumables
Faction Border   | Cross-faction  | Faction goods   | Opposing goods

Example: Ceramite Shards
- Imperial Capital: 100g base
- Frontier forge world: 120g (local production)
- War zone: 150g (high demand)
- Tau border: 180g (faction premium)
```

### Regional Vendor Inventories
- Vendors stock faction-appropriate items
- Regional specialties at 15% discount
- Foreign goods at 25% markup (if available)
- War zones have limited, rotating stock

---

# III. NPC VENDOR SYSTEMS

## A. Standard Vendors

### Fixed Price Vendors
```
VENDOR CATEGORIES

Equipment Vendors (Fixed Prices):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Basic Equipment (T1-T2): Always available
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Standard Equipment (T3): Level-gated
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Quality Equipment (T4): Reputation-gated
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Elite Equipment (T5): Not sold by vendors

Consumable Vendors (Fixed Prices):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Basic consumables: Always available
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Combat consumables: Level-gated
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Utility consumables: Reputation-gated
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Elite consumables: Crafted only

Material Vendors (Limited Stock):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T1-T2 materials: Unlimited stock
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T3 materials: 20/day per player
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T4 materials: 5/week per player
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ T5 materials: Not sold by vendors
```

### Vendor Pricing Table
```
VENDOR BUY/SELL PRICES

Item Type        | Player Sells | Player Buys | Spread
-----------------|--------------|-------------|--------
T1 Material      | 1g           | 5g          | 5x
T2 Material      | 5g           | 25g         | 5x
T3 Material      | 25g          | 150g        | 6x
T4 Material      | 150g         | 1,000g      | 6.7x
T1 Equipment     | 10g          | 50g         | 5x
T2 Equipment     | 50g          | 250g        | 5x
T3 Equipment     | 200g         | 1,200g      | 6x
T4 Equipment     | 800g         | 6,000g      | 7.5x
T1 Consumable    | 2g           | 10g         | 5x
T2 Consumable    | 10g          | 50g         | 5x
T3 Consumable    | 50g          | 300g        | 6x
T4 Consumable    | 200g         | N/A         | Crafted

Note: Wide spreads intentional - vendors are last resort, 
player trading should always be more attractive.
```

## B. Dynamic Vendors (Specialty)

### Traveling Merchants
```
TRAVELING MERCHANT SYSTEM

Spawn Frequency: 1 per zone, refreshes every 4 hours
Location: Random within zone (announced in zone chat)
Duration: Present for 30 minutes

Inventory:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 3-5 random T3-T4 items
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 1-2 rare consumables
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 1 unique cosmetic (rotates weekly)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Cross-faction materials (premium price)

Prices: 80-120% of base (randomized)
Haggle System: Charisma-adjacent skill reduces prices 5-15%
```

### Faction Quartermasters
```
FACTION VENDOR SYSTEM

Access: Requires faction reputation
Refresh: Weekly (server reset)
Currency: Faction tokens + gold

Inventory Tiers:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Friendly: Basic faction gear, consumables
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Honored: Quality faction gear, recipes
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Revered: Elite faction gear, unique mods
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Exalted: Legendary patterns, cosmetics

Prices scale with reputation:
- Friendly: 100% base price
- Honored: 90% base price
- Revered: 80% base price
- Exalted: 70% base price
```

## C. Vendor Refresh Mechanics

### Stock Refresh Timers
```
VENDOR REFRESH SCHEDULE

Vendor Type      | Personal Reset | Global Reset
-----------------|----------------|---------------
Basic Vendor     | None (unlimited)| None
Material Vendor  | Daily (midnight)| None
Faction Vendor   | Weekly (Monday) | None
Traveling Vendor | N/A            | 4 hours
Event Vendor     | Daily          | Event end
```

---

# IV. MONEY FLOW ANALYSIS

## A. Currency Sources (Per Active Player Per Week)

```
GOLD GENERATION SOURCES

Source              | Casual    | Moderate  | Hardcore
--------------------|-----------|-----------|----------
Quest Rewards       | 2,000g    | 4,000g    | 8,000g
Enemy Drops         | 1,500g    | 3,500g    | 7,000g
Vendoring Items     | 1,000g    | 2,500g    | 5,000g
PvP Rewards         | 500g      | 1,500g    | 4,000g
Daily/Weekly Bonuses| 1,000g    | 1,500g    | 2,000g
--------------------|-----------|-----------|----------
TOTAL WEEKLY        | 6,000g    | 13,000g   | 26,000g
```

## B. Currency Sinks (Per Active Player Per Week)

```
GOLD SINK TARGETS (UPDATED - Reduced from simulator feedback)

Sink Type           | Casual    | Moderate  | Hardcore  | % of Income
--------------------|-----------|-----------|-----------|------------
Waypoint Travel     | 300g      | 600g      | 1,200g    | 5%
Repair Costs        | 600g      | 1,300g    | 2,600g    | 10%
Crafting Fees       | 600g      | 1,300g    | 2,600g    | 10%
Consumable Purchase | 600g      | 1,300g    | 2,600g    | 10%
AH Fees             | 300g      | 650g      | 1,300g    | 5%
NPC Purchases       | 900g      | 1,950g    | 3,900g    | 15%
Faction Services    | 300g      | 650g      | 1,300g    | 5%
Optional Cosmetics  | 300g      | 650g      | 1,300g    | 5%
--------------------|-----------|-----------|-----------|------------
TOTAL WEEKLY SINK   | 3,900g    | 8,450g    | 16,800g   | 65%
NET ACCUMULATION    | 2,100g    | 4,550g    | 9,200g    | 35%
```

## C. Money Flow Diagram

```

‚îÇTravel ‚îÇ  ‚îÇ Repair ‚îÇ  ‚îÇ  AH    ‚îÇ  ‚îÇ Craft ‚îÇ  ‚îÇ  NPC   ‚îÇ

‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¨‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò  ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¨‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò  ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¨‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò  ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¨‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò  ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¨‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò
    ‚îÇ          ‚îÇ           ‚îÇ           ‚îÇ          ‚îÇ
    ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¥‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îº‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¥‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò
                           ‚ñº
                  ‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê
                  ‚îÇ   GOLD SINKS   ‚îÇ
                  ‚îÇ (Destroyed)    ‚îÇ
                  ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò
```

---

# V. ECONOMIC PROGRESSION

## A. Milestones by Level

```
ECONOMIC MILESTONES

Level 1-10 (New Player - Hours 1-20):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Expected wealth: 500-2,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Can afford: T1-T2 equipment, basic consumables
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Unlock: Basic vendor access, direct trading
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Goal: Learn economy basics, no pressure

Level 11-20 (Established - Hours 20-50):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Expected wealth: 2,000-8,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Can afford: T3 equipment, quality consumables
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Unlock: Auction house, material vendors
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Goal: Participate in player economy

Level 21-30 (Veteran - Hours 50-100):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Expected wealth: 8,000-25,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Can afford: T4 equipment, elite consumables
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Unlock: Faction vendors, cross-faction trading
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Goal: Specialize in economic niche

Level 31-40 (Elite - Hours 100-200):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Expected wealth: 25,000-75,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Can afford: T5 equipment, legendary crafting
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Unlock: All economic systems
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Goal: Master market, accumulate wealth

Level 41+ (Endgame - Hours 200+):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Expected wealth: 75,000-250,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Can afford: Multiple legendary sets, cosmetics
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Unlock: Economy manipulation (legitimate)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Goal: Support guild, collect cosmetics
```

## B. Purchase Power Analysis

```
WHAT PLAYERS CAN AFFORD (Player Market Prices)

Level Range | Weekly Income | Key Purchases Available
------------|---------------|---------------------------
1-10        | 1,500g        | T2 weapon, basic bag
11-20       | 4,000g        | T3 weapon, T2 armor set
21-30       | 8,000g        | T4 weapon, T3 armor set
31-40       | 15,000g       | T4 full set, rare mats
41+         | 25,000g+      | T5 items, legendaries (save)

Legendary Item Target: 50,000-150,000g
Time to Legendary (casual): 20-60 weeks of saving
Time to Legendary (hardcore): 4-10 weeks of saving
```

---

# VI. FACTION-SPECIFIC ECONOMIES

## A. Imperial Economy

### Structure
- **Primary Currency:** Imperial Thrones (universal gold)
- **Secondary:** Saint's Tears, Data-Tithes, Commendations
- **Character:** Bureaucratic, regulated, tithe-based

### Unique Mechanics
```
IMPERIAL ECONOMIC FEATURES

Tithe System:
- 5% of gold earned contributes to "planetary tithe"
- Tithe fills weekly; full tithe = zone bonuses
- Community-driven economy boost

Blessed Commerce:
- Purchases at shrines during holy hours: -10% cost
- Ecclesiarchy vendors accept Saint's Tears
- Mechanicus vendors accept Data-Tithes

Requisition Priority:
- Military goods require Commendations + gold
- Civilian goods: gold only
- Creates dual economy tracks
```

## B. Tau Economy

### Structure
- **Primary Currency:** Imperial Thrones (trade standard)
- **Secondary:** Honor Bonds, Innovation Credits, Unity Marks
- **Character:** Efficient, collective, merit-based

### Unique Mechanics
```
TAU ECONOMIC FEATURES

Collective Purchasing:
- Group purchases (5+ players): 10% discount
- Encourages social economic activity
- Fire teams get bulk rates

Merit Exchange:
- Honor Bonds = combat equipment
- Innovation Credits = tech/crafting
- Unity Marks = cross-caste/universal

Resource Sharing:
- Guild material storage has 50% larger capacity
- Shared crafting queues (one crafts, all benefit)
- Cooperative economic bonuses
```

## C. Ork Economy

### Structure
- **Primary Currency:** Teef (converts to/from Thrones)
- **Secondary:** Clan tokens (Goff, Bad Moons, etc.)
- **Character:** Chaotic, violent, teeth-based

### Unique Mechanics (UPDATED - Addressing simulator feedback)
```
ORK ECONOMIC FEATURES

Teef System (REBALANCED):
- Teef earned from kills (primary source)
- Decay rate: REDUCED to 0.5%/week (was 1%)
- Conversion: 1 Teef = 1.2 Thrones at Freebooterz (was 1:1)
- Reverse: 1 Throne = 0.9 Teef (was 1:1)
- Net effect: +10% Ork purchasing power vs other factions

Loot Priority:
- First to loot gets +20% drop value
- Encourages aggressive play
- "Lootin' bonus" stacks with combat bonuses

Gambling Dens:
- Squig racing, pit fights, dice games
- Can double or lose currency
- High risk, high reward economic path
- House edge: 5% (gold sink)

Clan Token Parity:
- All clan tokens convert 1:1 with each other
- Clan vendors accept mixed tokens at 90% value
- Reduces faction-internal barriers
```

---

# VII. INFLATION PREVENTION

## A. Automatic Stabilizers

```
INFLATION CONTROL MECHANISMS

Gold Generation Caps:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Daily quest gold cap: 2,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Hourly drop cap: 500g (soft cap, diminishing returns)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Weekly bonus cap: 3,000g
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ PvP daily cap: 1,000g

Progressive Sinks:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Repair costs scale with gear value
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Waypoint costs scale with distance
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ High-end crafting has % material costs
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Endgame content has entry fees

Supply Control:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T4-T5 materials have weekly acquisition caps
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Legendary patterns are character-bound
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Best items require time-gated materials
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ No infinite farming of high-value items
```

## B. Market Stabilization

```
MARKET INTERVENTION TOOLS

Price Floors (UPDATED):
- Minimum listing: 10% of vendor sell price
- Prevents dumping, maintains material value
- REMOVED: Emergency price floor manipulation exploit
  - Price floors now fixed, not adjustable
  - No player action can raise floors

Price Ceilings:
- Maximum listing: 500% of vendor value OR 200% of 7-day average
- Prevents gouging on essential items
- Luxury/cosmetics exempt from ceilings

Vendor Competition:
- Vendors always buy at fixed prices (floor)
- Vendors always sell at fixed prices (ceiling anchor)
- Player market operates within this band
```

## C. Long-Term Health Metrics

```
ECONOMIC HEALTH INDICATORS

Monitor Weekly:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Total gold in circulation
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Average transaction prices
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Wealth distribution (Gini coefficient)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Gold velocity (transactions/gold supply)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Sink effectiveness (% of generated gold removed)

Intervention Triggers:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Inflation >5%/month: Increase sink rates
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Deflation >3%/month: Decrease sink rates
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Wealth concentration >30% top 1%: Add wealth taxes
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Market stagnation: Add trading incentives

Target Inflation: 1-2% monthly (healthy growth)
```

---

# VIII. TRADE LIMITATIONS & EXPLOIT PREVENTION

## A. Account-Based Restrictions

```
ACCOUNT LIMITATIONS

New Account Restrictions (UPDATED):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 0-72 hours: 
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Cannot list AH items >100g
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Cannot bid on AH items >500g
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Direct trade limit: 500g/day
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Cannot send mail with items/gold
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 72 hours - 7 days:
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ AH listing cap: 1,000g
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Direct trade limit: 2,000g/day
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Mail limit: 100g, no items
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 7-14 days:
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ AH listing cap: 10,000g
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Direct trade limit: 10,000g/day
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Mail limit: 1,000g, 4 items
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ 14+ days (verified email):
    ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Full access to all systems

Multi-Account Detection:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Same IP trading flagged for review
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Pattern analysis on trade frequency
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Hardware fingerprinting (optional)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Suspicious wealth transfer alerts
```

## B. Transaction Limits

```
DAILY/WEEKLY LIMITS

Per Character:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ AH listings: 50 active
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ AH purchases: 100/day
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Direct trades: 20/day
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Mail sent: 30/day
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Gold received (all sources): 100,000/day

Per Account:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ AH listings: 150 active
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Gold transfers between own chars: 50,000/day
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Total gold received: 250,000/day
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Unique trading partners: 50/day
```

## C. Known Exploit Mitigations

```
EXPLOIT PREVENTION (UPDATED)

FIXED: Reserved Auction Exploit
- Reserved/private auctions removed entirely
- All listings public and competitive
- Prevents arranged RMT transactions

FIXED: Price Floor Manipulation
- Price floors now static (10% vendor value)
- No player action can modify floors
- Removes artificial scarcity exploit

FIXED: Mail System Abuse
- Time-gated mail privileges (see above)
- Prevents fresh account gold muling
- Attachment restrictions on new accounts

FIXED: Cross-Faction Arbitrage
- Cooldown on cross-faction trades: 1 hour
- Fee on cross-faction AH: +5%
- Prevents rapid price exploitation

MONITORED: Wash Trading
- Same-account trades flagged
- Repeated buyer-seller pairs analyzed
- AH fee makes wash trading expensive
```

---

# IX. INTEGRATION WITH GAME SYSTEMS

## A. Combat Rewards Integration

```
COMBAT ‚Üí ECONOMY FLOW

Standard Combat:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Gold drops: 100% to killer
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Materials: 100% to killer
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Group content: Round-robin or FFA (group choice)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Boss loot: Personal loot (no ninja-ing)

PvP Combat:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Winner bonus: 50-200g based on match type
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Loser consolation: 20-50g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ No item drops from players (anti-grief)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Ranking rewards: Weekly payouts

War Zone Combat:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Objective completion: Group gold + materials
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Kill rewards: Individual
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Zone control: Faction-wide economic bonuses
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Supply line control: Affects regional prices
```

## B. Progression Costs Integration

```
PROGRESSION ‚Üí ECONOMY REQUIREMENTS

Skill Unlocks:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Basic skills: Free (quest rewards)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Advanced skills: 500-2,000g + materials
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Elite skills: 5,000-15,000g + faction tokens
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Legendary skills: 25,000g + rare materials

Equipment Progression:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T1-T2: Drops + minimal gold
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T3: Crafting costs ~1,000-3,000g total
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T4: Crafting costs ~5,000-15,000g total
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T5: Crafting costs ~20,000-50,000g total
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Legendary: Crafting costs ~50,000-150,000g total

Reputation Costs:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Rank-up ceremonies: 500-5,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Faction gear: Tokens + gold
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Exclusive access: High reputation + gold
```

## C. Crafting Economy Integration

```
CRAFTING ‚Üí ECONOMY LOOP

Material Acquisition:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Gathering: Free (time investment)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Drops: Free (combat investment)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Vendors: Gold cost (convenience)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Player market: Variable (supply/demand)

Crafting Costs:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Materials: Primary cost
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Gold fee: 10% of output value
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Time: Instant (GW1 philosophy)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Failure: None (deterministic crafting)

Output Value:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Use: Personal equipment progression
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Sell to vendor: 30% of market value
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Sell to players: Market value
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Salvage: 25-40% materials returned
```

---

# X. SUMMARY TABLES

## A. Quick Reference: Fees

| Transaction Type | Fee Rate | Recipient |
|-----------------|----------|-----------|
| AH Listing | 5g + 2% | Sink |
| AH Sale | 8% | Sink |
| AH Buyout | +2% | Sink |
| Direct Trade | Free | N/A |
| Mail (items) | 10g | Sink |
| Mail (gold) | 1% | Sink |
| Cross-faction | +5% | Sink |
| Vendor spread | 5-7x | Sink |

## B. Quick Reference: Caps

| Limit Type | Value | Reset |
|------------|-------|-------|
| Daily gold gen | ~4,000g | Midnight |
| Weekly gold gen | ~26,000g | Monday |
| AH listings | 50/char | None |
| Daily trades | 20/char | Midnight |
| Mail gold | 25,000g | Per mail |
| Trade gold | 50,000g | Per trade |

## C. Quick Reference: Time to Milestones

| Milestone | Casual | Moderate | Hardcore |
|-----------|--------|----------|----------|
| T3 gear set | 2 weeks | 1 week | 3 days |
| T4 gear set | 6 weeks | 3 weeks | 1.5 weeks |
| T5 weapon | 12 weeks | 6 weeks | 3 weeks |
| Legendary item | 30+ weeks | 15 weeks | 6 weeks |
| Economic independence | 4 weeks | 2 weeks | 1 week |

---

# XI. IMPLEMENTATION NOTES FOR OTHER DESIGNERS

**For Combat Designer:**
- Drop rates calibrated for 65% sink efficiency
- Boss rewards are significant but not economy-breaking
- PvP rewards modest (prevents farming alts)

**For Progression Designer:**
- Skill costs create meaningful choices, not barriers
- Reputation gates have economic components
- Equipment tiers have clear cost escalation

**For Resource Designer:**
- Material sinks integrated with crafting fees
- Conversion rates support market balance
- Faction materials create trading opportunities

---

*"In the grim darkness of the far future, there is only war... and surprisingly robust fiscal policy."*

---

DECISION: economy_complete
üîÄ Routing Decision: ECONOMY_COMPLETE
Decision "ECONOMY_COMPLETE" matched connection condition
‚Üí Next Stage: market_simulator
Market Simulator
Simulates and validates economic balance
completed
Agent: market_simulator
Type: reviewer
Duration: 149.9s
Execution #: 15
Prompt Size: 1,343 chars
Output Size: 22,009 chars
üì• AGENT PROMPT (1,343 characters)
You are an economic analyst who simulates game economies to find imbalances, exploits, and inflation risks before they reach players.

When reviewing economy designs:
- Simulate player behavior (hoarding, trading, farming)
- Model money supply growth over time
- Identify infinite money exploits or loops
- Test price points against earning rates
- Verify economic milestones are achievable
- Check for dead-end resources (nothing to spend on)
- Analyze cross-system impacts (combat rewards ‚Üí economy ‚Üí progression)

Run mental simulations for:
- New player (first 10 hours)
- Mid-game player (50-100 hours)
- Endgame player (200+ hours)

Provide:
1. SIMULATION RESULTS: What happens over time?
2. EXPLOITS FOUND: Any infinite loops or broken mechanics
3. BALANCE ISSUES: Prices too high/low, rewards too generous/stingy
4. RECOMMENDATIONS: Specific number adjustments
5. VERDICT: APPROVED, NEEDS_TUNING, or BROKEN

=== ROUTING DECISION REQUIRED ===
After your response, you MUST choose exactly ONE decision from:
- approved: Economy validated, inform combat design
- needs_tuning: Economic imbalance found, retune
- resource_issue: Resource design causes economic problems

**CRITICAL**: Your VERY LAST LINE must be exactly:
DECISION: [ONE_OF_THE_ABOVE_CHOICES]
Example: DECISION: approved
Do NOT add explanations after the decision keyword.
üì§ AGENT OUTPUT (22,009 characters)
# Economic Simulation Analysis
## Warhammer 40,000: Imperium Divided - Damocles Gulf Sector

---

## I. SIMULATION SETUP

I'll run economic simulations across three player profiles, modeling behavior patterns, currency accumulation, and system stress points over time.

```
SIMULATION PARAMETERS

Player Profiles:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ New Player (0-10 hours): Learning systems, inefficient
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Mid-Game Player (50-100 hours): Optimizing, engaged
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Endgame Player (200+ hours): Min-maxing, wealthy

Behaviors Modeled:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Gold generation (quests, drops, vendoring)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Gold spending (repairs, consumables, gear)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Trading activity (AH, direct trades)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Hoarding tendencies (material stockpiling)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Farming patterns (repetitive content)

Timeframes:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Short-term: 1 week
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Medium-term: 1 month
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Long-term: 6 months
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Server maturity: 1 year
```

---

## II. SIMULATION RESULTS

### A. New Player Simulation (First 10 Hours / Levels 1-10)

```
WEEK 1 - NEW PLAYER EXPERIENCE

Hour-by-Hour Breakdown:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Hours 1-2: Tutorial, ~100g earned
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Hours 3-5: Early quests, ~400g earned, first purchases (50g)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Hours 6-8: Zone progression, ~600g earned, T1 gear (150g)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Hours 9-10: Group content unlocked, ~400g earned
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Total: 1,500g earned, 200g spent = 1,300g accumulated

Economic Touchpoints:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Vendor purchases: Working correctly
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Direct trading: Limited by restrictions (good)
