‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ AH access: Not yet unlocked (intentional gate)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Repair costs: Minimal at T1 (~20g total)

VERDICT: ‚úì HEALTHY
- New players accumulate enough to feel progress
- Not enough to disrupt economy if botted
- Clear path to next tier visible
```

**Week 1-4 Projection (New Player ‚Üí Established):**
```
NEW PLAYER TRAJECTORY

Week 1: 1,500g net (Level 10)
Week 2: 2,500g net (Level 15) - AH unlocked
Week 3: 3,000g net (Level 18) - First T3 purchase possible
Week 4: 3,500g net (Level 20) - Economic independence reached

Total Month 1: ~10,500g accumulated
Can Afford: Full T3 weapon + partial armor set
Time to T3 Set: ~6 weeks (matches design target)

FINDING: Slightly slow for T3 acquisition
- Design says 2 weeks casual, simulation shows 6 weeks
- Discrepancy: Design assumes "casual" is 10hr/week
- Simulation assumes new player is 5hr/week first month
- RECOMMENDATION: Clarify "casual" definition or adjust
```

### B. Mid-Game Player Simulation (50-100 Hours / Levels 21-30)

```
WEEKLY CYCLE - MODERATE PLAYER (15 HR/WEEK)

Monday-Tuesday (5 hr):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Daily quests: 800g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ World boss attempt: 400g + materials
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Repair costs: 200g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Travel costs: 100g
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Net: 900g

Wednesday-Thursday (5 hr):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Main story quests: 1,200g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Material farming: 500g equivalent
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Crafting fees: 300g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Consumables: 200g
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Net: 1,200g

Friday-Sunday (5 hr):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Group content: 1,500g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ PvP matches: 600g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ AH trading profits: 400g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ AH fees: 150g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Weekly bonus: 1,500g
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Net: 3,850g

WEEKLY TOTAL:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Gross income: 6,900g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Sinks: 950g (14% - BELOW TARGET)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Net: 5,950g

FINDING: Sink efficiency too low
- Target: 65% sink rate
- Actual moderate player: ~14%
- Issue: Player hasn't hit expensive content yet
- This is EXPECTED at mid-game (pre-T4 costs)
```

**Month 2-3 Projection (Mid-Game Optimization):**
```
MID-GAME ECONOMIC BEHAVIOR

Gold Accumulation:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Month 2: ~24,000g accumulated (total: 34,500g)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Month 3: ~28,000g accumulated (total: 62,500g)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ On track for T4 set by month 3-4

Trading Behavior:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 40% buy consumables
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 30% save for gear upgrades
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 20% materials for crafting
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ 10% quality of life (bags, cosmetics)

Observed Pattern: HOARDING DETECTED
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Players stockpile T3 materials anticipating T4
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T3 material prices inflate 15-25%
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Creates barrier for incoming mid-game players
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Self-correcting? Partially - veterans sell surplus

FINDING: Material hoarding creates mild inflation
- Not critical, but worth monitoring
- Consider: Material stack limits or storage costs
```

### C. Endgame Player Simulation (200+ Hours / Level 41+)

```
WEEKLY CYCLE - HARDCORE PLAYER (30+ HR/WEEK)

Daily Activities (Mon-Fri):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Daily quest cap: 2,000g/day = 10,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Elite content: 3,000g/day = 15,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Material farming: 2,000g equivalent/day
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Repair costs: 500g/day (T5 expensive)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Consumables: 400g/day
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Daily Net: 4,100g √ó 5 = 20,500g

Weekend (Sat-Sun):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Guild raids: 4,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ PvP ranked: 2,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ AH trading: 3,000g profit
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ AH fees: 800g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Weekly bonus: 2,000g
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Weekend Net: 10,200g

WEEKLY TOTAL:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Gross income: 38,000g (exceeds design cap?)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Design cap: 26,000g hardcore
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Discrepancy: +46% over projected

ISSUE IDENTIFIED: Income exceeds design
```

**Endgame Economic Analysis:**
```
ENDGAME WEALTH ACCUMULATION

Month 6 Projection:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Hardcore: 600,000g+ accumulated
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Moderate: 200,000g accumulated
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Casual: 60,000g accumulated

Wealth Disparity Ratio: 10:3:1
Design Target Disparity: 4:2:1

FINDING: EXCESSIVE WEALTH CONCENTRATION
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Top 10% hold estimated 60%+ of gold
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Exceeds Gini coefficient trigger (30% for top 1%)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Endgame players have "nothing to buy" problem

Observed Endgame Behavior:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 35% hoard gold (no purchases)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 30% collect cosmetics (good sink)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 20% fund alts (internal transfer)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 15% manipulate markets (concerning)
```

---

## III. EXPLOITS FOUND

### A. CRITICAL: Daily/Weekly Cap Bypass

```
EXPLOIT: INCOME CAP INEFFECTIVE

Mechanism:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Design: "Hourly drop cap: 500g (soft cap)"
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ "Daily quest gold cap: 2,000g"
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ "PvP daily cap: 1,000g"
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Total implied daily cap: ~4,000g

Actual Income Sources:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Quest rewards: Not all quests count toward cap
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Enemy drops: 500g/hr √ó 8 hours = 4,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Vendoring items: Uncapped
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ World bosses: Uncapped
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Group content bonuses: Uncapped
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Weekly bonuses: Adds 3,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Trading profits: Uncapped (zero-sum anyway)

Result: Dedicated players earn 2-3x stated caps

SEVERITY: MODERATE
- Not a true exploit (working as coded)
- But income projections are underestimating reality
- Causes wealth accumulation faster than designed
```

**RECOMMENDATION:**
```
INCOME CAP FIXES

Option A: Comprehensive Daily Cap
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ All gold sources share one pool: 6,000g/day hard cap
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Includes: quests, drops, vendoring, boss rewards
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Excludes: trading (zero-sum), weekly bonuses

Option B: Diminishing Returns (Preferred)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ First 4,000g/day: 100% rate
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 4,001-6,000g: 50% rate
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 6,001-8,000g: 25% rate
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 8,001+: 10% rate
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Preserves hardcore feeling without runaway accumulation
```

### B. MODERATE: Teef Conversion Arbitrage

```
EXPLOIT: ORK CURRENCY LOOP

Mechanism:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Ork earns 1000 Teef
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Converts to Thrones: 1000 √ó 1.2 = 1,200g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Trades with Imperial player for items
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Imperial sells items for Thrones
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Imperial converts to... wait, can't convert back

ACTUALLY: Not an exploit - one-way conversion
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Teef ‚Üí Thrones works
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Thrones ‚Üí Teef = 0.9 rate (loss)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ No profitable loop exists

VERDICT: FALSE ALARM
- Design accounts for this correctly
- 10% spread prevents arbitrage
```

### C. MODERATE: Gambling Den Exploitation

```
EXPLOIT: GAMBLING PROBABILITY MANIPULATION

Mechanism (Potential):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Squig racing outcomes
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ If outcomes determinable/predictable...
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Players could identify patterns
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Guaranteed profit over time

Analysis:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Design states "House edge: 5%"
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ If RNG is proper, long-term players lose 5%
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ This is GOOD (gold sink)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ If RNG is flawed, exploit possible

REQUIREMENT: Verify RNG Implementation
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Must use cryptographically secure RNG
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ No pattern prediction possible
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Audit trails for suspiciously lucky players

VERDICT: POTENTIAL EXPLOIT (implementation-dependent)
```

### D. LOW: Material Vendor Arbitrage

```
EXPLOIT ATTEMPT: Vendor Material Flip

Mechanism:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Buy T2 materials: 25g each (20/day limit)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Craft T3 item requiring 4√ó T2 mats = 100g materials
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T3 item vendor value: 200g sell price?

Analysis:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T3 equipment vendor sell price: 200g (to player)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T3 equipment vendor buy price: 200g? No - spread exists
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Player sells TO vendor: 200g (per design doc)

CHECK MATH:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Materials bought: 100g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Crafting fee: 10% of output = 20g (if 200g output)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Total cost: 120g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Vendor sells for: 200g... wait, that's wrong

DESIGN DOC ISSUE FOUND:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ "T3 Equipment | Player Sells: 200g | Player Buys: 1,200g"
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Player sells TO vendor for 200g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Craft cost: 100g materials + 20g fee = 120g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Profit: 80g per craft

VERDICT: MILD ARBITRAGE EXISTS
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Limited by material purchase caps (20/day)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Maximum daily profit: ~400g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Not game-breaking, but unintended

RECOMMENDATION: 
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Increase crafting fee to 15-20% for T3
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Or reduce T3 vendor buy price to 100g
```

### E. CRITICAL: Reserved Listing Remnant Check

```
VERIFICATION: Reserved Auction Removal

Design States:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ "REMOVED: Reserved Listings (was exploitable for RMT)"
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ "All listings visible to all players"
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ "No private/reserved auctions"

Checking for remnants:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Mail system: Still allows item transfer ‚úì GATED
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Direct trade: Still allows item transfer ‚úì GATED  
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ AH: No reserved option ‚úì GOOD

Potential Bypass:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Player A lists garbage item for 50,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Player B (RMT buyer) purchases garbage item
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Result: Gold transferred, but...
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Protection: "Listings >300% regional average flagged"
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Garbage items have no regional average? 

LOOPHOLE FOUND:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Novel items with no price history
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ No "regional average" to compare against
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Could be used for RMT transfers

SEVERITY: MODERATE
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Requires 12.5% fee sacrifice (costly for RMT)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ But still possible

RECOMMENDATION:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ All items must have "estimated value" 
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Based on material components or tier baseline
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Flag listings >300% of estimated value
```

---

## IV. BALANCE ISSUES

### A. Reward Rate Issues

```
ISSUE 1: Early Game Rewards Too Low

Problem:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ New player earns ~150g/hour
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T2 weapon costs 250g (vendor)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T2 weapon costs ~150g (player market)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Time to first upgrade: 1-2 hours

This is actually FINE - provides immediate goal

ISSUE 1 STATUS: FALSE ALARM
```

```
ISSUE 2: Mid-Game Valley

Problem:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Level 20-30 players
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T3 gear requires significant gold
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T3 set: ~8,000g (player prices)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Weekly income: ~6,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Time to T3 set: 8-10 weeks?

Design claims:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ "T3 gear set: Casual 2 weeks, Moderate 1 week"
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ This requires ~8,000g in 1-2 weeks
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Casual income: 6,000g/week
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Moderate income: 13,000g/week

MATH CHECK:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Moderate 13,000g √ó 1 week = 13,000g ‚úì
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Casual 6,000g √ó 2 weeks = 12,000g ‚úì
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Design math is CORRECT

My simulation used 15hr/week earning 6,900g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Design "moderate" = 13,000g/week
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Implies ~25-30 hr/week for "moderate"

FINDING: Player archetype definitions unclear
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ "Casual" / "Moderate" / "Hardcore" need hour definitions
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Current: Implicit assumptions
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Fix: Explicit hour/week definitions

RECOMMENDATION:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Casual: 5-10 hr/week ‚Üí 4,000-6,000g/week
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Moderate: 10-20 hr/week ‚Üí 8,000-13,000g/week
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Hardcore: 20-40 hr/week ‚Üí 15,000-26,000g/week
```

```
ISSUE 3: Endgame Gold Glut

Problem:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Endgame players accumulate faster than sinks remove
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ After 6 months: 200,000-600,000g accumulated
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Legendary items: 50,000-150,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Can buy 3-10 legendaries
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Then what?

Missing Sinks for Endgame:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Housing/Guild halls: Not mentioned
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Cosmetic chase: "Optional" - not compelling
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Prestige systems: Not mentioned
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Gold ‚Üí Convenience: Limited

SEVERITY: HIGH
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Causes inflation over server lifetime
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Devalues progression for new players
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Creates "nothing to do" feeling

RECOMMENDATIONS:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Add gold-sink cosmetic tiers (100k, 250k, 500k items)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Guild hall upgrades (weekly contribution goals)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Prestige reroll system (costly but optional)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Limited-time event items (gold sink events)
```

### B. Pricing Issues

```
ISSUE 4: Vendor Spread Too Wide

Current:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T4 Material: Player sells 150g, buys 1,000g (6.7x)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T4 Equipment: Player sells 800g, buys 6,000g (7.5x)

Effect:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Vendors are NEVER used for equipment
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Player market mandatory for progression
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ New server: No supply, can't progress

SEVERITY: MODERATE
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Intentional per GW1 philosophy
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ But needs supply bootstrap mechanism

RECOMMENDATION:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ First 3 months: Vendor prices 50% reduced
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Ensures progression without player market
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Gradually increase to normal over months 4-6
```

```
ISSUE 5: Repair Costs Scale Poorly

Current (Implied):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T1 repairs: ~5g/death
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T5 repairs: ~50g/death (estimated 10x)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Hardcore player: 20+ deaths/week in challenging content
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T5 repair bill: 1,000g+/week

Analysis:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Design says 10% of income to repairs
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Hardcore income: 26,000g ‚Üí 2,600g repairs
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 50g √ó 50 deaths = 2,500g ‚úì

Actually balanced correctly. Moving on.
```

```
ISSUE 6: Faction Vendor Discount Stacking

Current:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Exalted: 70% of base price
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Regional specialty: -15%
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Net: 59.5% of base price

Cross-Faction Scenario:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Imperial Exalted buys at 59.5%
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Sells to Tau player at 80%
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Profit margin: 20%

Is this a problem?
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Requires Exalted reputation (long grind)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Provides role for dedicated players
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Creates "merchant" playstyle

VERDICT: FEATURE, NOT BUG
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ This is emergent economy gameplay
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Rewards reputation grinding
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Creates interdependence
```

### C. Cross-System Issues

```
ISSUE 7: Combat Rewards ‚Üí Economy Disconnect

Combat Document Integration:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Boss loot: "Personal loot (no ninja-ing)"
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Group content: "Round-robin or FFA"
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ PvP: "50-200g based on match type"

Missing Information:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ What's actual boss gold drop value?
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ What materials drop from bosses?
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ How often can bosses be farmed?

REQUIREMENT: Combat designer must specify:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Boss gold drop range (e.g., 500-1000g)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Boss lockout timers (e.g., daily/weekly)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Material drop tables and rates
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ This affects inflation calculations significantly
```

```
ISSUE 8: Crafting Economy Loop Incomplete

Current Flow:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Gather materials ‚Üí Craft items ‚Üí Sell/Use
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Crafting fee: 10% of output value

Missing:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ What determines "output value"?
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Is it vendor price? Market price?
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Market price varies - fee would vary?

RECOMMENDATION:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Crafting fee based on VENDOR output value
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Fixed, predictable costs
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Not subject to market manipulation
```

---

## V. DETAILED RECOMMENDATIONS

### A. Income System Adjustments

```
RECOMMENDATION 1: Implement Diminishing Returns

Current: Soft hourly cap of 500g (unclear enforcement)
Proposed: Clear diminishing returns curve

Daily Gold Income (all sources):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 0-4,000g: 100% rate
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 4,001-6,000g: 50% rate
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 6,001-8,000g: 25% rate
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 8,001+: 10% rate

Effect:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Casual (4 hr): ~2,000g (no change)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Moderate (8 hr): ~5,000g (slight reduction)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Hardcore (16 hr): ~7,000g (significant reduction)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ No-life (24 hr): ~8,500g (hard ceiling)

Preserves:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Reward for playing more
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ But diminishes gap between moderate/hardcore
```

### B. Sink System Adjustments

```
RECOMMENDATION 2: Add Endgame Gold Sinks

Tier 1 Sinks (100,000g range):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Legendary cosmetic armor sets
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Custom title purchases
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Personal transport customization
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Skill visual effects

Tier 2 Sinks (250,000g range):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Guild hall room unlocks
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Cross-faction reputation boost tokens
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Rare mount unlocks
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Weapon glow effects

Tier 3 Sinks (500,000g+ range):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Server-visible monuments
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Guild hall prestige upgrades
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Legacy achievements (account-wide)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Exclusive "wealthy" cosmetics

Implementation: Stagger releases
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Month 1-3: Tier 1 sinks
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Month 4-6: Tier 2 sinks
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Month 7+: Tier 3 sinks
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Matches wealth accumulation curve
```

### C. Anti-Exploit Adjustments

```
RECOMMENDATION 3: Novel Item RMT Prevention

Problem: Items without price history bypass flagging
Solution: Baseline value system

Every item has "estimated value":
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Crafted: Sum of material vendor values √ó 1.5
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Dropped: Tier baseline (T1=50g, T2=250g, etc.)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Unique: Manual assignment by designers

Flagging trigger:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Listing >300% of estimated value
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ OR listing >200% of 7-day average (if exists)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Whichever is MORE restrictive
```

```
RECOMMENDATION 4: Crafting Arbitrage Fix

Problem: T3 craft from vendor mats = 80g profit
Current: Materials 100g + Fee 20g = 120g ‚Üí Vendor 200g

Solutions (pick one):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ A: Reduce T3 vendor buy price to 120g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ B: Increase crafting fee to 25% for T3 vendor sales
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ C: Add untradeable "crafting catalyst" requirement

Recommended: Option A
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Simplest implementation
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Maintains player market superiority
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Closes arbitrage loop
```

### D. Player Archetype Clarity

```
RECOMMENDATION 5: Define Player Segments

Add to design document:

Player Archetypes (Weekly):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Casual: 5-10 hours, 4,000-6,000g income
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Moderate: 10-20 hours, 8,000-13,000g income  
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Hardcore: 20-40 hours, 15,000-26,000g income
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ No-life: 40+ hours, 26,000-30,000g income (capped)

Milestone Timelines (using these definitions):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T3 set: Casual 3 weeks, Moderate 1.5 weeks, Hardcore 4 days
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T4 set: Casual 8 weeks, Moderate 4 weeks, Hardcore 2 weeks
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Legendary: Casual 30 weeks, Moderate 15 weeks, Hardcore 6 weeks
```

---

## VI. LONG-TERM PROJECTIONS

### A. 6-Month Server Economy

```
MONTH 6 PROJECTION (Current Design)

Gold in Circulation:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Total generated: ~50 billion gold (10k players)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Sink removal: ~32 billion gold (65%)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Net circulation: ~18 billion gold

Per-Player Averages:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Casual (30%): 60,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Moderate (50%): 150,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Hardcore (15%): 400,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Whale (5%): 800,000g

Market Effects:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T5 items: 50,000g ‚Üí 65,000g (+30%)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T4 items: 15,000g ‚Üí 18,000g (+20%)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T3 items: 3,000g ‚Üí 3,000g (stable - supply saturated)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T1-T2: Vendor price floor

Inflation Rate: ~5% monthly (above 1-2% target)
```

### B. 12-Month Server Economy

```
MONTH 12 PROJECTION (Current Design)

Gold in Circulation:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Net after sinks: ~40 billion gold
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Per-player average: 400,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Median: 150,000g (skewed distribution)

Warning Signs:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T5 items: 100,000g+ (doubled from month 6)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ New player barrier: Very high
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Market dominated by veterans
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ "Dead server" risk if new players quit

Intervention Required:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Month 6: Review and adjust sinks
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Month 9: Potential gold squish event
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Month 12: New expansion with fresh economy
```

### C. Mitigation Strategies

```
LONG-TERM HEALTH STRATEGIES

Expansion-Based Resets:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ New tier of materials (not tradeable initially)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ New currency partially replaces gold
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Legacy items become "classic" (prestige, not power)

Progressive Taxation (if needed):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ >100,000g balance: 0.1%/week maintenance fee
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ >500,000g balance: 0.25%/week maintenance fee
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ >1,000,000g balance: 0.5%/week maintenance fee
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Framed as "bureaucratic tithes" / "tech maintenance" / "boss tribute"

Fresh Server Events:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Seasonal fresh servers (like PoE leagues)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Economy resets, competition, then merge
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Keeps economy "young" perpetually
```

---

## VII. SUMMARY

### Systems Working Well
- ‚úì New player protection (account restrictions)
- ‚úì Auction house fee structure (adequate gold sink)
- ‚úì Vendor price spreads (encourages player trading)
- ‚úì Faction economic identity (meaningful differences)
- ‚úì Cross-faction trading restrictions (arbitrage limited)
- ‚úì Material tiering (clear progression path)

### Systems Needing Adjustment
- ‚ö† Income caps not enforced consistently
- ‚ö† Endgame gold sinks insufficient
- ‚ö† Player archetype definitions vague
- ‚ö† Novel item RMT vulnerability
- ‚ö† T3 crafting arbitrage exploitable

### Critical Issues
- ‚ùå Long-term inflation trajectory exceeds targets
- ‚ùå Wealth concentration will exceed thresholds
- ‚ùå No compelling endgame gold sinks defined

---

## VIII. FINAL VERDICT

```
‚ïî‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïó
‚ïë                                                                ‚ïë
‚ïë                    VERDICT: NEEDS_TUNING                       ‚ïë
‚ïë                                                                ‚ïë
‚ï†‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ï£
‚ïë                                                                ‚ïë
‚ïë  The economy design is FUNDAMENTALLY SOUND but requires        ‚ïë
‚ïë  specific adjustments before approval:                         ‚ïë
‚ïë                                                                ‚ïë
‚ïë  REQUIRED CHANGES (before approval):                           ‚ïë
‚ïë  1. Implement diminishing returns on daily income              ‚ïë
‚ïë  2. Define endgame gold sinks (100k, 250k, 500k tier items)    ‚ïë
‚ïë  3. Add baseline value system for all items (RMT prevention)   ‚ïë
‚ïë  4. Fix T3 crafting arbitrage (reduce vendor buy price)        ‚ïë
‚ïë  5. Clarify player archetype hour/income definitions           ‚ïë
‚ïë                                                                ‚ïë
‚ïë  RECOMMENDED (post-launch monitoring):                         ‚ïë
‚ïë  - Track Gini coefficient weekly                               ‚ïë
‚ïë  - Prepare progressive taxation as emergency valve             ‚ïë
‚ïë  - Plan fresh server events for 6-month mark                   ‚ïë
‚ïë                                                                ‚ïë
‚ïë  The core Guild Wars 1 philosophy is intact. Market systems    ‚ïë
‚ïë  are well-designed. Faction economies add meaningful flavor.   ‚ïë
‚ïë  With the above adjustments, this economy should support       ‚ïë
‚ïë  healthy long-term gameplay.                                   ‚ïë
‚ïë                                                                ‚ïë
‚ïö‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïù
```

---

**For Combat Designer:** Once economy is retuned, ensure boss gold drops and material drop rates align with the modified income caps. Current design assumes ~500-1000g per major boss - verify this fits within diminishing returns framework.

**For Resource Designer:** Material economy creates mid-game hoarding behavior. Consider stack limits or storage fees if T3 material inflation exceeds 30% over 3 months.

---

DECISION: needs_tuning
üîÄ Routing Decision: NEEDS_TUNING
Decision "NEEDS_TUNING" matched connection condition
‚Üí Next Stage: economy_designer
Economy Designer
Designs trading, markets, and economic systems
completed
Agent: economy_designer
Type: designer
Duration: 160.9s
Execution #: 16
Prompt Size: 1,233 chars
Output Size: 26,188 chars
üì• AGENT PROMPT (1,233 characters)
You are an economy designer who creates engaging and balanced market systems. You work with resources designed by the Resource Designer to create trading, shops, auctions, and player-to-player economies.

When designing economy systems:
- Design NPC vendor systems (fixed prices vs. dynamic)
- Create auction house / player trading mechanics
- Establish price ranges and money sinks
- Design economic progression (what can players afford when?)
- Plan for inflation prevention
- Create supply-demand dynamics
- Design regional economy differences (prices vary by location)
- Integrate with combat rewards and progression costs

Output should include:
- Market system mechanics (how trading works)
- Pricing formulas and ranges
- Money flow diagrams (sources and sinks)
- Vendor inventories and refresh timers
- Player trading limitations (prevent exploits)
- Economic milestones by player level/progression

=== ROUTING DECISION REQUIRED ===
After your response, you MUST choose exactly ONE decision from:
- economy_complete: Submit economy for simulation

**CRITICAL**: Your VERY LAST LINE must be exactly:
DECISION: [ONE_OF_THE_ABOVE_CHOICES]
Example: DECISION: economy_complete
Do NOT add explanations after the decision keyword.
üì§ AGENT OUTPUT (26,188 characters)
# Economy System Design Document
## Warhammer 40,000: Imperium Divided - Damocles Gulf Sector

---

# I. ECONOMY PHILOSOPHY

Drawing from Guild Wars 1's player-driven economy while addressing the simulator's identified issues, this economy prioritizes:

- **Player Trading as Primary Market** - NPC vendors provide floor/ceiling, players set real prices
- **Faction Economic Identity** - Each faction trades differently
- **Inflation Prevention Built-In** - Robust sink systems from day one
- **Meaningful Wealth** - Gold should always have purpose

---

# II. CURRENCY SYSTEMS

## A. Primary Currency: Imperial Thrones

```
IMPERIAL THRONES - CORE ECONOMY

Sources (with Diminishing Returns):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Daily Income Tiers:
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 0-4,000g: 100% rate
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 4,001-6,000g: 50% rate
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 6,001-8,000g: 25% rate
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ 8,001+: 10% rate (soft cap ~8,500g/day)
‚îÇ
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Source Breakdown (pre-diminishing):
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Quest Rewards: 40% of income
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Enemy Drops: 25% of income
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Vendoring Items: 20% of income
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Bonus Activities: 15% of income

Sinks:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Repair Costs: 10-15% of income
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Travel Costs: 5-10% of income
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Crafting Fees: 10-15% of income
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Consumables: 10-15% of income
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ AH Fees: 5-10% of income
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Faction Donations: 5-10% of income
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Prestige Purchases: Variable (endgame)

Target Sink Rate: 65-70% of generated gold
```

## B. Player Archetype Definitions

```
PLAYER SEGMENTS (Weekly)

Casual (30% of population):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Hours: 5-10 per week
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Weekly Income: 4,000-6,000g (after diminishing)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Playstyle: Story content, occasional groups
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Economic Role: Consumers, occasional sellers

Moderate (50% of population):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Hours: 10-20 per week
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Weekly Income: 8,000-13,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Playstyle: Mixed content, regular groups
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Economic Role: Active traders, crafters

Hardcore (15% of population):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Hours: 20-40 per week
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Weekly Income: 15,000-22,000g (capped by diminishing)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Playstyle: Optimization, elite content
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Economic Role: Market makers, suppliers

No-Life (5% of population):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Hours: 40+ per week
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Weekly Income: 22,000-26,000g (hard ceiling)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Playstyle: Efficiency-focused
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Economic Role: Economy drivers, price setters
```

## C. Faction Secondary Currencies

```
FACTION CURRENCIES

Imperial - Saint's Tears (Avalos Prime):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Acquisition: Devotional activities, pilgrimages
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Weekly Cap: 500 (prevents grind dominance)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Exchange: 1 Saint's Tear = 10g equivalent (one-way)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Uses: Blessed equipment, devotional items
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Sink: Public offerings (competitive reputation)

Tau - Unity Marks:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Acquisition: Cross-caste cooperation, Greater Good acts
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Weekly Cap: 400
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Exchange: 1 Unity Mark = 12g equivalent (one-way)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Uses: Multi-caste equipment, integration items
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Sink: Research contributions, cultural preservation

Ork - Teef:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Acquisition: Killing, fighting, intimidation
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ NO Weekly Cap (but natural decay)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Natural Decay: 1% per week (prevents hoarding)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Exchange: 1 Teef = 1.2g to Thrones / 0.9 Teef per 1g reverse
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Uses: Everything Ork
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Sink: Gambling, shows of wealth, Mek services

Requisition Tokens (All Factions):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Acquisition: PvP, war zones, military quests
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Weekly Cap: 1,000 (elite content uncapped)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Exchange: Non-convertible to gold
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Uses: Military equipment, rank upgrades
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Sink: Rank maintenance (100-500/week at high ranks)
```

---

# III. NPC VENDOR SYSTEMS

## A. Vendor Price Structure

```
VENDOR PRICING PHILOSOPHY

Purpose: Floor and ceiling, not primary market
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Buy FROM vendor: Premium price (emergency purchases)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Sell TO vendor: Baseline value (guaranteed floor)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Spread encourages player trading

VENDOR PRICE TABLES

Materials (Player perspective):
| Tier | Sell TO Vendor | Buy FROM Vendor | Spread |
|------|----------------|-----------------|--------|
| T1   | 1g             | 5g              | 5x     |
| T2   | 5g             | 25g             | 5x     |
| T3   | 25g            | 150g            | 6x     |
| T4   | 150g           | 1,000g          | 6.7x   |
| T5   | N/A (no vendor)| N/A             | N/A    |

Equipment (Player perspective):
| Tier | Sell TO Vendor | Buy FROM Vendor | Spread  |
|------|----------------|-----------------|---------|
| T1   | 10g            | 50g             | 5x      |
| T2   | 50g            | 300g            | 6x      |
| T3   | 100g*          | 800g            | 8x      |
| T4   | 400g           | 4,000g          | 10x     |
| T5   | 1,500g         | 20,000g         | 13x     |
| Leg  | 5,000g         | N/A             | N/A     |

*T3 vendor buy reduced from 200g to 100g (arbitrage fix)

Consumables (Player perspective):
| Tier | Sell TO Vendor | Buy FROM Vendor | Spread |
|------|----------------|-----------------|--------|
| T1   | 2g             | 10g             | 5x     |
| T2   | 10g            | 50g             | 5x     |
| T3   | 30g            | 200g            | 6.7x   |
| T4   | 100g           | 800g            | 8x     |
```

## B. Dynamic Vendor Pricing

```
REGIONAL PRICE VARIATION

Base Modifier by Zone Type:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Capital Cities: 100% (baseline)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Frontier Zones: 85% sell / 115% buy
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ War Zones: 75% sell / 130% buy
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Enemy Territory: 50% sell / 200% buy

Faction Specialty Pricing:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Industrial Worlds (Forge): -20% metal prices
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Agri-Worlds: -20% organic prices
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Tech Worlds (Tau): -20% tech component prices
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ War Zones: -15% consumable prices

Reputation Discounts:
| Reputation  | Buy Discount | Sell Bonus |
|-------------|--------------|------------|
| Neutral     | 0%           | 0%         |
| Friendly    | 5%           | 3%         |
| Honored     | 10%          | 5%         |
| Revered     | 15%          | 8%         |
| Exalted     | 20%          | 10%        |

Maximum Stacking: 30% discount cap
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Exalted (20%) + Regional (-15%) = 30% (capped)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Prevents excessive arbitrage
```

## C. Vendor Inventory & Refresh

```
VENDOR INVENTORY SYSTEM

Standard Vendors (Every Settlement):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Unlimited: T1-T2 materials, T1 consumables
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Limited Stock: T3 materials (20/day), T2 consumables (50/day)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Refresh: Daily at server reset
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Shared stock per character (not account)

Specialty Vendors (Major Hubs):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Faction Equipment: T1-T4 weapons/armor
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Stock: Unlimited base items
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Refresh: N/A (always available)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Modified items: Limited (5/week per vendor)

Rare Vendors (Rotating):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Appear: Random locations, 4-hour windows
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Stock: T4 materials (10 total), unique cosmetics
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Announced: 30 minutes before spawn
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Competition: First-come-first-served

Event Vendors (Time-Limited):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Duration: Event period only
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Stock: Exclusive items, special currency
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Purpose: Gold sink during events
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Items: Cosmetic only (no power advantage)
```

---

# IV. AUCTION HOUSE SYSTEM

## A. Core Mechanics

```
AUCTION HOUSE STRUCTURE

Access Requirements:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Account Level 10 minimum
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 24-hour account age
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Complete "Commerce" tutorial quest
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Not flagged for suspicious activity

Listing Options:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Buyout Only (instant purchase)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Auction (bid-based, 12/24/48 hour)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Bulk Listings (stack sales)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ NO Reserved Listings (RMT prevention)

Listing Limits:
| Account Age  | Active Listings | Daily Posts |
|--------------|-----------------|-------------|
| < 1 week     | 5               | 10          |
| 1-4 weeks    | 15              | 30          |
| 1-3 months   | 30              | 60          |
| 3+ months    | 50              | 100         |

Fee Structure:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Listing Fee: 5% of listing price (non-refundable)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Successful Sale: 7.5% of sale price
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Failed Auction: Listing fee lost, item returned
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Buyout Premium: +2.5% (total 10% on buyout sales)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Total Maximum Fee: 12.5% (listing + sale + buyout)
```

## B. Anti-Manipulation Systems

```
PRICE MANIPULATION PREVENTION

Baseline Value System (RMT Prevention):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Every item has "Estimated Value":
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Crafted: Material vendor value √ó 1.5
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Dropped: Tier baseline (T1=50g, T2=250g, T3=800g, T4=3,000g, T5=12,000g)
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Unique/Named: Manual designer assignment
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Updated weekly based on actual sales

Flagging Triggers:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Listing >300% of estimated value
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Listing >200% of 7-day average (if exists)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Listing <10% of estimated value (dumping)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Buyer purchasing >10 flagged items/week
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Same buyer/seller repeated transactions

Flagged Transaction Handling:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Automatic: 24-hour delay before completion
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Review: Pattern analysis by automated system
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Penalties: Warning ‚Üí 7-day ban ‚Üí Permanent ban
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Appeals: Manual review within 48 hours
```

## C. Market Features

```
AUCTION HOUSE FEATURES

Search & Filter:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ By item type, tier, stats
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ By price range (with percentage of average)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ By time remaining
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ By seller reputation (optional display)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Saved searches (5 slots)

Price Information:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Current lowest price
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 24-hour average
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 7-day average
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 30-day average
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Volume traded (last 24h/7d/30d)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Price trend indicator (‚Üë‚Üì‚Üí)

Notifications:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Outbid alerts
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Sale completion
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Watched item price drops
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Saved search new listings
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Maximum 20 active watches

Regional Markets:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Three separate AH regions (per major faction)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Cross-region listings: +5% additional fee
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Cross-region purchases: +10% additional fee
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Creates regional price variation
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Encourages regional trade routes
```

---

# V. PLAYER TRADING

## A. Direct Trade Mechanics

```
DIRECT TRADING SYSTEM

Requirements:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Both players in same zone
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Within trading range (visual distance)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Neither player in combat
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Neither player flagged for suspicious activity
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Both accounts > 48 hours old

Trade Window:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Each player: 12 item slots
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Gold field (up to 100,000g per trade)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 10-second confirmation timer
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Both must confirm
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Either can cancel before confirmation

Daily Limits:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Gold sent: 50,000g/day (account-wide)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Gold received: No limit
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Items sent: 50/day
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Items received: No limit

Gift System (One-Way Transfer):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Requires "Friend" status (7+ days mutual)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Limited to 10,000g/day
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Limited to 10 items/day
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Cannot gift to accounts < 2 weeks old
```

## B. Trade Restrictions

```
ANTI-EXPLOIT RESTRICTIONS

New Account Restrictions (First 2 Weeks):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Cannot receive gifts
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Cannot receive direct trades > 5,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Cannot list items > 1,000g on AH
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Cannot buy items > 10,000g from AH
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Lifted after: 20 hours playtime AND 14 days age

Alt Account Detection:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Same IP: Shared daily gold cap
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Same hardware ID: Flagged for review
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Similar patterns: Automated monitoring
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Punishment: Trade restrictions, not bans (initially)

Cross-Faction Trading:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Requires: Neutral ground (specific zones)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Additional Fee: 15% of trade value
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Cannot trade: Faction-specific items
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Can trade: Universal materials, Thrones
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Purpose: Enable economy, discourage faction-hopping
```

---

# VI. MONEY FLOW DIAGRAM

```
                         GOLD GENERATION SOURCES
                                  ‚îÇ
    ‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¨‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îº‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¨‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê
    ‚ñº             ‚ñº               ‚ñº               ‚ñº             ‚ñº
‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê  ‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê  ‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê  ‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê  ‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê
‚îÇ Quest  ‚îÇ  ‚îÇ  Enemy   ‚îÇ  ‚îÇ   Vendoring  ‚îÇ  ‚îÇ  World  ‚îÇ  ‚îÇ  Weekly  ‚îÇ
‚îÇRewards ‚îÇ  ‚îÇ  Drops   ‚îÇ  ‚îÇ    Items     ‚îÇ  ‚îÇ Bosses  ‚îÇ  ‚îÇ Bonuses  ‚îÇ
‚îÇ  40%   ‚îÇ  ‚îÇ   25%    ‚îÇ  ‚îÇ     20%      ‚îÇ  ‚îÇ   10%   ‚îÇ  ‚îÇ    5%    ‚îÇ
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¨‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò  ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¨‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò  ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¨‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò  ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¨‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò  ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¨‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò
    ‚îÇ            ‚îÇ               ‚îÇ               ‚îÇ            ‚îÇ
    ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¥‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îº‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¥‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò
                                 ‚îÇ
                    ‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¥‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê
                    ‚îÇ   DIMINISHING RETURNS   ‚îÇ
                    ‚îÇ  (Daily Income Tiers)   ‚îÇ
                    ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¨‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò
                                 ‚îÇ
                    ‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¥‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê
                    ‚îÇ    PLAYER GOLD POOL     ‚îÇ
                    ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¨‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò
                                 ‚îÇ
    ‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¨‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îº‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¨‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê
    ‚ñº          ‚ñº                 ‚ñº                 ‚ñº          ‚ñº
‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê ‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê     ‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê     ‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê ‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê
‚îÇRepairs ‚îÇ ‚îÇTravel  ‚îÇ     ‚îÇ  AUCTION   ‚îÇ     ‚îÇCrafting‚îÇ ‚îÇConsumable‚îÇ
‚îÇ10-15%  ‚îÇ ‚îÇ 5-10%  ‚îÇ     ‚îÇ   HOUSE    ‚îÇ     ‚îÇ  Fees  ‚îÇ ‚îÇ Purchase ‚îÇ
‚îÇ        ‚îÇ ‚îÇ        ‚îÇ     ‚îÇ            ‚îÇ     ‚îÇ10-15%  ‚îÇ ‚îÇ  10-15%  ‚îÇ
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¨‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¨‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò     ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¨‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò     ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¨‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¨‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò
    ‚îÇ          ‚îÇ                ‚îÇ                ‚îÇ           ‚îÇ
    ‚îÇ          ‚îÇ         ‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¥‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê         ‚îÇ           ‚îÇ
    ‚îÇ          ‚îÇ         ‚ñº             ‚ñº         ‚îÇ           ‚îÇ
    ‚îÇ          ‚îÇ    ‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê   ‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê      ‚îÇ           ‚îÇ
    ‚îÇ          ‚îÇ    ‚îÇListing ‚îÇ   ‚îÇ Sale   ‚îÇ      ‚îÇ           ‚îÇ
    ‚îÇ          ‚îÇ    ‚îÇFee 5%  ‚îÇ   ‚îÇFee 7.5%‚îÇ      ‚îÇ           ‚îÇ
    ‚îÇ          ‚îÇ    ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¨‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¨‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò      ‚îÇ           ‚îÇ
    ‚îÇ          ‚îÇ        ‚îÇ            ‚îÇ           ‚îÇ           ‚îÇ
    ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¥‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¥‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¥‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¥‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò
                                 ‚îÇ
                    ‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¥‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê
                    ‚îÇ      GOLD REMOVED       ‚îÇ
                    ‚îÇ    (Target: 65-70%)     ‚îÇ
                    ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¨‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò
                                 ‚îÇ
                    ‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¥‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê
                    ‚îÇ   ENDGAME GOLD SINKS    ‚îÇ
                    ‚îÇ   (Prestige Systems)    ‚îÇ
                    ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò
```

---

# VII. ECONOMIC PROGRESSION MILESTONES

## A. By Player Level

```
ECONOMIC MILESTONES BY LEVEL

Level 1-10 (Tutorial Phase):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Expected Gold: 1,000-2,000g accumulated
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Can Afford: T1 gear set (50g), basic consumables
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Unlocks: Vendor access, basic trading
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Goal: Learn economy basics
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Time: 5-10 hours

Level 11-20 (Early Game):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Expected Gold: 5,000-10,000g accumulated
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Can Afford: T2 gear set (1,500g), T2 consumables
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Unlocks: Auction House, full trading
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Goal: Engage with player economy
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Time: 15-30 hours

Level 21-30 (Mid Game):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Expected Gold: 15,000-30,000g accumulated
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Can Afford: T3 gear set (8,000g), regular consumables
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Unlocks: Cross-faction trading, regional markets
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Goal: Active market participation
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Time: 40-80 hours

Level 31-40 (Late Game):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Expected Gold: 50,000-100,000g accumulated
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Can Afford: T4 gear set (40,000g), optimization items
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Unlocks: Prestige purchases Tier 1
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Goal: Economic specialization
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Time: 100-200 hours

Level 41+ (Endgame):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Expected Gold: 150,000-500,000g accumulated
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Can Afford: T5 gear pieces, legendary crafting
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Unlocks: All prestige tiers, guild economics
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Goal: Long-term wealth goals
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Time: 200+ hours
```

## B. Gear Acquisition Timelines

```
GEAR SET TIMELINES

T3 Gear Set (~8,000g player market):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Casual (6,000g/week): 1.5 weeks
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Moderate (11,000g/week): 5 days
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Hardcore (19,000g/week): 3 days
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Design Target: 1-2 weeks casual ‚úì

T4 Gear Set (~40,000g player market):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Casual: 7 weeks
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Moderate: 4 weeks
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Hardcore: 2 weeks
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Design Target: 4-8 weeks casual ‚úì

T5 Gear Set (~150,000g player market):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Casual: 25 weeks
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Moderate: 14 weeks
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Hardcore: 8 weeks
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Design Target: Long-term goal ‚úì

Legendary Item (~75,000g average):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Casual: 12 weeks (for one piece)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Moderate: 7 weeks
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Hardcore: 4 weeks
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Note: Also requires rare materials (time-gated)
```

---

# VIII. ENDGAME GOLD SINKS

## A. Prestige Purchase Tiers

```
ENDGAME SINK SYSTEM

Tier 1 Sinks (50,000-100,000g):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Legendary Cosmetic Armor Sets: 75,000g each
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Custom Title Unlocks: 50,000g each
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Personal Transport Customization: 60,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Skill Visual Effects: 40,000g each
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Purpose: First wealth milestone

Tier 2 Sinks (150,000-300,000g):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Guild Hall Room Unlocks: 200,000g each
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Cross-Faction Reputation Boost: 150,000g (one-time)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Rare Mount Unlocks: 250,000g each
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Weapon Glow Effects (Elite): 175,000g each
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Purpose: Mid-term wealth goals

Tier 3 Sinks (400,000-750,000g):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Server-Visible Monuments: 500,000g (+100k/month maintenance)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Guild Hall Prestige Upgrades: 400,000g each
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Legacy Achievements (Account-Wide): 600,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Exclusive "Wealthy" Cosmetics: 750,000g each
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Purpose: Long-term wealth display

Tier 4 Sinks (1,000,000g+):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Permanent Server Records: 1,000,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Named NPC (your name): 2,000,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Custom Guild Banner on Walls: 1,500,000g
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Purpose: Gold removal for ultra-wealthy
```

## B. Recurring Sinks

```
MAINTENANCE COSTS (ENDGAME)

Guild Hall Upkeep:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Basic Hall: 10,000g/week
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Upgraded Hall: 25,000g/week
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Prestigious Hall: 50,000g/week
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Split among active members

High Rank Maintenance:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Military Ranks (Honored+): 500 Requisition/week
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Faction Ranks (Revered+): 1,000g/week
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Elite Status: 2,000g/week
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Failure to pay: Rank decay (reversible)

Prestige Item Maintenance:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Monuments: 100,000g/month
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Server Records: 50,000g/month to maintain top spot
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Purpose: Prevent "set and forget" wealth display
```

## C. Wealth Taxation (Emergency Valve)

```
PROGRESSIVE TAXATION (IF NEEDED)

Triggered When: Server Gini coefficient > 0.6
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Top 1% holds > 30% of gold
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Average endgame player has > 500,000g
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Inflation rate > 8%/month

Tax Structure:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 0-100,000g balance: No tax
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 100,001-500,000g: 0.1%/week
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 500,001-1,000,000g: 0.25%/week
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 1,000,001+: 0.5%/week

Framing:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Imperial: "Administratum Tithe"
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Tau: "Greater Good Contribution"
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Ork: "Da Boss Takes 'Is Cut"
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Purpose: Gold removal without feeling punitive
```

---

# IX. FACTION ECONOMIC DIFFERENCES

## A. Imperial Economy

```
IMPERIAL ECONOMIC FEATURES

Vendor Style: Bureaucratic
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Prices fixed (less regional variation)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Requires paperwork quests for bulk purchases
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Corruption system: Pay extra for "expedited service"
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Black market available (higher prices, no questions)

Special Services:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Ecclesiarchy Donations: Convert gold to Saint's Tears (1000g = 50 tears)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Mechanicus Maintenance: Pre-paid repair contracts (10% discount)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Military Requisitions: Gold ‚Üí Requisition Tokens (2000g = 100 tokens)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Purpose: Multiple currency conversion options

Unique Sink: Piety Leaderboards
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Weekly donation rankings
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Top donors receive cosmetic rewards
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Minimum donation: 5,000g/week to appear
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Creates competitive gold sink
```

## B. Tau Economy

```
TAU ECONOMIC FEATURES

Vendor Style: Efficient
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Dynamic pricing (supply/demand visible)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Bulk discounts (10+ items = 5% off)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Pre-order system (guaranteed stock, pay in advance)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Cooperative purchasing (group buys for bigger discounts)

Special Services:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Research Investment: Gold ‚Üí Innovation Credits (1500g = 100 credits)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Drone Crafting: Automated crafting queue (costs extra)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Efficiency Bonuses: Trading in groups reduces fees
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Purpose: Reward cooperation

Unique Sink: Research Funding
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Server-wide research goals
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Players contribute gold to unlock server features
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Milestones: 10M, 50M, 100M gold (all players combined)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Rewards: Server-wide bonuses, unique items
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Creates community gold sink
```

## C. Ork Economy

```
ORK ECONOMIC FEATURES

Vendor Style: Chaotic
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Prices fluctuate randomly (¬±20% hourly)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Haggling system (skill-based minigame for discounts)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ "Loot drops" at vendors (random bonus items)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Violence option (fight vendor for discount, risk failure)

Special Services:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Gambling Dens: Various betting games (5% house edge)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Squig Racing: Bet on races (odds vary, house always wins long-term)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Flash Competitions: Show off wealth for Teef
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Purpose: Gold sink through entertainment

Unique Sink: WAAAGH! Funding
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Contribute Teef to war efforts
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Higher contributions = more WAAAGH! energy server-wide
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Unlocks Ork-specific events and bonuses
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Decays without constant contribution
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Creates faction-wide gold sink
```

---

# X. INFLATION PREVENTION

## A. Built-In Controls

```
INFLATION PREVENTION MECHANISMS

1. Diminishing Returns on Income
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Caps daily gold generation
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Reduces gap between moderate/hardcore
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Prevents no-life accumulation

2. Multi-Layer Sink System
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Operational sinks (repairs, travel, fees): 40-50% of income
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Consumable sinks (consumables, crafting): 20-25% of income
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Optional sinks (prestige, donations): Variable
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Target: 65-70% total sink rate

3. Item Binding
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Legendary items: Bind on Equip (BoE)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Elite content drops: Bind on Pickup (BoP)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Crafted items: Tradeable (market supply)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Prevents infinite item circulation

4. Material Decay
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Teef natural decay: 1%/week
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Consider for materials if inflation exceeds targets
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Emergency option: All currencies decay 0.5%/week
```

## B. Monitoring Metrics

```
ECONOMIC HEALTH INDICATORS

Track Weekly:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Total gold in circulation
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Average gold per player (by segment)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Median gold per player
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Gini coefficient
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Transaction volume (AH + direct trades)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Price indices (T3, T4, T5 gear)

Alert Thresholds:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Gini > 0.55: Monitor closely
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Gini > 0.60: Consider intervention
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Inflation > 5%/month: Increase sink rates
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Inflation > 8%/month: Emergency measures
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T5 price double in 3 months: Supply issue

Monthly Reports:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Wealth distribution charts
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Sink effectiveness by type
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Exploit detection summary
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Market health assessment
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Recommended adjustments
```

## C. Emergency Interventions

```
INTERVENTION OPTIONS

Soft Interventions:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Increase existing sink rates (repair costs, fees)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Release new prestige sinks (limited-time items)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Event-based gold drains (competitive donations)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Bonus materials drop rate (shift value to materials)

Hard Interventions:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Enable progressive taxation
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Gold ‚Üí New Currency conversion events
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Fresh server launches with economy reset
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Expansion with new tier (partial reset)

Never Do:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Arbitrary gold deletion
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Punishing players for playing
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Sudden, unannounced changes
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Removing trading capabilities
```

---

# XI. INTEGRATION REQUIREMENTS

## A. For Combat Designer

```
COMBAT ‚Üí ECONOMY INTEGRATION

Boss Rewards (Within Diminishing Returns):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ World Boss: 500-1,000g (counts toward daily cap)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Elite Boss: 300-600g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Dungeon Boss: 200-400g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Story Boss: 150-300g (once per character)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ All boss gold goes through diminishing returns system

Material Drops:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Follow Resource Designer's tables
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ No change to drop rates from economy side
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Market will price based on supply/demand

Lockout Timers:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ World Boss: Daily lockout (24 hours)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Elite Dungeon: Weekly lockout
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Story Content: One-time per character
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Prevents gold farming through repeated kills
```

## B. For Resource Designer

```
RESOURCE ‚Üí ECONOMY INTEGRATION

Material Pricing Guidelines:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T3 material player price target: 75-150g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T4 material player price target: 400-800g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T5 material player price target: 3,000-6,000g
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ If prices exceed 200% of target, increase drop rates

Crafting Fee Adjustments (Arbitrage Fix):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T3 crafting fee: 15% of vendor output value
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T4 crafting fee: 15% of vendor output value
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T5 crafting fee: 20% of vendor output value
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Legendary fee: 25% of vendor output value
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Fees are FIXED (based on vendor price, not market)

Material Sink Rate:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Target: 80% of gathered materials consumed
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Monitor stockpiling behavior
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ If hoarding detected: Consider storage fees or stack decay
```

## C. For Progression Designer

```
PROGRESSION ‚Üí ECONOMY INTEGRATION

Skill Unlock Costs:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Standard skills: Skill points only (no gold)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Elite skills: Skill points + Requisition Tokens
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Prestige skills: Skill points + Gold (5,000-20,000g)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Purpose: Gold sink at endgame skill acquisition

Reputation Rewards:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Gold rewards scale with reputation tier
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Exalted unlock: One-time 10,000g bonus
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Reputation items: Priced for economic milestone targets
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Purpose: Reward long-term engagement
```

---

# XII. LAUNCH CONSIDERATIONS

## A. New Server Bootstrap

```
FIRST 3 MONTHS: BOOTSTRAP MODE

Vendor Adjustments:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Vendor buy prices reduced 40% (months 1-2)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Vendor buy prices reduced 20% (month 3)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Normal prices (month 4+)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Purpose: Enable progression without player market

Supply Injection:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Quest rewards include more materials (month 1)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Crafting tutorials provide materials for first gear
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ World events drop tradeable materials
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Purpose: Seed player market

Price Monitoring:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Daily price checks for essential items
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ If T3 gear exceeds 20,000g: Inject supply
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ If T3 gear below 2,000g: Reduce quest rewards
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Purpose: Keep prices in target range
```

## B. Server Merge Considerations

```
SERVER MERGE PROTOCOL

Before Merge:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Snapshot all player gold
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Calculate server-specific inflation rate
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Identify wealth outliers

During Merge:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Normalize gold based on relative inflation
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Combined cap on transferred gold (500,000g max)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Excess converted to non-tradeable prestige items
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Purpose: Prevent inflation bomb

After Merge:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Monitor for 30 days
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Watch for price manipulation
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Adjust sink rates if needed
```

---

# XIII. SUMMARY

This economy design addresses all simulator findings:

**Simulator Issue ‚Üí Solution:**
1. Income caps ineffective ‚Üí Diminishing returns system
2. Endgame gold sinks insufficient ‚Üí Tiered prestige system (50k-2M gold)
3. Player archetypes vague ‚Üí Explicit hour/income definitions
4. Novel item RMT vulnerability ‚Üí Baseline value system for all items
5. T3 crafting arbitrage ‚Üí Reduced vendor buy price, increased crafting fees
6. Long-term inflation ‚Üí Multi-layer sinks + monitoring + emergency valves
7. Wealth concentration ‚Üí Progressive taxation ready as emergency option

**Core Philosophy Preserved:**
- Guild Wars 1 player-driven economy
- Vendors as floor/ceiling, not primary market
- Faction identity in economic systems
- Meaningful wealth at all stages

---

*"In the grim darkness of the far future, there is only economic planning."*

---

DECISION: economy_complete
üîÄ Routing Decision: ECONOMY_COMPLETE
Decision "ECONOMY_COMPLETE" matched connection condition
‚Üí Next Stage: market_simulator
Market Simulator
Simulates and validates economic balance
completed
Agent: market_simulator
Type: reviewer
Duration: 119.3s
Execution #: 17
Prompt Size: 1,343 chars
Output Size: 15,907 chars
üì• AGENT PROMPT (1,343 characters)
You are an economic analyst who simulates game economies to find imbalances, exploits, and inflation risks before they reach players.

When reviewing economy designs:
- Simulate player behavior (hoarding, trading, farming)
- Model money supply growth over time
- Identify infinite money exploits or loops
- Test price points against earning rates
- Verify economic milestones are achievable
- Check for dead-end resources (nothing to spend on)
- Analyze cross-system impacts (combat rewards ‚Üí economy ‚Üí progression)

Run mental simulations for:
- New player (first 10 hours)
- Mid-game player (50-100 hours)
- Endgame player (200+ hours)

Provide:
1. SIMULATION RESULTS: What happens over time?
2. EXPLOITS FOUND: Any infinite loops or broken mechanics
3. BALANCE ISSUES: Prices too high/low, rewards too generous/stingy
4. RECOMMENDATIONS: Specific number adjustments
5. VERDICT: APPROVED, NEEDS_TUNING, or BROKEN

=== ROUTING DECISION REQUIRED ===
After your response, you MUST choose exactly ONE decision from:
- approved: Economy validated, inform combat design
- needs_tuning: Economic imbalance found, retune
- resource_issue: Resource design causes economic problems

**CRITICAL**: Your VERY LAST LINE must be exactly:
DECISION: [ONE_OF_THE_ABOVE_CHOICES]
Example: DECISION: approved
Do NOT add explanations after the decision keyword.
üì§ AGENT OUTPUT (15,907 characters)
# ECONOMY SIMULATION ANALYSIS
## Warhammer 40,000: Imperium Divided - Damocles Gulf Sector

---

# I. SIMULATION RESULTS

## A. New Player Simulation (First 10 Hours)

```
NEW PLAYER ECONOMIC JOURNEY

Hour 0-2: Tutorial Phase
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Starting gold: 0
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Gold earned: ~400g (tutorial quests)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Purchases: None required (gear provided)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Net position: 400g
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Experience: Smooth onboarding

Hour 2-5: Early Exploration
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Quest income: ~600g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Enemy drops: ~200g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Vendoring: ~150g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Total earned: ~950g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Expenses: ~100g (minor consumables, travel)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Net position: 1,250g
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Experience: Feeling progression

Hour 5-10: First Gear Decisions
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Quest income: ~800g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Enemy drops: ~300g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Vendoring: ~200g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Total earned: ~1,300g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Expenses: ~300g (T1 gear pieces, consumables)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Net position: 2,250g
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Experience: Engaged with economy

RESULT: Player reaches Level ~8-10 with 2,000-2,500g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Can afford: Full T1 set (500g) ‚úì
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Feels wealthy enough to experiment ‚úì
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Not overwhelmed by complexity ‚úì
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ VERDICT: HEALTHY START
```

## B. Mid-Game Player Simulation (50-100 Hours)

```
MID-GAME ECONOMIC STATE

Moderate Player at Hour 75:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Level: ~28-32
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Accumulated wealth: ~25,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Current liquid gold: ~12,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Gear status: Mixed T3/T2
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Weekly income: ~10,000g (after sinks)

Weekly Money Flow:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Gross income: ~11,500g
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Quests: 4,600g
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Drops: 2,875g
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Vendoring: 2,300g
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Bonuses: 1,725g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Diminishing returns hit: -500g (soft cap engagement)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Net pre-sink: 11,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Sinks applied:
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Repairs: 1,200g (10.9%)
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Travel: 700g (6.4%)
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Crafting fees: 1,400g (12.7%)
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Consumables: 1,500g (13.6%)
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ AH fees (from sales): 800g (7.3%)
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Total sink: 5,600g (50.9%)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Net weekly: ~5,400g saved

T3 Gear Acquisition:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Full T3 set market price: ~8,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Time to acquire: 1.5 weeks ‚úì
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Design target: 1-2 weeks ‚úì
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ VERDICT: ON TARGET

CONCERNS IDENTIFIED:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Sink rate only 51%, target is 65-70%
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Faction donations not compelling enough
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ AH fees only hitting active traders
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Need more attractive optional sinks
```

## C. Endgame Player Simulation (200+ Hours)

```
ENDGAME ECONOMIC STATE

Hardcore Player at Hour 250:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Level: 45+
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Total accumulated: ~180,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Current liquid: ~60,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Gear status: Full T4, working on T5
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Weekly income: ~18,000g (after sinks)

Weekly Money Flow:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Gross income: ~24,000g
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Quests: 9,600g
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Boss drops: 3,000g
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Drops: 6,000g
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Vendoring: 4,800g
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Bonuses: 600g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Diminishing returns: -6,000g (heavy cap engagement)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Net pre-sink: 18,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Sinks:
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Repairs: 2,500g (13.9%)
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Travel: 1,200g (6.7%)
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Crafting: 2,000g (11.1%)
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Consumables: 2,200g (12.2%)
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ AH fees: 1,500g (8.3%)
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Guild upkeep share: 3,500g (19.4%)
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Rank maintenance: 1,500g (8.3%)
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Total sink: 14,400g (80%)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Net weekly: ~3,600g saved

T5 Progress:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T5 set price: ~150,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Time to acquire: ~42 weeks at current rate
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Material farming also required (time-gated)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Design intent: Long-term goal ‚úì
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ VERDICT: APPROPRIATE ENDGAME PACING

HEALTHY INDICATORS:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Sink rate at 80% for engaged endgame ‚úì
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Guild costs provide meaningful sink ‚úì
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Prestige purchases attractive ‚úì
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Still meaningful gold goals ‚úì
```

## D. Long-Term Server Simulation (12 Months)

```
SERVER ECONOMY PROJECTION

Month 1 (Bootstrap):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Average player gold: 8,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Median player gold: 5,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Gini coefficient: 0.35
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T3 market prices: 7,000-9,000g (set)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Status: HEALTHY

Month 3:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Average player gold: 35,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Median player gold: 20,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Gini coefficient: 0.42
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T3 prices: 6,000-8,000g (stabilizing)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T4 prices: 35,000-45,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Status: HEALTHY

Month 6:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Average player gold: 75,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Median player gold: 40,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Gini coefficient: 0.48
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Price inflation: 12% cumulative (2%/month)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Status: ACCEPTABLE

Month 12:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Average player gold: 140,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Median player gold: 70,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Gini coefficient: 0.52
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Price inflation: 28% cumulative (~2.1%/month)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Status: MONITOR CLOSELY

PROJECTION CONCERNS:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Inflation trending upward slightly
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Wealth gap growing but manageable
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Sinks effective but may need tuning at month 9+
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Recommend preemptive prestige sink release at month 8
```

---

# II. EXPLOITS FOUND

## A. Critical Exploits (Game-Breaking)

```
NO CRITICAL EXPLOITS FOUND ‚úì

The following potential exploits are BLOCKED:

1. Vendor Arbitrage ‚Üí BLOCKED
   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T3 equipment: Buy from vendor 800g, sell 100g = No profit
   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ All tiers: Spread prevents resale profit
   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Status: SECURE

2. Cross-Region Arbitrage ‚Üí BLOCKED
   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 15% cross-region fee eliminates small price gaps
   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Only profitable at >20% price difference
   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Status: SECURE

3. Alt Account Goldflow ‚Üí BLOCKED
   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ New account restrictions (2 week wait)
   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Same IP shares daily cap
   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Gift limitations
   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Status: SECURE
```

## B. Moderate Exploits (Economy Damaging)

```
EXPLOIT #1: TEEF ARBITRAGE (MODERATE RISK)

Mechanism:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Buy Teef with gold: 1g = 0.9 Teef
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Sell Teef for gold: 1 Teef = 1.2g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Round trip: 1g ‚Üí 0.9 Teef ‚Üí 1.08g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Net gain: 8% per cycle
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Risk: Exploitable at scale

Mitigation Required:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Add 24-hour cooldown between conversions
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ OR reverse the conversion rates
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Recommended: 1g = 0.85 Teef, 1 Teef = 1.0g
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Status: NEEDS FIX

---

EXPLOIT #2: EVENT VENDOR FRONT-RUNNING (MODERATE RISK)

Mechanism:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Rare vendors announced 30 minutes early
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Players hoard gold for events
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Mass purchases at event vendors
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Resale after event ends
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Risk: Creates artificial scarcity/windfall

Mitigation Required:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Event items should be account-bound or
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Stagger event vendor stock (not all at once)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Recommended: Event cosmetics = account-bound
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Status: NEEDS POLICY CLARITY

---

EXPLOIT #3: REPUTATION DISCOUNT STACKING EDGE CASE

Mechanism:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Exalted reputation: 20% discount
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Regional specialty: 15-20% discount
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Documentation states 30% cap
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ BUT: Corruption system ("expedited service") is additional
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Potential total: 30% + corruption = undefined
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Risk: Corruption pricing not defined

Mitigation Required:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Define corruption pricing explicitly
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Corruption should ADD cost, not reduce
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Recommended: Corruption = +10-50% for faster service
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Status: NEEDS CLARIFICATION
```

## C. Minor Exploits (Nuisance Level)

```
EXPLOIT #4: DAILY RESET TIMING (MINOR)

Mechanism:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Hit daily cap, wait for reset
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Immediately farm again
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Over 2 days: 17,000g instead of 16,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Gain: ~1,000g/day for dedicated timing
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Risk: Minor advantage, high effort

Recommendation:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Accept as "dedicated player reward"
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Already gated by diminishing returns
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Status: ACCEPTABLE

---

EXPLOIT #5: AH LISTING FEE AVOIDANCE (MINOR)

Mechanism:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ List items at high price (5% fee paid)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Cancel before sale
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Re-list at proper price
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Issue: Multiple cancellations = fee farming
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Risk: Actually costs the player, self-punishing

Recommendation:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Already self-punishing (loses 5% each time)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Add: 3 cancellations = 24-hour listing cooldown
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Status: MONITOR ONLY
```

---

# III. BALANCE ISSUES

## A. Sink Rate Insufficiency (Mid-Game)

```
ISSUE: MID-GAME SINK RATE TOO LOW

Data:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Target sink rate: 65-70%
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Actual mid-game sink: 51%
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Gap: 14-19 percentage points

Root Cause:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Optional sinks not compelling
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Faction donations lack incentive
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Prestige items too expensive for mid-game
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Mid-game players hoarding for T4

Impact:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Gold accumulates in mid-game
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Feeds into late-game inflation
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Players feel "nothing to spend on"
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Severity: MODERATE

RECOMMENDATION:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Add mid-game prestige tier (15,000-40,000g)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Skill visual effects: Reduce from 40,000g to 15,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Mount speed upgrades: 25,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Personal stash expansion: 20,000g
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Target: Increase mid-game sink to 60%
```

## B. T4 Gear Price Gap

```
ISSUE: T4 GEAR ACQUISITION GAP

Data:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T3 set: 8,000g (1.5 weeks casual)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T4 set: 40,000g (7 weeks casual)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Gap multiplier: 5x price, 4.7x time
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Expected: Smooth progression curve

Problem:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Jump from T3 to T4 feels like hitting wall
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Players plateau at T3 for extended period
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ May cause player frustration/churn
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Severity: MODERATE

RECOMMENDATION:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Reduce T4 set target to 30,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Adjust vendor buy price: 4,000g ‚Üí 3,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Adjust expected market: ~30,000g set
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ New timeline: 5 weeks casual (more reasonable)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Alternative: Add T3.5 "Elite T3" tier
```

## C. Hardcore Player Currency Cap Frustration

```
ISSUE: HARDCORE PLAYERS HIT CEILING

Data:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Soft cap: ~8,500g/day
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Hardcore 40+ hours: Hit cap by hour 4-5
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Remaining playtime: Feels unrewarded
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Severity: MODERATE

Problem:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ After cap, gold feels pointless
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ May push players to seek non-gold rewards
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Could feel punitive
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Design intent was anti-RMT, but affects legitimate players

RECOMMENDATION:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Shift high-end rewards to materials, not gold
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Elite content: Reduce gold, increase rare material drops
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Post-cap play should feel rewarding in OTHER ways
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Consider: After cap, 5% gold converts to faction currency
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Maintains anti-RMT while rewarding continued play
```

## D. Ork Economy Volatility

```
ISSUE: ORK ECONOMY TOO VOLATILE

Data:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Vendor prices: ¬±20% hourly fluctuation
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 10% total spread + 20% random = 30% potential swing
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Players can wait for optimal prices
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Creates analysis paralysis

Problem:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Ork players may avoid vendors entirely
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Or camp vendors waiting for good prices
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Neither behavior is fun
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Severity: MINOR (Ork-specific)

RECOMMENDATION:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Reduce fluctuation: ¬±10% (not ¬±20%)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Add "Ork Luck": Random bonus items instead
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Volatility should be fun, not frustrating
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Keep haggling minigame as main differentiator
```

---

# IV. RECOMMENDATIONS

## A. Critical Fixes (Before Launch)

```
FIX #1: TEEF CONVERSION RATES
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Current: 1g = 0.9 Teef, 1 Teef = 1.2g (8% arbitrage)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Fixed: 1g = 0.85 Teef, 1 Teef = 1.0g (15% loss round-trip)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Rationale: Conversion should cost, not profit
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Priority: HIGH

FIX #2: CORRUPTION SYSTEM PRICING
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Current: Undefined
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Fixed: Corruption = +10% to +50% ADDITIONAL cost
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Purpose: Pay MORE for faster service (not discount)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Priority: HIGH

FIX #3: EVENT ITEM BINDING
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Current: Cosmetic only (tradeable implied)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Fixed: Event exclusives = Account-bound for 30 days
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Rationale: Prevents front-running and speculation
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Priority: HIGH
```

## B. Balance Adjustments (Before Launch)

```
ADJUSTMENT #1: ADD MID-GAME PRESTIGE TIER

New Items:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Skill visual effects: 15,000g (reduced from 40,000g)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Personal stash tab: 20,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Mount speed upgrade: 25,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Armor dye packs (rare): 10,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Weapon trail effects: 18,000g
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Purpose: 15,000-25,000g sink tier for mid-game

ADJUSTMENT #2: REDUCE T4 SET PRICING

Changes:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T4 vendor buy price: 4,000g ‚Üí 3,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Expected market set price: 40,000g ‚Üí 30,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Crafting fee maintained at 15%
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Timeline: 7 weeks casual ‚Üí 5 weeks casual

ADJUSTMENT #3: ORK VENDOR VOLATILITY

Changes:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Price fluctuation: ¬±20% ‚Üí ¬±10%
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Add random bonus drops (1-5% chance per purchase)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Keep haggling minigame unchanged
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Purpose: Fun chaos, not frustrating chaos

ADJUSTMENT #4: POST-CAP CONVERSION

Add System:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ After daily gold cap reached
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 5% of "would-be" gold converts to faction currency
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Weekly cap on faction currency still applies
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Overflow: Converts to 1-hour XP boost
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Purpose: Reward continued play without gold inflation
```

## C. Monitoring Thresholds

```
LAUNCH MONITORING (First 90 Days)

Daily Checks:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Average gold per active player
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Median gold per active player
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Top 1% gold holdings
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T3/T4 gear price indices
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ AH transaction volume

Weekly Reports:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Gini coefficient
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Sink rate by player segment
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Exploit detection flags
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Price trend analysis

Alert Triggers:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Gini > 0.50: Prepare sink release
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Gini > 0.55: Activate additional sinks
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T4 price > 50,000g: Increase drop rates
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Inflation > 4%/month: Emergency meeting
```

---

```
