---

# VI. FINAL VERDICT

## Summary Assessment

| Category | Status | Notes |
|----------|--------|-------|
| New Player Experience | ‚úÖ HEALTHY | Clear progression, feels rewarding |
| Mid-Game Economy | ‚ö†Ô∏è NEEDS TUNING | Sink rate low, T4 gap too large |
| Endgame Economy | ‚úÖ HEALTHY | Strong sinks, meaningful goals |
| Inflation Control | ‚úÖ HEALTHY | Diminishing returns effective |
| Exploit Prevention | ‚ö†Ô∏è NEEDS TUNING | Teef arbitrage, corruption undefined |
| Long-Term Stability | ‚úÖ HEALTHY | Monitoring system robust |

## Critical Items

1. **MUST FIX**: Teef conversion arbitrage (8% free money)
2. **MUST FIX**: Define corruption pricing (currently undefined)
3. **SHOULD FIX**: Add mid-game prestige tier (15k-25k range)
4. **SHOULD FIX**: Reduce T4 set pricing from 40k to 30k
5. **MINOR**: Reduce Ork vendor volatility

## Verdict

The economy design is fundamentally sound with Guild Wars 1-style player-driven markets, robust anti-RMT protections, and comprehensive sink systems. However, several balance issues and one exploit require attention before approval.

The Teef arbitrage loop creates an infinite money exploit that must be fixed. The mid-game sink gap and T4 pricing cliff will cause player frustration and contribute to long-term inflation.

With the recommended fixes applied, this economy should support a healthy, sustainable game for years.

---

**VERDICT: NEEDS_TUNING**

Required changes:
- Fix Teef conversion rates to eliminate arbitrage
- Define corruption system pricing explicitly
- Add mid-game prestige sink tier
- Reduce T4 set pricing gap

Once these four items are addressed, the economy can be approved for implementation.

---

DECISION: needs_tuning
üîÄ Routing Decision: NEEDS_TUNING
Decision "NEEDS_TUNING" matched connection condition
‚Üí Next Stage: economy_designer
Economy Designer
Designs trading, markets, and economic systems
completed
Agent: economy_designer
Type: designer
Duration: 202.6s
Execution #: 18
Prompt Size: 1,233 chars
Output Size: 32,379 chars
üì• AGENT PROMPT (1,233 characters)
You are an economy designer who creates engaging and balanced market systems. You work with resources designed by the Resource Designer to create trading, shops, auctions, and player-to-player economies.

When designing economy systems:
- Design NPC vendor systems (fixed prices vs. dynamic)
- Create auction house / player trading mechanics
- Establish price ranges and money sinks
- Design economic progression (what can players afford when?)
- Plan for inflation prevention
- Create supply-demand dynamics
- Design regional economy differences (prices vary by location)
- Integrate with combat rewards and progression costs

Output should include:
- Market system mechanics (how trading works)
- Pricing formulas and ranges
- Money flow diagrams (sources and sinks)
- Vendor inventories and refresh timers
- Player trading limitations (prevent exploits)
- Economic milestones by player level/progression

=== ROUTING DECISION REQUIRED ===
After your response, you MUST choose exactly ONE decision from:
- economy_complete: Submit economy for simulation

**CRITICAL**: Your VERY LAST LINE must be exactly:
DECISION: [ONE_OF_THE_ABOVE_CHOICES]
Example: DECISION: economy_complete
Do NOT add explanations after the decision keyword.
üì§ AGENT OUTPUT (32,379 characters)
# ECONOMY DESIGN DOCUMENT
## Warhammer 40,000: Imperium Divided - Damocles Gulf Sector

---

# I. ECONOMY PHILOSOPHY

Drawing from Guild Wars 1's successful economy model, this design prioritizes:

- **Player-driven markets** over vendor-centric economies
- **Meaningful trading** with robust anti-exploitation systems
- **Regional flavor** that reflects faction identities
- **Inflation prevention** through comprehensive sink systems
- **Accessible progression** without pay-to-win pathways

---

# II. MARKET SYSTEMS

## A. Auction House (Primary Trading)

### Core Mechanics

```
AUCTION HOUSE STRUCTURE

Type: Asynchronous buy/sell orders (Guild Wars 1 style)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Sellers list items with asking price
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Buyers place orders with bid price
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ System matches when bid ‚â• ask
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ No real-time bidding (prevents sniping)

Regional Hubs:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ IMPERIAL: Sanctum Commercia (Avalos Prime)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ TAU: Por'la Trading Nexus (T'au Sept Outpost)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ ORK: Da Big Market (Waaagh! Camp)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ NEUTRAL: Freeport Exchange (Contested Zone)

Cross-Faction Trading:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Same faction: Full access
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Allied factions: 90% access (some restrictions)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Enemy factions: Neutral hub only, +15% fee
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Contraband items: Faction-specific, cannot cross
```

### Fee Structure

```
AUCTION HOUSE FEES

Listing Fee: 5% of asking price (paid upfront, non-refundable)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Minimum: 1g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Maximum: 10,000g per listing
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Purpose: Prevents spam listings

Sale Fee: 10% of final sale price (deducted from payment)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Minimum: 1g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ No maximum
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Purpose: Primary gold sink

Cancellation:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Before sale: Listing fee lost (already paid)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 3+ cancellations in 24h: 12-hour listing cooldown
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Purpose: Prevents price manipulation

Cross-Region Fee: +15% (added to sale fee = 25% total)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Applied when buyer/seller in different regions
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Purpose: Encourages regional markets
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Waived during global events
```

### Listing Limits

```
LISTING RESTRICTIONS

Per Account:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Maximum active listings: 50
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Maximum listing duration: 7 days
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Auto-relist option: Yes (repays listing fee)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Expired items: Mailed to player (24h window)

Per Item:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Stack size limits apply (250/100/50/10 by tier)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Equipment: Single item only
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Materials: Up to stack maximum
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ No minimum price (player chooses)

Quantity Limits (Daily):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T1-T2 materials: No limit
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T3 materials: 500 units/day sale cap
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T4 materials: 100 units/day sale cap
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T5 materials: 20 units/day sale cap
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Purpose: Prevents market flooding
```

## B. Direct Player Trading

### Trade Window System

```
DIRECT TRADE MECHANICS

Initiation:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Right-click player ‚Üí "Request Trade"
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Must be within 50 meters
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Both players must accept
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Trade window opens for both

Trade Window:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 6 item slots per side
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Currency input field
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ "Lock" button when satisfied
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ "Accept" button (both must accept after both lock)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ 10-second countdown after mutual lock

Restrictions:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Account-bound items: Cannot trade
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ New accounts (<14 days): 500g daily trade limit
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Same IP accounts: Share daily limit
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Gifting: Max 5,000g per transaction
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Purpose: Anti-RMT, anti-exploitation
```

### Mail System Trading

```
MAIL TRADE MECHANICS

Sending Items:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Cost: 10g + 1% of item vendor value
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Maximum items: 8 per mail
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Maximum gold attachment: 10,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Delivery: Instant (same faction) / 1 hour (cross-faction)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Return: Unclaimed mail returns after 30 days

Restrictions:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Cannot mail to enemy faction
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Cannot mail account-bound items
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ New accounts: Mail disabled for 7 days
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Purpose: Prevents gold selling via mail
```

## C. Vendor Systems

### NPC Vendor Types

```
VENDOR CLASSIFICATION

TYPE 1: STANDARD VENDORS (Fixed Prices)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Location: Major settlements
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Inventory: Basic supplies, T1-T2 gear
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Prices: Fixed, never change
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Purpose: Baseline pricing reference
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Example: Imperial Quartermaster

TYPE 2: SPECIALTY VENDORS (Regional Pricing)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Location: Zone-specific
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Inventory: Regional specialties
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Prices: 15-20% below market for local goods
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Purpose: Encourage zone travel
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Example: Forge World Metalsmith (cheap metals)

TYPE 3: REPUTATION VENDORS (Unlock-gated)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Location: Faction headquarters
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Inventory: Faction-exclusive items
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Prices: Fixed, paid in faction currency + gold
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Purpose: Reputation rewards
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Example: Ecclesiarchy Relic Keeper

TYPE 4: RARE VENDORS (Timed Spawns)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Location: Random (announced 15 min prior)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Inventory: Limited stock unique items
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Prices: Premium (150-200% market value)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Purpose: Event excitement, gold sink
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Example: Wandering Rogue Trader

TYPE 5: BLACK MARKET VENDORS (Corruption System)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Location: Hidden areas
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Inventory: Cross-faction items, contraband
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Prices: +10% to +50% premium ("expedited service")
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Purpose: High-risk, high-reward access
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Example: Tau Sympathizer (sells Tau gear to Imperials)
```

### Vendor Pricing Formulas

```
VENDOR PRICE CALCULATIONS

SELL PRICE (Player sells to vendor):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Formula: Base Value √ó Tier Modifier √ó Condition
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Tier Modifier: T1=0.20, T2=0.20, T3=0.17, T4=0.15, T5=N/A
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Condition: 100%=1.0, 50%=0.5, 0%=0
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Example: T3 item worth 1000g sells for 170g

BUY PRICE (Player buys from vendor):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Formula: Base Value √ó Markup √ó Region Modifier
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Markup: 1.0 (standard) to 1.5 (rare vendor)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Region Modifier: 1.0 (local) to 1.2 (distant)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Example: T3 item base 1000g costs 1000-1500g

REPUTATION DISCOUNTS:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Friendly: 5% discount
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Honored: 10% discount
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Revered: 15% discount
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Exalted: 20% discount
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Maximum discount: 30% (stacking capped)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Note: Discounts apply to BUY only, not sell

REGIONAL SPECIALTY DISCOUNT:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Local specialty items: 15-20% below base
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Example: Forge World metals = 15% cheaper
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Stacks with reputation up to 30% cap
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Purpose: Encourages travel and trade routes
```

### Vendor Inventory Refresh

```
INVENTORY REFRESH TIMERS

Standard Vendors:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Basic supplies: Always available (infinite stock)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T1-T2 equipment: 4-hour refresh, 20 stock each
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T3 equipment: 24-hour refresh, 5 stock each
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Consumables: 1-hour refresh, 50 stock each

Specialty Vendors:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Regional goods: 6-hour refresh, 30 stock
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Rare materials: 24-hour refresh, 10 stock
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Unique items: Weekly refresh, 1-3 stock

Reputation Vendors:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Common items: Always available
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Rare items: 48-hour refresh, 3 stock
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Exclusive items: Weekly refresh, 1 stock
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Title-locked items: One-time purchase per character

Rare Vendors:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Spawn duration: 2 hours
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Spawn frequency: 2-4 times per week per region
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Announcement: 15 minutes before spawn
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Stock: 5-20 units of special items
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ First-come-first-serve (no reservation)
```

---

# III. PRICING STRUCTURE

## A. Base Price Ranges

```
EQUIPMENT PRICING BY TIER

Tier | Vendor Buy | Vendor Sell | Market Low | Market High | Target Market
-----|------------|-------------|------------|-------------|---------------
T1   | 50g        | 10g         | 20g        | 40g         | 30g
T2   | 200g       | 40g         | 80g        | 160g        | 120g
T3   | 800g       | 136g        | 400g       | 700g        | 550g
T4   | 3,000g     | 450g        | 2,000g     | 4,000g      | 3,000g
T5   | N/A        | N/A         | 8,000g     | 15,000g     | 11,000g
Leg  | N/A        | N/A         | 25,000g    | 60,000g     | 40,000g

FULL SET PRICING (8 pieces):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T1 Set: 160-320g (market), 400g (vendor)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T2 Set: 640-1,280g (market), 1,600g (vendor)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T3 Set: 3,200-5,600g (market), 6,400g (vendor)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T4 Set: 16,000-32,000g (market), 24,000g (vendor) [ADJUSTED]
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T5 Set: 64,000-120,000g (market only)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Legendary Set: 200,000-480,000g (market only)
```

```
MATERIAL PRICING BY TIER

Tier | Vendor Buy | Vendor Sell | Market Low | Market High | Target Market
-----|------------|-------------|------------|-------------|---------------
T1   | 5g         | 1g          | 1g         | 3g          | 2g
T2   | 25g        | 5g          | 8g         | 20g         | 12g
T3   | 150g       | 25g         | 50g        | 120g        | 80g
T4   | 1,000g     | 150g        | 400g       | 800g        | 600g
T5   | N/A        | N/A         | 2,000g     | 5,000g      | 3,500g
```

```
CONSUMABLE PRICING BY TIER

Tier | Vendor Buy | Vendor Sell | Market Low | Market High
-----|------------|-------------|------------|------------
T1   | 10g        | 2g          | 5g         | 8g
T2   | 50g        | 10g         | 25g        | 40g
T3   | 300g       | 51g         | 150g       | 250g
T4   | 2,000g     | 300g        | 1,000g     | 1,800g
```

## B. Service Pricing

```
SERVICE COSTS

Waypoint Travel:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Same zone: 10g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Adjacent zone: 25g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Distant zone (same region): 50g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Cross-region: 100g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Emergency recall (combat): 200g
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Free travel: Guild halls, home point

Repairs:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Formula: Item Value √ó Damage% √ó 0.05
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T1 full repair: ~3g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T2 full repair: ~10g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T3 full repair: ~40g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T4 full repair: ~150g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T5 full repair: ~550g
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Repair kits: 50% cost, field-usable

Respecs:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ First respec: Free
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Subsequent respecs: 500g base + (100g √ó respec count)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Weekly reset: Counter reduces by 1
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Maximum cost: 5,000g
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Full reset item: 10,000g (one-time purchase)

Crafting Services:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ NPC crafting fee: 15% of item value
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Player crafter: Negotiable (typically 5-10%)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Salvaging: 25g + 2% of item value
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Enhancement: 20% of enhancement value
```

---

# IV. MONEY FLOW ANALYSIS

## A. Gold Sources (Faucets)

```
GOLD GENERATION SOURCES

PRIMARY SOURCES (80% of gold entering economy):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Quest Rewards: 40%
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Story quests: 50-600g per mission
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Side quests: 25-150g per mission
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Daily bounties: 25-50g each (3 available)
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Weekly challenges: 200-400g each
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Enemy Drops: 25%
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Standard enemies: 5-60g
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Veterans: 20-40g
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Elites: 35-60g
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Bosses: 100-200g
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Vendoring Loot: 15%
    ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Equipment sales
    ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Material sales (excess)
    ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Consumable sales

SECONDARY SOURCES (20% of gold entering economy):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Mission Completion Bonuses: 8%
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ First-time completion: +50%
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Speed bonuses: +10-25%
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ No-death bonus: +15%
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Event Rewards: 7%
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ World events: 50-200g
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Seasonal events: Variable
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ PvP tournaments: 500-5,000g
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Achievement Rewards: 5%
    ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ One-time unlocks
    ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Milestone bonuses
```

## B. Gold Sinks (Drains)

```
GOLD REMOVAL SYSTEMS

PASSIVE SINKS (Always Active):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Waypoint Travel: 10%
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Constant small drain
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Scales with activity
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Repair Costs: 15%
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Scales with gear tier
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Incentivizes skill (less death = less repair)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Consumable Purchases: 12%
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Combat consumables
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Utility items
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Auction House Fees: 10%
    ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 5% listing fee
    ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ 10% sale fee

ACTIVE SINKS (Player Choice):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Crafting Fees: 12%
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 15% of item value
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Material conversion costs
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Faction Donations: 8%
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Reputation gains
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Faction-wide goals
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Weekly caps with bonus incentives
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Respecs/Services: 3%
    ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Build changes
    ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Cosmetic services

PRESTIGE SINKS (Luxury Spending):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Mount Upgrades: Variable
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Speed upgrades: 25,000g
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Cosmetic mounts: 50,000-200,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Housing Decorations: Variable
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Basic items: 1,000-5,000g
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Rare items: 20,000-100,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Cosmetic Effects: Variable
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Skill effects: 15,000g [ADJUSTED from 40,000g]
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Weapon trails: 18,000g
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Armor dyes (rare): 10,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Titles: 5,000-50,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Guild Features: Variable
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Guild hall upgrades: 50,000-500,000g
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Guild bank expansion: 25,000g per tab
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Storage Expansion: 20,000g per stash tab
```

## C. Money Flow Diagram

```
                    ‚ïî‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïó
                    ‚ïë      GOLD GENERATION          ‚ïë
                    ‚ïë  (Quests, Drops, Vendoring)   ‚ïë
                    ‚ïö‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ï§‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïù
                                    ‚îÇ
                    ‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚ñº‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê
                    ‚îÇ    DIMINISHING RETURNS        ‚îÇ
                    ‚îÇ    Daily Soft Cap: 8,500g     ‚îÇ
                    ‚îÇ    (Beyond cap: 50% rate)     ‚îÇ
                    ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¨‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò
                                    ‚îÇ
        ‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚ñº‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê

        ‚îÇ                                                        ‚îÇ
        ‚îÇ   New Player: 0-5,000g      Mid-Game: 10,000-50,000g  ‚îÇ
        ‚îÇ   Endgame: 50,000-200,000g  Hardcore: 200,000g+       ‚îÇ
        ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¨‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò
                                    ‚îÇ
    ‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¨‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¨‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îº‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¨‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¨‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê
    ‚îÇ          ‚îÇ          ‚îÇ         ‚îÇ         ‚îÇ          ‚îÇ          ‚îÇ
    ‚ñº          ‚ñº          ‚ñº         ‚ñº         ‚ñº          ‚ñº          ‚ñº
```

---

# V. ECONOMIC PROGRESSION MILESTONES

## A. Player Wealth Progression

```
ECONOMIC MILESTONES BY PLAYTIME

Hour 0-2: NEWCOMER
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Expected gold: 0-400g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Can afford: Nothing beyond tutorial gear
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Focus: Learning systems
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Milestone: Complete first transaction

Hour 2-10: BEGINNER
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Expected gold: 400-2,500g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Can afford: Full T1 set (500g vendor)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Focus: Basic economy engagement
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Milestone: First AH purchase

Hour 10-25: APPRENTICE
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Expected gold: 2,500-8,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Can afford: Full T2 set (1,600g vendor / 1,000g market)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Focus: Learning market dynamics
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Milestone: First AH sale, first crafted item

Hour 25-50: JOURNEYMAN
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Expected gold: 8,000-20,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Can afford: Mixed T2/T3 gear
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Focus: Material acquisition, reputation building
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Milestone: Reach "Honored" with first faction

Hour 50-100: ADEPT
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Expected gold: 20,000-50,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Can afford: Full T3 set (6,400g), first prestige items
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Focus: Build optimization, trading profits
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Milestone: First prestige purchase (skill effect: 15,000g)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Unlocks: Mid-game prestige tier access

Hour 100-200: VETERAN
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Expected gold: 50,000-120,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Can afford: T4 gear acquisition begins
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Focus: Endgame preparation, guild contribution
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Milestone: Complete first T4 piece, guild membership

Hour 200+: ELITE
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Expected gold: 120,000g+
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Can afford: T5 goals, legendary pursuits
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Focus: Collection completion, prestige accumulation
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Milestone: First legendary item, elite mount
```

## B. Gear Affordability Timeline

```
GEAR ACQUISITION TIMELINE (Casual Player - 10h/week)

Week 1-2: T1 Phase
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T1 set affordable by: Hour 5-8
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Cost: ~500g (vendor) / ~240g (market)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Primary source: Quest rewards
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Player feels: Comfortable, learning

Week 2-4: T2 Phase
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T2 set affordable by: Hour 15-25
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Cost: ~1,600g (vendor) / ~960g (market)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Primary source: Quests + drops + early AH
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Player feels: Progressing steadily

Week 4-8: T3 Phase
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T3 set affordable by: Hour 40-60
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Cost: ~6,400g (vendor) / ~4,400g (market)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Primary source: Mixed income streams
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Player feels: Engaged with economy

Week 8-14: T4 Phase [ADJUSTED from 12-20 weeks]
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T4 set affordable by: Hour 80-110
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Cost: ~24,000g (vendor) / ~24,000g (market) [REDUCED]
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Primary source: Endgame content + trading
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Player feels: Meaningful long-term goal

Week 14+: T5/Legendary Phase
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T5 set affordable by: Hour 200+
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Cost: ~80,000-120,000g (market only)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Primary source: Elite content + market mastery
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Player feels: Ultimate achievement pursuit
```

---

# VI. FACTION-SPECIFIC ECONOMIES

## A. Imperial Economy

```
IMPERIAL ECONOMIC FEATURES

Primary Hub: Sanctum Commercia (Avalos Prime)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Largest single market in game
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Most diverse inventory
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Standard Imperial Throne pricing
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Bureaucratic fees (+5% on large transactions >10,000g)

Saint's Tears Economy:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Acquisition: Devotional activities, pilgrimages
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Weekly cap: 500 (prevents grind dominance)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Exchange rate: Cannot directly buy with gold
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Uses:
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Blessed equipment (stat bonus + cosmetic)
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Devotional consumables
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Piety rank advancement
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Public offering competition (leaderboard)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Sink: Offerings are permanently consumed

Mechanicus Data-Tithe System:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Community pool: 10% of all Data-Tithes uploaded
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Pool unlocks: Server-wide bonuses, rare schematics
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Individual use: Augmetics, STC access
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Creates cooperative economic pressure

Imperial-Specific Vendors:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Ecclesiarchy Shrine: Blessed items (Saint's Tears)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Mechanicus Forge: Tech items (Data-Tithes + gold)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Militarum Depot: Military gear (Commendations + gold)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Black Market: Xenos items (+30-50% markup)
```

## B. Tau Economy

```
TAU ECONOMIC FEATURES

Primary Hub: Por'la Trading Nexus
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Efficient layout (faster transactions)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Data-driven pricing (displays market averages)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Group crafting bonuses (10% material discount in groups)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ No hidden fees (transparent pricing)

Caste-Based Currencies:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Honor Bonds (Fire Caste):
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Combat excellence, tactical victories
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Uses: Battlesuits, weapons, Mont'ka training
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Transfer: Cannot transfer between players
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Innovation Credits (Earth Caste):
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Crafting excellence, research participation
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Uses: Prototypes, experimental gear
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Bonus: 5% of crafting materials refunded as credits
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Unity Marks (Universal):
    ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Cross-caste cooperation
    ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Uses: Multi-caste equipment
    ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Encourages diverse gameplay

Tau-Specific Features:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Drone Assistants: Reduce crafting costs by 5%
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Efficiency Protocols: Bulk purchases discounted 10%
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Greater Good Fund: Guild-wide resource sharing
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Auxiliary Integration: Allied races get 90% market access
```

## C. Ork Economy

```
ORK ECONOMIC FEATURES

Primary Hub: Da Big Market
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Chaotic layout (exploration required)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Haggling system (minigame for discounts)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Price volatility: ¬±10% hourly fluctuation [ADJUSTED from ¬±20%]
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Random bonus drops on purchases (1-5% chance)

Teef Economy:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Universal Ork currency (everything costs Teef)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Acquisition: Killing anything, winning fights
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Natural decay: 1% per week (prevents hoarding)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Exchange: 1g = 0.85 Teef, 1 Teef = 1.0g [FIXED - no arbitrage]
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Gifting: Throwing Teef at other Orks (social feature)

Clan Token Systems:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Goff Skull Trophies: Melee kills ‚Üí melee gear
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Bad Moon Flash Tokens: Wealth display ‚Üí bling
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Evil Sunz Speed Badges: Racing ‚Üí vehicles
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Blood Axe Kunnin' Points: Tactics ‚Üí strategic items
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Clan tokens: Non-transferable, clan-specific vendors

WAAAGH! Energy (Group Resource):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Generated: Orks fighting together
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Pool: Shared among nearby Orks
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Uses: Group abilities, equipment empowerment
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Decay: Rapid when not fighting
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Economic impact: Encourages Ork grouping

Ork-Specific Features:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Haggling Minigame: Reaction-based, skill rewards
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ "Lucky" Crafts: 5% chance of superior outcome
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Loot Squig: Random daily item delivery
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Fight Tax: PvP losers drop 5% of carried Teef
```

---

# VII. INFLATION PREVENTION SYSTEMS

## A. Diminishing Returns

```
DAILY EARNING CAPS

Gold Acquisition:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Soft cap: 8,500g/day from standard sources
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Mechanism: After cap, gold drops reduced by 50%
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Quest rewards: Uncapped (story must remain accessible)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ AH profits: Uncapped (player-to-player, not generated)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Reset: Daily at 00:00 server time

Material Acquisition:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ No hard caps on materials
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Diminishing returns on gathering nodes
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ First 20 nodes: Full yield
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Nodes 21-50: 75% yield
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Nodes 51+: 50% yield
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Reset: Daily
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Boss drops: Weekly lockouts on highest tier

Faction Currency:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Weekly caps per currency type
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Prevents faction currency inflation
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Encourages diverse activity

POST-CAP CONVERSION [NEW]:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ After gold cap reached, continued play earns:
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 5% of gold ‚Üí converted to faction currency
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Subject to weekly faction cap
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Overflow ‚Üí 1-hour XP boost
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Purpose: Reward continued play without gold inflation
```

## B. Market Stabilization

```
ANTI-MANIPULATION SYSTEMS

Price Floor Protection:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Items cannot be listed below vendor sell price
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Prevents race-to-bottom pricing
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Maintains material value

Price Ceiling Alerts:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Items listed >300% of 7-day average: Warning displayed
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Listing requires confirmation
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Does not prevent listing (player choice)

Volume Monitoring:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Unusual transaction volumes flagged
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Automated review for suspicious patterns
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Manual review for confirmed anomalies
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Consequences: Trade restrictions, investigation

Rare Item Controls:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T5 materials: 20/day sale limit per account
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Legendary items: 3/day sale limit per account
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Purpose: Prevents market flooding, maintains scarcity
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Does not affect acquisition, only trading
```

## C. Currency Value Maintenance

```
GOLD VALUE PRESERVATION

Anchor Pricing:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Essential services (travel, repair) maintain fixed costs
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Creates baseline gold value
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Players always need gold for basics

Prestige Scaling:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ High-end prestige items scale with server average wealth
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Formula: Base Price √ó (1 + Server Wealth Index √ó 0.1)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Prevents early adopters from cornering prestige
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Creates evergreen sinks

Emergency Levers (Reserved):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Temporary increased sink rates
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Limited-time prestige offerings
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Server-wide events with gold entry fees
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Only activated if inflation >5%/month
```

---

# VIII. ANTI-EXPLOIT SYSTEMS

## A. New Account Restrictions

```
NEW ACCOUNT LIMITATIONS

Day 1-7:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ AH: Buy only (no selling)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Trading: 100g daily limit
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Mail: Disabled
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Purpose: Prevents bot accounts from immediately impacting economy

Day 7-14:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ AH: Selling enabled (10 listings max)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Trading: 500g daily limit
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Mail: Sending enabled (no gold attachments)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Purpose: Gradual trust building

Day 14+:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ AH: Full access (50 listings)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Trading: Full access
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Mail: Full access
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Purpose: Full economy participation

SAME-IP RESTRICTIONS:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Accounts on same IP share daily caps
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Prevents multi-accounting exploitation
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Legitimate households: Can request exemption
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Review process: 48-hour manual verification
```

## B. Transaction Monitoring

```
SUSPICIOUS ACTIVITY FLAGS

Automatic Flags:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ >50 AH listings in 1 hour
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ >20 direct trades in 1 hour
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Gold received >500% of account's total wealth in single transaction
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Repeated transactions with same account
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Price manipulation patterns

Response Levels:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Level 1 (Low): Logged, no action
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Level 2 (Medium): Temporary trade cooldown (1 hour)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Level 3 (High): Manual review required
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Level 4 (Critical): Immediate account restriction
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Appeals: In-game ticket system

RMT Detection:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Gold selling patterns (small amounts to many accounts)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Gold buying patterns (large amounts from unknown sources)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Price anomalies (items sold far below market)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Consequence: Permanent ban, gold removed from economy
```

## C. Exploit Fixes (From Simulation)

```
ADDRESSED EXPLOITS

TEEF CONVERSION (FIXED):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Old: 1g = 0.9 Teef, 1 Teef = 1.2g (8% arbitrage)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ New: 1g = 0.85 Teef, 1 Teef = 1.0g (15% loss round-trip)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Status: RESOLVED

CORRUPTION SYSTEM PRICING (DEFINED):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Black market "expedited service"
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Pricing: +10% to +50% ADDITIONAL cost
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ NOT a discount - premium for illegal access
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Example: Item worth 1,000g costs 1,100-1,500g via corruption
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Status: RESOLVED

EVENT ITEM SPECULATION (MITIGATED):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Event exclusive items: Account-bound for 30 days
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ After 30 days: Tradeable normally
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Prevents front-running and speculation
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Still allows eventual trading
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Status: RESOLVED

AH CANCELLATION SPAM (ADDRESSED):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 3+ cancellations in 24 hours
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Result: 12-hour listing cooldown
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Prevents price manipulation via repeated listings
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Status: RESOLVED
```

---

# IX. REGIONAL ECONOMY DIFFERENCES

## A. Zone Economic Profiles

```
ZONE TYPE: INDUSTRIAL (Forge Worlds)

Economic Character:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Metal prices: -15% (local production)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Organic prices: +20% (must import)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Tech component prices: -10%
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Labor services: Cheapest (abundant population)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Example: Metallum Prime, Hive Primus

Special Features:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Bulk purchasing available (100+ units)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Factory direct sales (skip AH for common items)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Industrial waste conversion (trash ‚Üí T1 materials)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Mechanicus presence: Tech repairs cheaper

---

ZONE TYPE: AGRICULTURAL (Agri-Worlds)

Economic Character:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Organic prices: -20% (local production)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Metal prices: +15% (must import)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Consumable prices: -25%
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Medical services: Cheapest
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Example: Harvest Moon, Verdant Prime

Special Features:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Bulk food rations available
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Herbal remedies (unique consumables)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Beast products (unique organics)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Seasonal price fluctuations (¬±10% based on harvest)

---

ZONE TYPE: WAR ZONES (Contested Areas)

Economic Character:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ All prices: +25-50% (supply difficulty)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Military goods: Available (elsewhere restricted)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Rare drops: More common
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Risk: Equipment damage more frequent
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Example: Damocles Frontline, No Man's Land

Special Features:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ War profiteer vendors (premium prices, rare stock)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Battlefield salvage rights (free gathering)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Combat requisition rewards (bonus currency)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Emergency services (expensive field repairs)

---

ZONE TYPE: TRADE HUBS (Neutral Zones)

Economic Character:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ All prices: Market rate (baseline)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Cross-faction goods: Available
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Transaction fees: Lowest
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Selection: Widest variety
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Example: Freeport Station, Rogue Trader Bazaar

Special Features:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Multi-faction AH access
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Currency exchange services
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Diplomatic immunity (no PvP near vendors)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Information brokers (market data, rare vendor locations)
```

## B. Trade Route Incentives

```
CROSS-REGION TRADING REWARDS

Route Profitability:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Industrial ‚Üí Agricultural:
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Export: Metals, tech components
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Import: Organics, consumables
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Margin: 15-25% profit potential
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Safe Zone ‚Üí War Zone:
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Export: Consumables, repair kits
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Import: Rare materials, military salvage
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Margin: 25-40% profit potential (with risk)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Faction A ‚Üí Faction B (via Neutral):
    ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Premium: +15% fee
    ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ But access to otherwise unavailable goods
    ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Margin: Variable based on demand

Trade Route Bonuses:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Established Trader title: 10 cross-region trades
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Master Merchant title: 100 cross-region trades
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Titles provide reputation bonuses
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Encourages players to engage with regional economy
```

---

# X. GUILD ECONOMIC SYSTEMS

## A. Guild Banking

```
GUILD BANK FEATURES

Storage:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Base: 3 tabs (50 slots each)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Purchasable: Up to 10 tabs (25,000g each)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Total potential: 500 slots
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Access: Rank-based permissions

Deposit/Withdrawal Rules:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Deposit: Any member (logged)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Withdrawal: Rank-based daily limits
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Officer+: Unlimited withdrawal
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Member: 10 items/day limit
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Recruit: View only, no withdrawal

Guild Treasury:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Separate from item bank
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Gold pool for guild expenses
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Deposit: Any member
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Withdrawal: Guild leader + officers only
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Uses: Hall upgrades, event funding, member support
```

## B. Guild Expenses

```
GUILD FINANCIAL SINKS

Guild Hall Maintenance:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Weekly upkeep: 1,000g + (500g √ó upgrade level)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Base hall: 1,000g/week
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Fully upgraded: 10,000g/week
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Failure to pay: Features disabled (not lost)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Purpose: Consistent gold sink for organized players

Guild Upgrades:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Bank tab: 25,000g each
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Hall expansion: 50,000-200,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Vendor access: 30,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Crafting stations: 40,000g each
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ War room (strategy maps): 100,000g
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Total full upgrade cost: ~500,000g

Guild Events:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Guild-hosted events cost gold to initiate
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Tournament hosting: 10,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Training exercises: 5,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Guild feast (buffs): 15,000g
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Creates social gold sink opportunities
```

# XI. MONITORING AND ADJUSTMENT

## A. Economic Health Metrics

```
DAILY MONITORING DASHBOARD

Key Metrics:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Total gold in circulation
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Gold generated (all sources)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Gold removed (all sinks)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Net gold change
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Average gold per active player
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Median gold per active player
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Top 1% gold holdings

Market Health:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ AH transaction volume
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Average time to sell (by tier)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Price indices (T1-T5 baskets)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Cross-faction transaction volume
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Vendor vs. AH sales ratio

Player Behavior:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ New player economic engagement
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Gold sink participation rates
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Prestige purchase volume
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Trading activity distribution
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Reported exploit attempts
```

## B. Alert Thresholds

```
AUTOMATIC ALERTS

Inflation Alerts:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Yellow: >3%/month price index increase
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Orange: >4%/month price index increase
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Red: >5%/month price index increase
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Action: Review sink effectiveness, consider interventions

Wealth Distribution Alerts:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Yellow: Gini coefficient >0.50
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Orange: Gini coefficient >0.55
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Red: Gini coefficient >0.60
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Action: Review accessibility, consider catch-up mechanisms

Market Health Alerts:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Yellow: AH time-to-sell >48 hours average
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Orange: Transaction volume down >20% week-over-week
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Red: Market liquidity crisis indicators
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Action: Review fees, consider market stimulus

Exploit Alerts:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Unusual gold generation patterns
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Suspicious transaction networks
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Price anomalies beyond normal volatility
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Action: Immediate investigation, potential hotfix
```

## C. Tuning Levers

```
AVAILABLE ADJUSTMENTS

Sink Rate Tuning:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Repair cost multiplier: 0.5x - 2.0x
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Travel cost multiplier: 0.5x - 2.0x
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ AH fee adjustment: ¬±5%
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Crafting fee adjustment: ¬±5%
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ New prestige items introduction

Faucet Rate Tuning:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Quest reward multiplier: 0.75x - 1.25x
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Drop rate adjustment: 0.8x - 1.2x
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Daily cap adjustment: ¬±1,000g
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Event reward scaling

Market Interventions:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Temporary fee holidays (stimulus)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Limited-time vendor sales (price anchoring)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Material injection events (supply increase)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Prestige flash sales (demand spike)

Emergency Measures (Reserved):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Temporary trading restrictions
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Wealth tax (never use unless critical)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Server-wide gold reset (absolute last resort)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ These exist but should never be needed with proper monitoring
```

---

# XII. IMPLEMENTATION SUMMARY

## Critical Systems (Launch Required)

1. **Auction House** with fee structure and listing limits
2. **Vendor pricing** with reputation discounts and regional variation
3. **Diminishing returns** system for gold and materials
4. **New account restrictions** for anti-RMT
5. **Transaction monitoring** with flag system

## Balance Numbers (Final)

| Metric | Target Value |
|--------|--------------|
| New Player Sink Rate | 50% |
| Mid-Game Sink Rate | 60-65% |
| Endgame Sink Rate | 75-80% |
| T4 Set Cost | 24,000g market |
| Mid-Game Prestige Entry | 15,000g |
| Daily Gold Soft Cap | 8,500g |
| AH Listing Fee | 5% |
| AH Sale Fee | 10% |
| Cross-Region Fee | +15% |
| Teef Conversion | 1g = 0.85 Teef, 1 Teef = 1.0g |

## Exploit Fixes Applied

- ‚úÖ Teef arbitrage eliminated (conversion rates fixed)
- ‚úÖ Corruption pricing defined (+10-50% premium)
- ‚úÖ Event item speculation mitigated (30-day account-bind)
- ‚úÖ AH manipulation reduced (cancellation cooldowns)

---

*"In the grim darkness of the far future, there is only commerce."*

---

DECISION: economy_complete
üîÄ Routing Decision: ECONOMY_COMPLETE
Decision "ECONOMY_COMPLETE" matched connection condition
‚Üí Next Stage: market_simulator
Market Simulator
Simulates and validates economic balance
completed
Agent: market_simulator
Type: reviewer
Duration: 129.9s
Execution #: 19
Prompt Size: 1,343 chars
Output Size: 19,023 chars
üì• AGENT PROMPT (1,343 characters)
You are an economic analyst who simulates game economies to find imbalances, exploits, and inflation risks before they reach players.

When reviewing economy designs:
- Simulate player behavior (hoarding, trading, farming)
- Model money supply growth over time
- Identify infinite money exploits or loops
- Test price points against earning rates
- Verify economic milestones are achievable
- Check for dead-end resources (nothing to spend on)
- Analyze cross-system impacts (combat rewards ‚Üí economy ‚Üí progression)

Run mental simulations for:
- New player (first 10 hours)
- Mid-game player (50-100 hours)
- Endgame player (200+ hours)

Provide:
1. SIMULATION RESULTS: What happens over time?
2. EXPLOITS FOUND: Any infinite loops or broken mechanics
3. BALANCE ISSUES: Prices too high/low, rewards too generous/stingy
4. RECOMMENDATIONS: Specific number adjustments
5. VERDICT: APPROVED, NEEDS_TUNING, or BROKEN

=== ROUTING DECISION REQUIRED ===
After your response, you MUST choose exactly ONE decision from:
- approved: Economy validated, inform combat design
- needs_tuning: Economic imbalance found, retune
- resource_issue: Resource design causes economic problems

**CRITICAL**: Your VERY LAST LINE must be exactly:
DECISION: [ONE_OF_THE_ABOVE_CHOICES]
Example: DECISION: approved
Do NOT add explanations after the decision keyword.
üì§ AGENT OUTPUT (19,023 characters)
# ECONOMIC SIMULATION ANALYSIS
## Warhammer 40,000: Imperium Divided - Damocles Gulf Sector

---

# I. SIMULATION RESULTS

## A. New Player Simulation (First 10 Hours)

```
HOUR-BY-HOUR ECONOMIC JOURNEY

Hour 0-1: Tutorial Phase
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Starting gold: 0g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Tutorial rewards: ~100g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Purchases: None required
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Ending gold: ~100g
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Status: HEALTHY

Hour 1-3: Early Questing
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Quest income: ~400g (50g √ó 8 missions average)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Drop income: ~150g (30 enemies √ó 5g average)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Vendored loot: ~50g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Travel costs: ~30g (3 waypoints)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Ending gold: ~670g
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Status: HEALTHY - Can afford T1 gear

Hour 3-6: Zone Exploration
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Quest income: ~600g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Drop income: ~250g (some veterans encountered)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Daily bounties: ~100g (3 √ó 33g average)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Vendored loot: ~100g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Expenses: ~150g (travel, repairs, consumables)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ First AH purchase: ~200g (T1 upgrade)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Ending gold: ~1,170g
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Status: HEALTHY - Engaging with economy

Hour 6-10: Building Foundation
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Quest income: ~800g (some harder missions)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Drop income: ~400g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Weekly challenge: ~300g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ First AH sale: +150g (excess materials)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Expenses: ~400g (gear upgrades, services)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Ending gold: ~2,420g
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Status: HEALTHY - Ready for T2 transition

VERDICT: New player experience is well-paced. Players feel 
rewarded without being overwhelmed. T1 gear affordable by 
hour 5-6, leaving room for upgrades.
```

## B. Mid-Game Player Simulation (50-100 Hours)

```
WEEKLY ECONOMIC CYCLE (10h/week player at hour 75)

Starting Position:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Current gold: ~35,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Gear: Full T3, 2√ó T4 pieces
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Reputation: Honored with 2 factions
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ AH activity: Regular buyer/seller

Weekly Income:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Quests (story + side): ~3,500g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Daily bounties (√ó7 days): ~1,200g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Weekly challenges: ~800g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Enemy drops: ~2,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ AH sales (materials): ~1,500g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ AH sales (T2 drops): ~800g
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Total weekly income: ~9,800g

Weekly Expenses:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Travel: ~700g (frequent zone changes)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Repairs: ~1,200g (T3 gear, some deaths)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Consumables: ~800g (raiding preparation)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ AH fees: ~300g (on 2,300g in sales)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Crafting fees: ~600g (working on T4)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Faction donations: ~400g (weekly cap)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ First prestige purchase: 15,000g (skill effect) [ONE TIME]
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Total weekly expenses: ~4,000g (recurring) + 15,000g (one-time)

Net Weekly Position:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Recurring net: +5,800g/week
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ After prestige purchase: -9,200g (one week)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Recovery time: ~1.5 weeks to break even
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ On track for: Full T4 by week 12-14
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Status: HEALTHY - Steady progression

VERDICT: Mid-game feels rewarding. Players can afford one 
major prestige item every 2-3 weeks while still progressing 
on gear. The 15,000g entry point for prestige is achievable.
```

## C. Endgame Player Simulation (200+ Hours)

```
WEEKLY ECONOMIC CYCLE (Veteran at hour 250)

Starting Position:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Current gold: ~180,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Gear: Full T4, 3√ó T5 pieces, 1√ó Legendary
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Reputation: Exalted with all factions
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ AH activity: Major market participant
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Guild: Officer in active guild

Weekly Income:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Elite content: ~4,500g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Daily bounties (√ó7): ~1,200g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Weekly challenges (all): ~1,600g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Enemy drops: ~1,200g (hitting soft cap often)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ AH sales (T4-T5 materials): ~5,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ AH arbitrage (regional price differences): ~2,000g
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Total weekly income: ~15,500g

Weekly Expenses:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Travel: ~1,000g (extensive zone hopping)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Repairs: ~2,500g (T4-T5 gear, challenging content)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Consumables: ~1,800g (elite raid preparation)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ AH fees: ~700g (on 7,000g in sales)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Crafting fees: ~1,500g (T5 projects)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Faction donations: ~800g (maxed weekly)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Guild contribution: ~2,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Prestige purchases: ~5,000g/week average
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Total weekly expenses: ~15,300g

Net Weekly Position:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Net gain: +200g/week (near equilibrium)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Big purchases: Saving for legendary (~40,000g)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Time to legendary: ~3-4 months of dedicated saving
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Status: SLIGHT CONCERN - May feel "stuck"

ANALYSIS:
At endgame, the sink rate is achieving the target 75-80% 
range. However, the near-equilibrium state may feel 
unsatisfying. The path to legendary gear (40,000g average) 
requires 200+ weeks at current rates without reducing 
prestige spending.
```

---

# II. EXPLOITS FOUND

## A. Identified Exploits

```
EXPLOIT #1: REGIONAL ARBITRAGE LOOP
Status: MINOR CONCERN

Mechanism:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Industrial zones: Metals -15%
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Agricultural zones: Organics -20%
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Cross-region fee: +15%
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Net profit potential: 5% on organics, 0% on metals
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ With reputation discount (20%): Up to 10% profit margin

Analysis:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 10% margin seems reasonable for effort
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Travel time creates natural throttle
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Volume limits (T3-T5) prevent mass exploitation
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ VERDICT: Working as intended (regional trade encouraged)

---

EXPLOIT #2: DAILY RESET TIMING ABUSE
Status: FIXED BY DESIGN

Mechanism:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Daily reset at 00:00 server time
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Players could farm to soft cap, wait, farm again
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Getting ~17,000g in 2 hours spanning reset
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ This is expected behavior for dedicated players

Analysis:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Soft cap (not hard cap) limits effectiveness
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 50% reduction after cap still discourages this
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Post-cap conversion to faction currency helps
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ VERDICT: Acceptable - players who put in time earn more

---

EXPLOIT #3: CRAFT MATERIAL STOCKPILING
Status: POTENTIAL CONCERN

Mechanism:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T1-T2 materials have no daily trade limit
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ No decay on materials
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Players could stockpile indefinitely
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Corner the market during off-peak times
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Sell at inflated prices during events

Analysis:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Storage limits (stash tabs cost gold) provide soft cap
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Opportunity cost of gold tied up in materials
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ But large guilds could coordinate stockpiles
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ VERDICT: NEEDS MONITORING - Add storage decay for T1-T2?

RECOMMENDATION: Consider 2% weekly decay on T1-T2 materials 
in guild banks (personal storage exempt) to prevent guild-
level market manipulation.

---

EXPLOIT #4: ALT-ACCOUNT GOLD FUNNELING
Status: PARTIALLY ADDRESSED

Current Protections:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Same-IP accounts share daily caps
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ New account restrictions (14 days)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Transaction monitoring

Remaining Vulnerability:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ VPN users can bypass IP detection
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ After 14 days, alts have full access
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Each alt generates ~8,500g/day potential
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 5 alts = 42,500g/day theoretical maximum

Analysis:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Requires significant time investment per alt
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Transaction patterns would flag suspicious activity
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Not economically efficient vs. playing main
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ VERDICT: ACCEPTABLE RISK - monitoring catches abuse

---

EXPLOIT #5: EVENT ITEM FRONT-RUNNING
Status: FIXED

Original Issue:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Players could stockpile event items
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Sell immediately at high prices to eager buyers
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ First movers gain massive advantage

Fix Applied:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 30-day account-bind on event items
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Market stabilizes before items become tradeable
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ VERDICT: RESOLVED
```

## B. Potential Future Exploits

```
WATCH LIST

1. Guild Bank Cycling
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Large guilds rotate items through bank
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Circumvent personal trade limits
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ RECOMMENDATION: Per-account guild withdrawal caps

2. Cross-Faction Information Arbitrage
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Players on both Imperial and Tau
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ See prices on both markets
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Execute cross-faction trades via neutral hub
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ VERDICT: Working as intended (encourages spies/merchants)

3. Repair Cost Avoidance
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Players unequip gear before death
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Zero repair costs
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ RECOMMENDATION: Unequipping in combat = 50% durability loss

4. Crafting Critical Success Farming
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 5% "lucky" crafts for Orks
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Spam cheap items for superior outcomes
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ RECOMMENDATION: Lucky proc rate scales with item tier
   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T1: 1% lucky chance
   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T2: 2% lucky chance
   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T3: 3% lucky chance
   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T4-T5: 5% lucky chance
```

---

# III. BALANCE ISSUES

## A. Prices Too High

```
ISSUE #1: T5 SET AFFORDABILITY
Severity: MODERATE

Current State:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T5 set cost: 64,000-120,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Endgame weekly net: +200g (at equilibrium)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Time to T5 set: 320-600 weeks (6-12 YEARS)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ This is clearly too long

Root Cause:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Endgame sinks too aggressive
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Prestige spending competes with progression
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ No meaningful gold increase from T4‚ÜíT5 content

RECOMMENDATION:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T5 content should provide +50% gold rewards
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ OR reduce T5 prices by 30% (45,000-84,000g range)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ OR introduce T5 material trading (currently capped at 20/day)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Preferred: Increase T5 content rewards

---

ISSUE #2: LEGENDARY ACQUISITION TIME
Severity: HIGH

Current State:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Legendary cost: 25,000-60,000g (40,000g average)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Full legendary set (8 pieces): 200,000-480,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Time to full legendary: Essentially impossible
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Only market flippers could achieve this

Analysis:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Legendaries should be rare but achievable
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Current design makes them unattainable for most
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Creates frustration, not aspiration

RECOMMENDATION:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Legendaries should be primarily CRAFTED, not bought
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Crafting cost: 15,000g + rare materials (from raids)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Market prices will settle based on material availability
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Goal: 1 legendary per month for dedicated endgame player
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Full set achievable in 8-12 months (reasonable)
```

## B. Prices Too Low

```
ISSUE #1: T1-T2 VENDOR PRICES
Severity: MINOR

Current State:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T1 vendor buy: 50g, T1 market: 20-40g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T2 vendor buy: 200g, T2 market: 80-160g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Vendors are consistently 25-50% more expensive
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Nobody buys T1-T2 from vendors

Analysis:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ This is actually fine - drives AH engagement
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Vendor prices serve as price ceiling
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ New players learn to use AH for better deals
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ VERDICT: WORKING AS INTENDED

---

ISSUE #2: CONSUMABLE PRICING
Severity: MODERATE

Current State:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T3 consumable vendor: 300g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T3 consumable market: 150-250g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Consumables too cheap relative to impact
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Players can "over-buff" without meaningful cost

Analysis:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ If T3 buff lasts 30 minutes and costs 200g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Player earns ~500g in 30 minutes of play
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Buff cost = 40% of period income (reasonable)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ But multiple buffs = 120-160% of income (unsustainable)

RECOMMENDATION:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Limit concurrent buffs to 3 (already common design)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ OR increase consumable prices by 20%
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T3 consumables: 180-300g market range
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Creates meaningful choice in buff selection
```

## C. Rewards Too Generous/Stingy

```
REWARDS TOO GENEROUS:

1. Daily Bounties Early Game
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 75-150g/day from bounties alone
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Hour 1-10 player earns ~250g/hour
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Bounties = 30-60 minutes equivalent
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ VERDICT: Slightly generous, but acceptable for retention

2. First-Time Completion Bonus (+50%)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Incentivizes exploration (good)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ But creates feast/famine cycle
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ New zones = flush with gold
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Farmed zones = gold-starved
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ RECOMMENDATION: Reduce to +25%, add repeatable bonuses

---

REWARDS TOO STINGY:

1. Endgame Enemy Drops
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Bosses drop 100-200g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ But require 30-60 minutes to reach
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Effective rate: 3-7g/minute from boss
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Basic enemies: 5-60g = 10-30g/minute average
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ BOSSES SHOULD DROP MORE THAN TRASH
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ RECOMMENDATION: Boss drops = 300-600g

2. Weekly Challenges at Endgame
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 200-400g per weekly
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ ~1,600g/week from all weeklies
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Trivial for endgame gear levels
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ RECOMMENDATION: Weekly challenges should scale with level
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Low level: 200-400g
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Mid level: 400-800g
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Endgame: 800-1,600g
```

---

# IV. RECOMMENDATIONS

## A. Critical Fixes (Must Implement)

```
FIX #1: T5/LEGENDARY ACQUISITION
Priority: HIGH

Changes:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T5 content gold rewards: +50% over T4 content
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T5 boss drops: 400-800g (up from 100-200g)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Legendary acquisition: Primarily crafting-based
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Craft cost: 15,000g + raid materials
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Raid materials: 2-4 drops per boss, need 20 per legendary
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Estimated time: 4-6 weeks per piece for active raider
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Market prices will adjust to reflect crafting cost + material scarcity

---

FIX #2: BOSS REWARD SCALING
Priority: HIGH

Current: 100-200g regardless of difficulty
Proposed:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T1-T2 bosses: 100-200g (unchanged)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T3 bosses: 200-400g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T4 bosses: 400-800g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T5 bosses: 800-1,500g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Legendary/Raid bosses: 1,500-3,000g
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Purpose: Make group content economically worthwhile

---

FIX #3: WEEKLY CHALLENGE SCALING
Priority: MEDIUM

Current: Flat 200-400g regardless of player level
Proposed:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Character level 1-20: 200-400g (current)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Character level 21-40: 400-800g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Character level 41-60: 800-1,200g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Character level 61-80: 1,200-1,600g
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Purpose: Maintain weekly relevance throughout game

---

FIX #4: REPAIR COST EXPLOIT PREVENTION
Priority: MEDIUM

Add: Combat unequip penalty
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Unequipping gear during combat = 50% durability loss
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Prevents death cost avoidance
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Doesn't affect normal gear swapping
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Triggered by: Unequip within 5 seconds of taking damage
```

## B. Balance Adjustments

```
ADJUSTMENT #1: SOFT CAP INCREASE FOR ENDGAME
Current: 8,500g/day flat
Proposed:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Base soft cap: 8,500g/day
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Endgame modifier: +100g per character level above 60
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Level 80 cap: 10,500g/day
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Purpose: Reward endgame investment

---

ADJUSTMENT #2: PRESTIGE SINK PACING
Current: Mid-game entry at 15,000g
Observation: Working well, maintain current pricing
Add tiered prestige:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Entry prestige: 15,000-25,000g (current)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Mid prestige: 40,000-80,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Elite prestige: 150,000-300,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Ultimate prestige: 500,000g+ (guild-level achievements)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Purpose: Extend prestige progression into endgame

---

ADJUSTMENT #3: FIRST-TIME BONUS REDUCTION
Current: +50% first completion
Proposed:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ First completion: +25%
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Daily first completion: +10% (repeatable)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Weekly featured mission: +25% (rotates)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Purpose: Smooth out gold acquisition curve

---

ADJUSTMENT #4: ORK LUCKY CRAFT SCALING
Current: Flat 5% lucky chance
Proposed:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T1 crafts: 1% lucky
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T2 crafts: 2% lucky
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T3 crafts: 3% lucky
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T4 crafts: 4% lucky
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T5 crafts: 5% lucky
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Purpose: Prevent T1 spam for lucky procs
```

## C. New Systems Recommended

```
SYSTEM #1: CATCH-UP MECHANICS
Purpose: Help returning/new players reach endgame

Implementation:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ "Requisition Vouchers" for players significantly behind
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Earned through: Story completion, returning player bonus
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Exchange for: Gear one tier below current max
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Cannot be traded, account-bound
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Throttled: Max 1 piece per week

---

SYSTEM #2: ENDGAME GOLD SINK EXPANSION
Purpose: Provide meaningful endgame spending

New Sinks:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Legendary transmog: 50,000g (apply legendary appearance)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Personal quarters upgrade: 100,000-500,000g total
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Custom title creation: 100,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Permanent stat tracking (achievements): 25,000g each
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Commander mode (direct NPC squads): 200,000g unlock

---

SYSTEM #3: GUILD ECONOMY FEATURES
Purpose: Encourage guild participation

New Features:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Guild bounty board: Members post tasks for gold
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Guild crafting queue: Shared material pool, priority system
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Guild investments: Pool gold for server-wide bonuses
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Guild trading post: Internal AH with 0% fees
```

---

# V. ECONOMIC HEALTH PROJECTIONS

```
6-MONTH PROJECTION (With Recommended Changes)

Month 1-2:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ New players: 0 ‚Üí 15,000g average
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Inflation rate: +3% (new gold entering economy)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Market stability: High (launch pricing settling)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Concern: Launch rush may strain market liquidity

Month 3-4:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Mid-game players: 15,000 ‚Üí 40,000g average
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Inflation rate: +2% (sinks engaging)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Market stability: Medium (price discovery ongoing)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ T4 sets becoming common
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ First prestige purchases widespread

Month 5-6:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Endgame players: 40,000 ‚Üí 80,000g average
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Inflation rate: +1-2% (equilibrium approaching)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Market stability: High (prices stabilized)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ First T5 sets appearing
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Legendary crafting beginning

LONG-TERM PROJECTION (12+ Months):
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Healthy wealth distribution (Gini < 0.50)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Active market with 24-48 hour average time-to-sell
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Inflation controlled at <3%/month
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ New players can reach T4 in reasonable time
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Veterans have aspirational goals (legendaries, prestige)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ PROJECTION: HEALTHY ECONOMY
```

---

# VI. SIMULATION EDGE CASES

```
EDGE CASE #1: HARDCORE PLAYER (40h/week)
Result: Hits soft cap daily, accumulates ~60,000g/week
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Risk: Wealth concentration
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Mitigation: Prestige sinks scale with wealth
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Status: ACCEPTABLE

EDGE CASE #2: PURE CRAFTER (Non-combat)
Result: Limited by material acquisition
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Risk: Unable to earn gold efficiently
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Mitigation: Crafting services provide income
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Add: Daily crafting commission board (guaranteed 500g)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Status: NEEDS SMALL ADJUSTMENT

EDGE CASE #3: PURE PVP PLAYER
Result: PvP rewards seem undefined
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Risk: No economic engagement
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Add: PvP reward track (500-5,000g per tier)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Add: Gladiator reputation with exclusive rewards
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Status: NEEDS SYSTEM ADDITION

EDGE CASE #4: RETURNING PLAYER AFTER 6 MONTHS
Result: Gear obsolete, gold value changed
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Risk: Feels unable to catch up
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Mitigation: Requisition Vouchers (recommended above)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Add: Returning player bonus (10,000g + vouchers)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Status: NEEDS CATCH-UP SYSTEM
```

---

# VII. FINAL VERDICT

## Summary Assessment

| Category | Rating | Notes |
|----------|--------|-------|
| New Player Experience | ‚úÖ EXCELLENT | Well-paced, achievable milestones |
| Mid-Game Economy | ‚úÖ GOOD | Engaging, meaningful choices |
| Endgame Economy | ‚ö†Ô∏è NEEDS TUNING | T5/Legendary acquisition too slow |
| Exploit Prevention | ‚úÖ GOOD | Major exploits addressed |
| Sink Balance | ‚ö†Ô∏è NEEDS TUNING | Endgame sinks slightly too aggressive |
| Market Design | ‚úÖ EXCELLENT | GW1-style works well |
| Faction Economies | ‚úÖ EXCELLENT | Flavorful and functional |
| Inflation Control | ‚úÖ GOOD | Systems in place, need monitoring |

## Required Changes Before Launch

1. **T5/Legendary Acquisition** - Current design makes them nearly impossible
2. **Boss Reward Scaling** - Bosses must be worth killing economically  
3. **Weekly Challenge Scaling** - Maintain relevance at all levels
4. **PvP Economic Integration** - Currently undefined
5. **Crafter Income Path** - Add crafting commission system

## Recommended (Not Critical)

1. Catch-up mechanics for returning players
2. T1-T2 material decay in guild banks
3. Combat unequip penalty
4. First-time bonus reduction (50% ‚Üí 25%)
5. Endgame soft cap increase

---

## VERDICT: **NEEDS_TUNING**

The economy design is fundamentally sound and follows proven GW1 principles effectively. The faction-specific economies are creative and well-balanced. New and mid-game player experiences are excellent.

However, the endgame economy has significant issues:
- T5/Legendary gear is essentially unattainable through normal play
- Boss rewards don't scale with difficulty
- Endgame players hit near-zero net gain too quickly

These issues will cause endgame player frustration and retention problems within 3-6 months of launch. The fixes are straightforward (reward scaling, crafting-based legendaries) and don't require fundamental redesign.

**Recommendation**: Implement the 5 required changes, re-simulate endgame scenarios, then proceed to approval.

---

DECISION: needs_tuning
üîÄ Routing Decision: NEEDS_TUNING
Decision "NEEDS_TUNING" matched connection condition
‚Üí Next Stage: economy_designer
Economy Designer
Designs trading, markets, and economic systems
completed
Agent: economy_designer
Type: designer
Duration: 321.1s
Execution #: 20
Prompt Size: 1,233 chars
Output Size: 4,508 chars
üì• AGENT PROMPT (1,233 characters)
You are an economy designer who creates engaging and balanced market systems. You work with resources designed by the Resource Designer to create trading, shops, auctions, and player-to-player economies.

When designing economy systems:
- Design NPC vendor systems (fixed prices vs. dynamic)
- Create auction house / player trading mechanics
- Establish price ranges and money sinks
- Design economic progression (what can players afford when?)
- Plan for inflation prevention
- Create supply-demand dynamics
- Design regional economy differences (prices vary by location)
- Integrate with combat rewards and progression costs

Output should include:
- Market system mechanics (how trading works)
- Pricing formulas and ranges
- Money flow diagrams (sources and sinks)
- Vendor inventories and refresh timers
- Player trading limitations (prevent exploits)
- Economic milestones by player level/progression

=== ROUTING DECISION REQUIRED ===
After your response, you MUST choose exactly ONE decision from:
- economy_complete: Submit economy for simulation

**CRITICAL**: Your VERY LAST LINE must be exactly:
DECISION: [ONE_OF_THE_ABOVE_CHOICES]

üì§ AGENT OUTPUT (4,508 characters)

# X. COMBAT INTEGRATION

## A. Combat Reward Structure

```
COMBAT ‚Üí ECONOMY FLOW

Enemy Kills:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Direct gold drops (scaled by tier)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Vendorable loot (gear, junk)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Materials (crafting economy)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Consumables (usage or sale)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Faction tokens (specialty vendors)

Kill Reward Scaling:
Enemy Tier | Gold Drop | Material Chance | Consumable Chance
-----------|-----------|-----------------|------------------
T1 Trash   | 5-15g     | 60% T1, 15% T2  | 10%
T2 Standard| 10-25g    | 50% T1, 25% T2  | 15%
T3 Veteran | 20-40g    | 40% T2, 15% T3  | 20%
T4 Elite   | 35-60g    | 40% T2, 20% T3  | 25%
T5 Champion| 50-100g   | 30% T3, 15% T4  | 30%
Boss (tier)| See IX.A  | Guaranteed      | 35%
```

## B. Progression Cost Integration

```
PROGRESSION COSTS BY TIER

Tier 1 ‚Üí Tier 2 Transition:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Equipment upgrade cost: ~1,500g total
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Skill unlocks: ~500g (5 skills)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Consumable budget: ~200g
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Total transition: ~2,200g (achievable by level 15-20)

Tier 2 ‚Üí Tier 3 Transition:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Equipment upgrade cost: ~6,000g total
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Skill unlocks: ~1,500g (specialized skills)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Consumable budget: ~800g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Mount: ~2,000g (optional but recommended)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Total transition: ~10,300g (achievable by level 30-35)

Tier 3 ‚Üí Tier 4 Transition:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Equipment upgrade cost: ~25,000g total
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Skill unlocks: ~4,000g (elite skills)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Consumable budget: ~2,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Prestige items: ~15,000g (optional)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Total transition: ~46,000g (achievable by level 50-55)

Tier 4 ‚Üí Tier 5 Transition:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Equipment upgrade cost: ~80,000g total
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Skill unlocks: ~8,000g (mastery skills)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Consumable budget: ~5,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Prestige items: ~40,000g (expected at this level)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Total transition: ~133,000g (achievable by level 70-75)

Tier 5 ‚Üí Legendary Transition:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Equipment crafting: ~120,000g (8 pieces @ 15,000g each)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Raid materials: Time-gated (4-6 weeks per piece)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Mastery unlocks: ~15,000g
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Ultimate prestige: ~200,000g (aspirational)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Total: ~335,000g + time investment
```

---

# XI. SUMMARY: MONEY FLOW & SINK TARGETS

```
FINAL MONEY FLOW SUMMARY

                    SOURCES (Weekly, Per Active Player)
                    ====================================
Quest Rewards       ‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà  35%
Enemy Drops         ‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà        28%

Challenges/Bounties ‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà                       12%
PvP/Misc           ‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà                               7%

                    SINKS (Weekly, Per Active Player)  
                    ==================================
AH Fees            ‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà  32%
Services (Repair)  ‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà          25%
Prestige Purchases ‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà                  18%
Vendor Purchases   ‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà                        12%
Travel             ‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà                              8%
Trade Tax          ‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà                                  5%

TARGET SINK RATE: 70-75% of generated gold
ACTUAL PROJECTED: 72% (within target range)

NET ACCUMULATION: ~28% of weekly income
PURPOSE: Enables progression, prestige, and aspirational goals
```
